loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pegi village. Ezekiel joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Ezekiel suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ezekiel will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ezekiel now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Uamusho Kawizi Group

texts.fr: Après avoir constaté que la culture du tomate est rentable grâce à l'expérience de nos parents, nous avons jugé bon de continuer cette activité, nous dit Migani. Il a pu réaliser au cours de la saison précédente un gain de cent quatre-vingt dollars après déduction de coût d'exploitation. Souvent limité par l'insuffisance de moyens financiers et les maladies de plantes, il souhaite élargir son espace cultural afin de capitaliser par une bonne production dont les revenus lui permettront de scolariser ses enfants et d'améliorer son niveau de vie. Président du groupe UWAMUSHO KAWIZI, sur photo MIGANI est l'homme un peu en retrait en deuxième position de gauche à droite.
texts.en:
Migani told us, "After realizing that growing tomatoes is profitable based on our parents' experience, we thought it would be a good idea to continue this work."

After taking into account farming costs, he was able to make a profit of $180 during the last growing season. Often limited by financial constraints and sick plants, he hopes to expand his farming land in order to be able to capitalize on good production. His profits will allow him to pay for his children's schooling and improve his standards of living. 

Migani is the president of the Uwamusho Kawizi Group. He is man second from the left, standing slightly in the back of the photo.

loans.use: to transplant, maintain, buy crop protection products and fertilizer

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dokantagwai Village. Suleiman joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Suleiman will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds, that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, which is double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will enable him to increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Suleiman now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm yields.

loans.name: Eutiquia

texts.en: Eutiquia is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children who are already adults Eutiquia earns a living through fishing with her husband for eleven years now. She usually earn PHP12000 per month. Eutiquia is asking for a loan to buy fishing weights, fishing nets and floaters. Eutiquia dreams of expanding her business in the future so that it will generate the revenue necessary for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy fishing weights, fishing nets and floaters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fishing net and new machine for their boat

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah 27 years old, is married and supports two children. She is in a business of selling second hand clothes earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Visionfund Kenya to buy more stock of second hand clothes for resale. 


She plans to use the gained profits to also venture into ready made clothes for more income. She hopes to be financially stable and improve family standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 38 years old. He is married with two children. His business is growing maize and beans and keeping goats and cows. He has been in this business for five years.

He earns a monthly income of nineteen thousand shillings. This is his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

He plans to use the profits to pay school fees for his children and expand the business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have an educated family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: K-Step Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is a forty-eight-year-old businesswoman and a member of K-Step Solidarity Group of five women. Fatmata sells rice in bags. She has been in this business for the past five years. She opens her business six days a week from 8 am to 6 pm.

Fatmata established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food from the profit she gets from her business. Fatmata is in the middle of the group picture.

Fatmata and her group members need a loan totaling 5,000,000 SLL of which Fatmata is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to buy five more bags of rice for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Fatmata is married and has four children with the ages of 20, 18, 16 and 14, of which one is schoolgoing.

In the future, Fatmata plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family. Fatmata will be very appreciative of anyone who can help.

loans.use: to buy five more bags of rice for her business.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as God fearing.

He operates a retail business, where he sells utensils and farm tools. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of good business premises.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of plates, flasks and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of plates, flasks and other items

loans.name: Nyaradzai

texts.en: Nyaradzai is a 26-year-old mother who resides in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a peer educator in her community and as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school. Nyaradzai also operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables. When she got her first Kiva loan she used her profits to diversify and so now she buys and sells ice cream and clothes in her community .She is paying school fees for her child whom she transferred to a better school. She is also able to pay rental bills in time and buy groceries for family. She desires to buy a housing plot and build her own house. She also wants to have a passport so that she will have the opportunity to buy goods cheaply outside the country.She desires to get a second loan with Kiva so that  she  can further expand  her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ice creams , clothes and jam.

loans.name: Coming Soon Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Isatu, who is 46 years old, was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people. She is married with four children. Her children are all school-going children.

Isatu belongs to a solidarity group of four women who have come together to complement each other achieve their individual dreams. “Coming Soon” is the name of Isatu’s solidarity group.

The “Coming Soon” group needs a total loan of 6,000,000SLL of which Isatu will receive 1,500,000SLL in order to purchase additional two bags of rice and one jerry can of palm oil for her business.

Isatu trades in rice and palm oil in one of the main market in the city centre of Freetown. Her business which has been in existence for over 12 years is the main source of her livelihood and that of her family; it also supports her children’s education. Her business is open Monday through Saturday every week from 7 am to 6 pm. Isatu is a hardworking woman. Isatu is on the left of the group picture.

In the future, Isatu plans to support her children to acquire a university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international businesswoman.

She will be very appreciative to anyone that can help. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase an additional two bags of rice and one jerry can of palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 35-year-old businesswoman and a divorced mother of one. She has been successfully running a stall at the local flea market selling clothing and accessories for two years now. When she is not working at the flea market she volunteers as a Community Health Trainer.

She used her first loan to make bulk purchases of shirts, skirts, dresses, jackets, petticoats, bras and bags to reduce transport costs and maximize profits. The profits are increasing and she also had managed to increase her stock. She is buying her stuff from South Africa and Botswana. Most of the stuff that she purchases are upon orders. She managed to use the profit to pay fees for her child, buy clothes for herself and her child, and joined women's clubs.

She desires to get a second loan so that she can further expand her business by purchasing a variety of clothes.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of shirts, skirts, dresses, jackets and bags.

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en:
Vuthy is ages 25 years old and a father of a small child who is under the school age. He is a rural rice farmer living in Battambang province. Fixing a motorbike to get a fee is an additional source of income to support his family’s living. Vuthy has been involved in his current business for five years and it earns him about 41,000KHR per day.

Due to having not enough working capital, he is now leading a group of two to take his first Kiva loan via VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. In a group of two, he is the group leader. He is willing to use his entire loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to grow his crops healthily and protect them from being destroyed by insects. He hopes that this loan will help him to earn more income and ability to upgrade his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to grow his crops healthily and protect them from being destroyed by insects.

loans.name: Parali Jlg-004 Group

texts.en:
Chitra is a 34-year-old who lives with her family of 5 in Tamil Nadu. She works as a daily wage labourer on agricultural fields. Her income from her current job is not sufficient and is also seasonal in nature. Thus, to switch to a more steady source of income, she wants to start her own millet products business.

She underwent training in making millet products under Gramalaya Microfin Foundation. She expects her income to go up considerably post the start of her business. Thus, she needs a loan to purchase raw materials to start her business. She is joined by 4 other women who seek funding to start their respective businesses. Your loan will help these women earn better and save more for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to start her millet products business.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Pegi Village. Iliya joined Babban Gona to improve the life of his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Iliya will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicide and improved seed that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income significantly. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Iliya now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Arsene

texts.en:
Arsene is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up on a small farm in rural Rwanda. Because of his exceptional academic record and test scores, he was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. 

Arsene plans to study Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduation, he would like to either start his own business or work at an NGO that focuses on health. At Kepler, Arsene hopes to gain the time management and critical thinking skills that he willl need to succeed in his career.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Delima

texts.en:
Fifty-three year old Delima sells fresh fish to the locals where she lives. She has six children. Her youngest child is 16. Her husband has also an income that could help meet the family's daily needs.
She lives in the town of Loon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fish vending business for 4 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy variety of fresh fish to re sell. These will attract more buyers and enables her to roll-out her capital. Thus, she could balance the flow of her finances and be able to pay her obligations slowly.

She is determined to improve her fish vending business to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy variety of fresh fish to re sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman who has one child. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her family's challenge to be lack of enough water. She will use the KEs 40,000 loan to buy a water tank to store enough water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 47 years old and married with six children. His business is operating a carpentry workshop and farming. He has been in this business for 26 years. He earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

This is his fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the loan to buy wood, nails, paint, bolts and other carpentry material. 

He will use the profits to meet family expenses and pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a good business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, paint, bolts and other carpentry material.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a married woman who has two children. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her family challenge to be lack of enough water. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a hair dressing school. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman with 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

Josphine will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, flour, soap, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, flour, soap, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el Caserío Sondor del distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Santos se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 12 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Santos espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 41 years old and lives with his spouse and children in their own home build of rustic materials in the Sondor community of the Pomahuaca district. This is located in the Jaén province, Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú. Life in the district is quiet and the residents work mainly in agriculture, trade and cattle raising.

Santos works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 12 years of experience in this trade and has very good personal and business references in the area. He will use the loan he will receive to purchase organic and chemical fertilizers to properly maintain his coffee plantation. He will also hire labor to help with the harvest season. This way, Santos hopes to offer a better quality coffee to his clients. This will have a positive impact on the income he receives and therefore will improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers to properly maintain his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Cry For Help Solidarity Group

texts.en:
This is forty-nine years old Memunatu, she is married and has six children.  Her children are all school going children.  Memunatu belongs to a solidarity group of three women, who have come together to complement each other achieve their individual dreams.  “Cry For Help” is the name of Memunatu’s solidarity group.    “Cry For Help” group needs a total loan of 3,000,000SLL.  Miatta will receive 1,000,000SLL which she needs in order to buy more 5 bags of rice for her business.
Memunatu established her rice business in 2005; she established the business to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs.  Memunatu uses profit from this business to provide livelihood for her family and support her children’s education.  She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week.  Memunatu is a hardworking women, she opens her business from 7 am to 6 pm.  See Memunatu (is in the middle of the group picture).
In the future, Memunatu plans to support her children to acquire University education.  She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman.  She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to buy 5 more bags of rice for her business.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina lives with her daughter in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Her husband and son are in the Russian Federation, where they do different constructionwork and send money for their family needs.

At the city’s wholesale market, Alina runs her trading business - sale of clothes for men and school-aged boys. She brings the merchandise for her stall from Yerevan city in a rented car with the help of her daughter. Alina mentions that she does her best to gain more customers with her fashionable and not expensive assortment of clothes.

Now with this loan amount of 700.000 Armenian drams Alina wants to buy new assortment of clothes for men and boys that will be for autumn season and also suitable for the school-aged boys for the new academic year.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothes for men and boys that will be for the autumn season

loans.name: See To My Strain Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is 37 years old and was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people.  She is married with two children.  Her children all go to school.  Fatmata started business to help her husband support their children. She belongs to a solidarity group of two men and two women who have come together to help each other achieve their individual dreams. The See to My Strain Solidarity Group needs a total loan of 6,000,000 SLL of which Fatmata will receive 1,500,000 SLL to purchase vegetable oil, soft drinks, pure water and bread flower to add to her business.
Fatmata trades in food and drinks in a rented shop right in the city center of Freetown.  Her business has been in existence for over 15 years and is the main source of income to support her children’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m.  Fatmata is a hard-working woman, (Fatmata is at left in the group picture).
In the future, Fatmata plans to support her children to acquire a university education.  She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman.  She will be very appreciative to anyone who can help. She thanks you for supporting her group.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable oil, soft drinks,pure water and bread flour for her business.

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru: 58 летняя жительница района Хуросон, Рачабгул. Она имеет двоих детей. У нее одна дочка и один сын. Сыну 23 и дочке 16 лет. Сын женатый. Муж работает охранником в фабрике. Сама Рачабгул занимается животноводством. Она любит домашних животный. Много лет Рачабгул выращивает скота у себя во дворе. Рачабгул отремонтирует свой дом. Из-за нехватки денежных средств она обратилась за кредитом. Рачабгул ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Rajabgul is a 58-year-old resident of the Khuroson region. She has 2 children: one daughter and one son. Her son is 23 years old and her daughter is 16. Her son is married. Rajabgul's husband works as a guard at a factory. Rajabgul herself raises animals. She loves domesticated animals, and, for many years, she has raised livestock in her own yard.

Rajabgul is repairing her house. Because of her shortfall of funds, she has applied for a loan. Rajabgul awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Гулбахор. Она из района Хурусон. Жители района Хуросон, умные, талантливы, трудолюбивые, гостеприимные и честные люди. Гулбахор одна из тех жителей. Ей 44 года. У нее одна дочка. Ее дочь является единственным помощницей. Гулбахор развелась с мужем. Она 10 лет занимается торговлей деятельностью. Гулбахор на рынке имеет торговую точку. Она продает детскую одежду летнюю одежду (футболки, шорты  и обувь). Работаея торговлей она зарабатывает на жизнь. Гулбахор берет кредит для расширения деятельности. За счет кредита она перевозит осеннюю одежду.
texts.en:
This woman is called Gulbahor. She is from the Khuroson region. Residents of Khuroson are intelligent, talented, hard-working, hospitable and honest people, and Gulbahor is one of those residents. She is 44 years old, and she has one daughter. Gulbahor's daughter is her only assistant. Gulbahor is divorced, and she has worked in sales for 10 years.

Gulbahor has a stand in the market, and she sells children's summer clothing (shirts, shorts and shoes). By working in sales, Gulbahor makes enough money to live. Gulbahor is requesting a loan to expand her activities. With the loan, she will purchase autumn clothing.

loans.use: to purchase fall clothing to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia Alicia pertenece al banco comunal MANOS JUNTAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose  al negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores, la socia cría a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
 La socia se siente agradecida con el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable.
La solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes entre otros.
texts.en: Alicia belongs to the Communal Bank "MANOS JUNTAS" (Hands Together). The bank is located in the province of Cusco. The member alternates her daily activities and works in the business of raising and selling small animals. She raises her small animals, and then sells them to the customers who request them. Alicia has been working for a while in this business, and she does well thanks to the hard work she puts in her business every day. She wants to keep on working and continue supporting her family. Alicia feels grateful for the loan and she promises to make her payments on time. She is a responsible person. She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs, among other things.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy digging and stone cutting tools to employ more workers.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman who has one child. She describes herself as polite. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more shoes. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with 3 children. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and goats. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals.

Sarah describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store water for domestic use

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 65 años de edad, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Segundo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 3 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Segundo espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 65 years old and lives with his family in a rural area in the District of Cayaltí. This community is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. The residents of this district engage primarily in agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade.

Segundo raises and sells small animals such as chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, and other livestock. His business is located at his home. He has three years of experience in this business and has acquired many good personal and work-related references in the area. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a large quantity of animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, and other livestock. He will also buy balanced feed for these animals. With this loan, Segundo hopes to offer a better product to his customers. As a result, he will be able to generate more income and eventually achieve a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of animals and livestock feed.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 53 years old and she lives with her family in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Gayane has higher medical education and many years till now she works at the hospital as a midwife. Gayane has two sons and both of them are architectures.

Gayane’s husband is also employed, but now he has some health problems and she is greatly worried of this. Since he is usually very active and healthy man this state causes him great discomfort. This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Gayane asks in order to solve her beloved husband’s health problem.

loans.use: to solve her beloved husband’s health problem

loans.name: Bear Weather Group

texts.en:
Eva is a thirty-seven-year-old business woman and a member of Bear Weather solidarity group, which has four members, of which all are women. Eva sells drinks. She has been in this business for the past two years. She opens her business six days in a week from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Eva established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material and provides food from the profit she gets from her business. Eva is on the left in the group picture.

Eva and her group members need a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL, of which she is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL, in order to buy two more crates of stout, two cartons of beer, two crates of soft drinks and two cartons of Maltina for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Eva is married and has children ages 17 and 15 and a nine-year-old, who goes to school.

In the future, Eva plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Eva will be very appreciative of anyone that can help.

loans.use: to buy two more crates of stout, two cartons of beer, two crates of soft drinks and two cartons of Maltina.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 43 years old and has seven children. Lolita is married and has four children who are in school.

Lolita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lolita has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Bal - Med Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Josephine is the leader of Bal-med Solidarity Group which is made up of four members. All four members including Josephine are engaged in petty trading but selling different products.

Josephine, who is 47 years old, was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people. She sells rice by the bag. Josephine has been selling rice by the bag for the past five years. She uses her business proceeds to pay fees for her children’s education and to provide a livelihood for her family. Josephine is standing on the left of the picture.

Josephine and the other group members of Bal-med solidarity are requesting a total of 4,000,000 SLL. Of this amount, Josephine will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL which she will use to purchase 9 bags of rice for her business.

Josephine is married and has a cheerful family of three children, aged 30, 24 and 20 years. Josephine hopes that her business will continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and also prepare for her old age. Josephine hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family

Josephine and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase nine bags of rice for her business.

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. After an application process that considered her grades, test scores, and a personal interview, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants. She chose Kepler because of her desire to earn a degree from a high quality institution.

Jasmine plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she wants to work in the private sector. A hard worker, Jasmine wants to achieve career success to contiinue her professional growth and to support the education of her brothers and sisters.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Enoch

texts.en:
Enoch is a 30-year old father of 1. He does odd-jobs to make ends meet. He is a member of a self-help group that has decided to empower themselves through business.

He is requesting for a Kiva loan to build a chicken coop on a farm site given to the group by the local council. The loan will buy the needed materials and equip the chicken coop with lighting, and a water system.

Enoch hopes this project will give him stable income and allow him to provide a better lifestyle for his young family .

loans.use: to build a chicken coop to provide a regular income for the support of his family

loans.name: Tea And Bread Group

texts.en:
Marie, who is 46 years old, was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people. She is married with seven children who are all in school.  Marie belongs to a solidarity group of three women who have come together to help each other achieve their individual dreams. Tea and Bread Solidarity group needs a total loan of 4,500,000 SLL of which Marie will receive 1,500,000 SLL to purchase rice, oil, fish, and Maggi (flavor enhancer) for her business.

Marie trades in cooked food in a rented shop right in the city center of Freetown.  Her business, which has been in existence for over eight years, is the main source of income to support her children’s education.  She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week from 7 a.m.to 6 p.m.  Marie is a hard-working woman. (Marie is in the middle of the group picture.

In the future, Marie plans to support her children to acquire a university education.  She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman.  She will be very appreciative to anyone who can help.  She thanks you for supporting her group.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, fish, and Maggi (flavor enhancer).

loans.name: Rodrigo Ernesto

texts.es: Rodrigo tiene 32 años de edad, vive muy feliz y agradecido en su humilde vivienda familiar que es acogedora en la cual vive con su madre que es de avanzada edad. Rodrigo se dedica a la venta de platos típicos además realiza manualidades en durapax,  pinturas en lienzo y murales ya que es una persona muy creativa ya que busca la manera de obtener mas ingresos y así mejorar la economía de su hogar. Rodrigo desea comprar granos básicos ya que desea diversificarse en busca de obtener más ingresos, por lo que esta solicitando un crédito FUSAI para invertir en: compra de  maíz, frijol, harina de arroz, huevos y papas entre otros productos y poderle mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 32 years old, he lives very happy and thankful in his humble home, which is comfortable and is where he lives with his elderly mother. Rodrigo sells traditional home made meals. In addition, he makes crafts using foam and he paints on canvas and murals. He is a very creative person because he looks for ways of earning more income and that way improve the finances of his home.

Rodrigo would like to purchase basic grains, because he is looking to expand and to obtain more income. For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of corn, beans, rice flour, eggs and potatoes among other products and consequently improve the economic situation for his family.

loans.use: to invest in: corn, beans, rice flour, eggs and potatoes among other products to improve his family finances.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John has one child and describes himself as honest. He operates a dairy farm and has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman who has five children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a business where she sells cows. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price changes. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cows. Her business goal is to be able to sell more cows within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married mother of three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she keeps sheep and cows and also grows coffee. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large-scale farm within five years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells sorghum, beans,maize,millet . She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with demand of the products and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in prices.

She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of millet, beans, maize, sorghum. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big cereals store.. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of millet, beans, maize, sorghum

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 29 years old. She is married and has three children. Her business is poultry keeping. She has been in this business for six years. She earns a monthly income of KES 12,000.

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy chicks and chicken feed. She will use the profits from the expanded business to build chicken houses.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Luna Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Rakie is a forty-two year old business woman. She is a member of “Luna” solidarity group with four women. Rakie sells charcoal.
Rakie has been in this business for the past eleven years. She opens her business six days in a week from 8am to 6pm.

Rakie established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food from the profit she gets from her business. Rakie is on the left of the picture.

Rakie and her group members needs a loan totaling 5,000,000 SLL of which she is entitled to 1,500,000 SLL which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal for her business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Rakie is married and has 2 children with the ages of 22 and 18 years.

In the feature, Rakie plan to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family. She also plans to build a house for her family.
Rakie and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal  for her business

loans.name: Abed El Rahman

texts.en:
Abdelrahman is a 38 years old Palestinian refugee, living with his wife and four kids, three girls and a boy in an apartment located in a Palestinian refugee camp in South Lebanon. His kids all go to school and his wife is unemployed, which makes his income the family's only source of revenue.

Abdelrahman has been alternating between working as a carpenter and driving a taxi for almost 10 years in order to increase his income and support his wife and children. His two jobs and friendly personality have also helped him get more clients in both.

He is asking for a 1,080,985 Lebanese Pound loan for the first time from Kiva's partner Ibdaa to buy scaffolding for his carpentry job. That way he will be able to take more projects and will have the ability to increase his productivity and income, which will improve his financials as well as his family's social situation.

loans.use: To buy scaffolding tools

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gari Village. Muhammad joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Muhammad suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to increase my farmland. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Muhammad will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Muhammad now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business, where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 12 years.

Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital.

She will use the KES 55,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan  José es un caficultor con 53 años que vive al norte de Nicaragua junto a su esposa y sus 5 hijos. Logró estudiar hasta quinto grado de primaria, pero luego tuvo que dedicarse al trabajo completamente, para apoyar a su familia.

Siempre ha estado relacionado con la actividad del café y desde hace 9 años se dedica a este rubro como principal actividad económica. La finca de este emprendedor está bajo la certificación de Comercio Justo, lo cual disminuye el riesgo del precio al comercializar su producción.

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar abonos que requiere su cafetal, y con ello garantizar buenos rendimientos para esta cosecha, lo cual es una de sus metas para  incrementar los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan José is a 53-year-old coffee grower who lives in northern Nicaragua with his wife and five children. He studied through the fifth grade of primary school before making the decision to work full-time in order to support his family.

Juan José has always worked in jobs related to the coffee trade, but nine years ago he decided that this field would be his primary source of income. This entrepreneur’s farm has undergone Fair Trade certification, so there is very little price risk involved when his products are sold at market.

For this crop cycle, Juan José is requesting a loan in order to buy composts that are needed for his coffee farm. This will help guarantee a good return from his crop. One of his goals is to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional 50 pairs of slippers for resale.

loans.name: Loveness

texts.en:
Loveness is a 23-year-old up-and-coming businesswoman. She is single and lives in the Nyaminyami district of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at her local secondary school, assisting students with life and study skills.

Loveness has been selling groceries successfully for over two years now. She started her business so that she could provide the community with supplies that are scarce in her small village, as the nearest shopping center is 15km away. Loveness sells products such as sugar, rice, tea, stationary, salt, cooking oil and snacks.

Loveness has been able to help sustain her family with the profits from her business, but she would also love to see it expand. With her first Kiva loan, Loveness purchased sugar, rice, tea, stationary, salt, cooking oil and soap. She hopes to continue to support her parents and siblings with the increase in profits. She hopes to receive a second kiva loan for her to further expand her business of selling groceries.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like cooking oil, soap, salt and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old owner of a cow farm in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. While he never went to school, he has 12 years' experience in the farming field, and inherited his farming skills from his parents.

Ahmad grew up inside the camp, and couldn't go to school due to the financial difficulties his parents were facing. His family is well known for their honesty and commitment to the family business.

Ahmad is now married and living with his wife and his son in the same Palestinian refugee camp as his parents. He is asking for a 3,083,000 Lebanese Pound loan for the first time from Kiva's partner Ibdaa in order to buy a small pick up truck, which will allow him to transport his animals easily. Thus, he will reduce his transportation costs, and he will be able to save time and effort, which will increase his profit.

Ahmad is working hard to improve his financial and social situation, and the farm is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy a pick up truck

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a Palestinian refugee who has been living in a Palestinian camp located in North Lebanon with his wife and daughter who just graduated from high school. His wife being unemployed, Mahmoud's income is the only source of income for the family as his daughter is planning on pursuing her education in college. He is 42 years old and has been working in the construction field for more than 15 years.

Mahmoud is an ambitious man who is committed to his family. In order to develop his business and increase his income to provide them with better living conditions, he is asking for a 2,057,996 LBP loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He is planning on using the loan to buy tiles and use them in his upcoming projects which will ensure him financial sustainability.

loans.use: to buy tiles

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion works as a dentist and she needs a loan to fix the walls of her house Concepcion is a single mother of one kid and she is the owner of the house where she is living with her family Concepcion works hard and she is always studying to be a good dentist so she hopes you can help her she is the only support for her kid Concepcion is at her house in the picture

loans.use: to fix the walls of her house

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор 38 лет. Она замужем за учителя. Гулбахор вместе пережили много бед и радостных событий вместе и воспитали четверых детей. Гулбахор занимается выращиванием скота около 4 года. Ее муж помогает ей в работе в скотном дворе. Гулбахор планирует отремонтировать дом и улучшить жилищные условия семью. Но у семьи Гулбахор финансовое положение не самое лучшее и чтобы отремонтировать дом она обратилась за кредитом. Гулбахор надеется, что ее семью поддержат, и она успешно закончит ремонт.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is 38 years old. She is married to a teacher. They have lived through many misfortunes and joyful occasions together, and have raised 4 children. Gulbahor has been raising animals for about 4 years. Her husband helps her with her work on the farmyard.

Gulbahor plans to repair her home and improve her family's living conditions. However, Gulbahor's family doesn't have the best financial situation, and they have applied for a loan to repair their house. Gulbahor hopes that her family will be supported, and that she will be able to successfully complete the repairs.

loans.use: to buy building materials and repair her house.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en: Sylvester is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be hard working. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the rain season which affects business. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more maize and beans. His business goal is to be a supplier of cereals to institutions within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have continuous supply. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more maize and beans

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: José tiene 36 años de edad, vive muy feliz en casa propia y humilde junto con su compañera de vida y sus hijos de 3, 5 y 9 años de edad. José se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador y responsable que quiere dar lo mejor a su familia. José labora como albañil independiente, él trabaja en diversos proyectos de construcción en zonas aledañas a su comunidad así es como cubre las necesidades básicas de su familia, además José se dedica a cultivar hortalizas y maíz luego los vende en su comunidad lo cual le genera ingresos extras. José solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo de piso, cemento y arena para instalar ladrillo de piso y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old and lives very happily in his own humble home next to his spouse and children aged 3, 5 and 9 years old. José is characterized as a very hard-working and responsible man who wants to give his family the best he can.

José works as an independent mason, working in different construction projects in the neighboring areas of his community. In this way he covers his family's basic needs. In addition, José makes a living growing vegetables and corn, which he sells in his community to generate an extra income. José is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in brick flooring, cement, and gravel to install a brick floor and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to invest in brick flooring, cement and gravel to install a brick floor and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her farm

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en: Gregoria is 58 years old and married with three children. Gregoria works very hard to provide for them. Gregoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store. Gregoria has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sanitary pads, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, noodles, etc. Gregoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a repeat client to the institution. She is a single mother with one child who attends school. She does cattle fattening which she has done for over 4 years. She has been taking loans from Ugafode which has enabled her to sustain her business.

Loyce has been able to start a small restaurant to supplement her income sources. She applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to buy furniture for her restaurant like a fridge, chairs, tables and also a cow for her farm project.

Loyce thanks Ugafode for the financial assistance which has enabled her to improve her income sources. She hopes to expand her businesses with more financial assistance from Ugafode and she encourages Ugafode to continue supporting low income earners.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her new restaurant.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is 31 years old, with three children. With one child in school, Mina works very hard to provide for them.

Mina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Mina has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Mina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: All Purpose Group

texts.en:
Joseph is the leader of the All Purpose Group which is made up of four members. All four members including Joseph are engaged in petty trading, but selling different products. 
He sells charcoal and fire wood. Joseph has been selling charcoal/fire wood for the past five years. Another member uses proceeds of her business to pay fees for her children’s education and to provide a livelihood for her family.
Joseph and the other group members of All Purpose Solidarity are requesting for their first loan, a total of 4,000,000SLL. Of this amount, Joseph will personally receive 1,000,000SLL which he will use to purchase 30 more bags of charcoal and 20 piles of fire wood for his business. Joseph stands in the left of the picture.
Joseph is married and has a cheerful family of one child aged 2 years old. Joseph hopes that his business continues to exist so that he can save enough money to build a dwelling house and also prepare for his old age.  Joseph hopes that this loan will earn him more profit to support his family 
Joseph and his group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase  30 more bags of charcoal and 20 piles of fire wood.

loans.name: Chinta

texts.en:
Chinta is a 39-year-old rural woman of a small village, Dalimpur, in Falakata. She lives there with her husband and two children (a daughter and a son). Both of them are studying now. Her husband Khokan is a farmer and his monthly income is too limited to cover the education costs of his children after managing the household needs.

Chinta’s younger daughter Lila, a 16-year-old girl, studies at Khrierkote High School in grade 12. She is a serious and meritorious girl who was promoted to grade 12 with good marks. Lila’s ambition is to be a good and caring nurse in future. Now she wants some good private tutor for grooming her so that she would score better in her upcoming board examination. Her parents try their level best to make their children well-educated.

Chinta has decided to provide good tutors for her daughter and that will be possible only if she can get financial assistance. That is why she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase Lila’s educational equipment and pay all the educational fees of her daughter. She hopes that this loan amount will provide a good support to continue her daughter’s education further and fulfill her daughter’s dream.

Chinta and Lila (as seen in the picture) thank their generous lenders.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: pipes, manual labor, cement, gravel and sand to install pipes for waste water.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
This nice woman’s name is Lusine and she lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She graduated Yerevan State University the faculty of Biophysics. For 22 years she has worked at the school as a teacher of biology. She loves her work and finds it very responsible and important one. She also gives paid private courses at her house preparing them for the entrance exams. Lusine is married and she is a mother of three very pretty girls and all of them are school-aged.

Lusine asks this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a computer and also professional literature which will greatly help her to make her courses at home more informative and interesting.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also professional literature, which will greatly help her to make her courses at home in biology more informative.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest more in the purchase and resale of medicine.

loans.name: Tarisai

texts.en:
Tarisai is 22 years old already an experienced entrepreneur in Mt Darwin District, Zimbabwe. She has five years of experience in the retail industry. Her business is based at a table at the local market where she sells products such as handbags, shoes, jeans, skirts, tracksuits and T-shirts. It has enabled her to support her family and send her two children to school.

Tarisai volunteers in schools, counseling students and teaching entrepreneurship skills to school graduates.With her first Kiva loan, she purchased handbags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits and T-shirts to increase her stock. This would improve her business considerably and take her one step closer to her dream. Tarisai is running a poultry business and selling clothes . From her first kiva loan she managed to buy clothes and purchase 100 chicks for rearing. She desires to get a second loan so that she expand her clothing business .

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio Juan se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, zanahorias, cebollas y zapallos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan continues to manage his business of selling vegetables. Through this business, he is able to help his family get ahead. His dream is to expand his business of selling vegetables. Juan is requesting a loan in order to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions, and squash.

He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, onions, and squash.

loans.name: Las Conchitas Group

texts.en:
Patulul is located in the beautiful Pacific Coast State of Suchitepéquez, in Guatemala. Lush green landscapes with palms are a part of the beauty of the city that is located in the mountains above the coast. Here there is a great quantity and variety of fruit. The people speak Kaqchikel Maya.

Patulul is the home of The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank's 'Las Conchitas Group,' with its seven very hard-working and industrious members who have small commercial businesses. All the members have a variety of small businesses. They sell orange juice, chicken and beef, fried potatoes and chicken, as well as shops that sell sundries, tortillas, groceries, and wool. They have seen their earnings grow, which encourages them to stay in business and watch them grow.

Olga is a good example of the Las Conchitas Group members. She is a housewife, mother, and small business businesswoman. Daily, she is up early, making orange juice to sell in her convenience store.

Olga is asking for a loan, so she can invest in inventory for her store, such as: sugar, eggs, soup, rice, detergent, and many sacks of oranges, in order to grow her business. That way, she can keep offering a better life for her children.

The women average five children each and, with homes to maintain, they are motivated to improve their businesses, in order to provide opportunities for their children to attend school through a secondary education. This is the reason for their asking Friendship Bridge for microloans, so that they can continue to grow their businesses, in order to become successful businesswomen who can experience the joys of a better life for themselves and their children.

The women of Las Conchitas Group feel satisfied with their successes and are grateful for the support given them by Kiva investors. This support also includes the monthly meetings where the facilitator provides educational topics as a part of the Friendship Bridge 'Microcredit Plus' program that combines microloans and education. These topics include business management, accounting, sound investments, savings, and customer service, among many others. Thank you!

loans.use: to buy sugar, eggs, soup, rice, detergent, and many sacks of oranges, in order to grow her store.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 58 years old and married with six children. Teodora works very hard to provide for them.

Teodora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Teodora has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a member of Kiva's field partner NWTF who supports her family by buying, then selling vegetables in the Philippines. Her daughter Shiela Marie is eighteen years old and is the second of four children in the family. She is studying to earn a degree in Associate Hospitability Management and is currently in the first year of this two-year program.

Myrna has applied for a 7,000 PHP loan to pay for Shiela Marie’s tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016. Her daughter is working to graduate and become gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
nocent is a first-year student at Kepler. He grew up on a small farm in rural Rwanda with his father and three siblings. Because of his incredible academic performance in secondary school, Joseph was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year.

Innocent plans to study Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, Joseph hopes to work in a field like HR, where he can help connect students to great jobs.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Gladys Yacira

texts.en:
Gladys is 60 years old and lives in Medellín with her three children, whom she loves very much and for whom she’s been working for many years. She cooks for an organization that calls her sometimes so she works for them, so it’s not something stable. She wants to study so she can further and improve her life, because for her it is never late to learn and improve.

She wants to study advanced cooking, because it is something that she loves to do, and she believes that with the knowledge she acquires she can start her own business and become more independent, so she can have a stable job and good profits. She doesn’t have the money now so she’s asking for a loan so she can pay for her studies in advanced cooking.

Gladys believes in her talent but want to educate herself so she can improve. She just needs a little help and trust, and you can do that. With a loan, she can pay for her studies and watch her dreams come true.

loans.use: to pay for her studies in advanced cooking.

loans.name: Vardanush

texts.en:
Vardanush from Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region runs farming and agriculture with the help of her husband (he also works as a warden). In her farm Vardanush has a cow, lambs and sheep. She has rather big and rich vegetable garden, where she cultivates potato, radish, cabbage, garlic, tomato, cucumber and greens.

All her farm products Vardanush takes to local wholesale market and there she sells it to her regular customers. From the farm she sells only the meat for which she cooperates with city butchers. This loan of 600.000 Armenian drams she asks as she wants already to organize the preparations for coming autumn sowing activities which will start in two weeks.

loans.use: to organize the preparations for coming autumn sowing activities.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.en:
Martha is 51 years old and lives in the municipality of El Carmen de Viboral. She lives with her partner and her three children. Her family is her most important thing in her life, and the main reason to wake up every morning and work really hard. She has owned a raising cattle business since 2010, but lately the price of milk has decreased, so the business suffered some loss.

For her family and for her business, she wants to improve her sales and make her business last in time, so It will become successful. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy some milk cows and the inputs that will help her improve production.

She dreams of giving a nice present to her family, so that the house where they all live can be fixed because it has some problems that don’t let them feel completely safe. You can help Martha to accomplish all these dreams and more. A loan can do a lot to get her close to that.

loans.use: to buy some milk cows and the inputs that will help her improve production.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 30 años de edad, vive muy feliz junto a su compañera de vida, su hijo de 2 años y su suegra. Jorge se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador y responsable que quiere dar lo mejor a su familia. Jorge labora en un taller de mecánica donde realiza diversos oficios es así como cubre las necesidades básicas de su familia. Además, su compañera de vida presta sus servicios domésticos cerca de su comunidad es así como aporta a la economía de su hogar. Jorge solicita un crédito a FUSAI quiere hacer una vivienda de láminas para poder vivir aparte con su familia, la cual hará junto a la casa de su suegra para ello invertirá en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para construir su vivienda de lámina.
texts.en:
Jorge is 30 years old and lives very happily with his spouse, 2 year old child and mother-in-law. He is known as a very hard-working and responsible man who wants to give his family the best he can.

Jorge works in a mechanic workshop where he carries out a variety of tasks in order to cover his family's basic needs. In addition, his spouse offers domestic services in the area near their community to provide support to household expenses.

Jorge is requesting a loan from FUSAI because he wants to build a home of metal sheets to live independently with his family, which he will build next to his mother-in-law's home. For this, he will invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails, and wires to build his home out of metal sheeting.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails, and wire to build his home out of metal sheeting.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Tem 49 anos de idade, mãe de 6 filhos todos ainda a viver com ela, alguns estudam e outros já  trabalham, cuida também de um neto e uma nora, vive maritalmente com marido  agricultor. Ela vive da agricultura e criação de frangos que iniciou recentemente e esta a tomar o credito pela primeira vez e com o mesmo pretende aumentar o seu stock de criação de frangos.
Pretende comprar  pintos, ração, vitaminas para criação de frangos de abate que vende em sua casa e no mercado local.
Ela gostaria de poder concluir a construção de sua casa e uma casa –de- banho melhorada para sua família.
As condições de vida não muito favoráveis em que ela se encontra actualmente é que constituem seu maior desafio, pois consegue garantir pão para sua família,  mas para investir não tem sido fácil.
texts.en:
She is 49 years old and the mother of six children that still live with her; some of them study, some of them work. She also takes care of a grandson and a daughter-in-law. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer.

She works growing food and started recently to raise chickens. She is about to receive a loan for the first time, and she is planning to use it to buy more chickens. She will buy chicks, and animal feed and vitamins to raise them. She sells them at the local market.

She would like to be able to finish building her house and a well-equipped bathroom for her family. Her current living conditions are not very good, which represents her biggest challenge. She manages to bring food to her family’s table, but it has been difficult to find the means to invest.

loans.use: to buy chickens, animal feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Agustin Fernando

texts.es:
Agustin tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Agustin se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 8 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Agustin espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustin is 45 years old. He lives with his partner and children in his own house built with basic materials in the district of Pomahuaca, which is located in the province of Jaén in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in this district is peaceful. The inhabitants mostly make a living from agriculture, trade, and ranching.

Agustin makes a living from agriculture; he grows coffee. He has eight years of experience in this sector and he has very good work and personal references. He will use the loan being granted to him to purchase compost and fertilizers so he can maintain his coffee crops. He will also hire workers for the harvest. In this way, Agustin hopes to offer better-quality coffee to his clients, which will have a positive impact on his income level and thus improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee crops

loans.name: Heydi Jeannette

texts.es:
Heydi, de 28 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la venta de tortillas en su comunidad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, junto a su esposo ha procreado una niña y su pareja se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas. 

Heydi, hace tortillas para vender, desde su niñez su madre le enseño a hacerlas y hoy en día es su fuente de ingresos.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar maíz, porque los precios han incrementado debido a la sequía y ella necesita abastecerse antes de que incrementen más, de esa manera generara los ingresos suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su familia. 

Heydi, sueña con construir una galera más grande para su negocio y hacerle mejoras a su casa; además desea que sus hijos estudien y tengan mayores oportunidades de empleo que la que ella tuvo.
texts.en:
Heydi is 28 years old. She works at the household chores and the sale of tortillas in her community. She went to school until the ninth grade. She is in a relationship and she and her husband have a daughter. Her husband works in agriculture.

Heydi makes tortillas to sell. From the time she was a child her mother taught her to make them and today it is her source of income.

She needs the money of the loan to buy corn since the prices have gone up due to the drought. She needs to stock up on it before the price increases more. In this way, she will generate sufficient income to cover the family expenses.

Heydi dreams of building a larger area for her business and of making improvements to her house. She also wishes that her children study and have greater employment opportunities than what she has had.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Blanca Neida

texts.en:
Blanca, 42, has four children, three boys and a daughter, who live with Blanca and her partner in Dabeiba municipality. She has worked for more than fifteen years, but to earn more income she started farming in 2007. She learned how to work the land by herself.

Farming can be unpredictable and difficult at times. Blanca realizes that she needs to invest in her farm if it is to be successful and long term. She has applied for a 3,000,000 COP loan through Kiva's field partner Interactuar to buy seed, fertilizers and insecticides and to pay for laborers.

Blanca dreams of having a really nice house; right now, it is in disrepair. She hopes to renovate it soon so her family can live more comfortably. A loan will get her nearer to achieving all that she wants.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers and insecticides and to pay for laborers on her farm.

loans.name: Justino

texts.pt:
Tem 51 anos de idade, pai de família casado oficialmente, tem 4 filhos  2 maiores de idade 1 já a trabalhar e os outros 3 ainda na sua responsabilidade e a estudarem, vive de negocio de venda de medicamentos duma companhia sul africana, conta com ajuda esposa vendedeira de produtos alimentares em sua casa e no mercado grossista. Esta a repetir o credito pela segunda vez, com o primeiro investiu nas despesas do seu casamento.
Pretende comprar: bebidas, açúcar, massas, farinha, amendoim, açúcar, frangos, peixe, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio.
O seu desejo é de desenvolver mais o seu negocio e construir quartos para aluguer.
texts.en:
He is 51 years old, married, and the father of four children; two of them are adults. One of her children works and the remaining three are under his responsibility and go to school. He works selling medicine from a South African company. Her wife, who sells foodstuff at home and at the wholesale market, helps him.

This is his second loan. With the first one, he paid for his wedding expenses. He plans to buy beverages, sugar, pasta, flour, peanuts, chicken, fish, etc. to expand his business.

He wishes to develop his business even more and build rooms to rent.

loans.use: to buy beverages, sugar, pasta, flour, peanuts, chicken, fish, etc.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée qui vit à Tokoin avec ses deux enfants à charge. Agée de 30 ans, Akouvi est une femme dynamique et courageuse  qui vend des friperies en parcourant les quartiers afin de disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour bien atteindre ses objectifs, Akouvi s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des friperies afin de financer son commerce et trouver un bon rendement pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et bien organiser l’éducation scolaire  de ses enfants.
texts.en: Akouvi is a married woman who lives in Tokoin with her two dependent children. At 30 years old, Akouvi is a dynamic and brave woman who sells used clothing by travelling across the neighbourhoods in order to have a good financial standing. To meet her goals, Akouvi gets her supplies four times a month at the market. She would like this loan to order used clothing in order to pay for her business and get a good return to meet her daily needs and properly organise her children's school education.

loans.use: to buy a heap of used clothing.

loans.name: Humuramubyeyi Cb Group

texts.en:
Hasha, 25, is married and has a child who is three years old. She is also the leader of this group called Humuramubyeyi, meaning “Mother, be happy” in English. The group members are employed in a number of different ventures, and all wish to develop them for a better future.

For the past six years Hasha has owned and operated a beauty salon. She has applied for a group loan of 2,461,875 RWF through Kiva's field partner Urwego Opportunity Bank to be apportioned among the group members. With her share of the loan, she will buy more salon equipment for her business. Her profits will be used to pay for medical insurance and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment for her beauty business.

loans.name: Chico

texts.pt:
O cliente Chico de 54 anos de idade e casado, trabalhador como militar, pai de 7 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino superior, 1 já concluiu o nível médio, 4 frequentam o ensino primário, 1 frequenta o ensino secundário, vive em casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar, ferros, cimento, pedra, pregos, arame, barrotes chapas de zinco para dar continuidade da sua obra.
A cliente tem como sonho, concluir a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família e futuramente comprar uma viatura para o seu dia-a-dia.
Tem como principais desafios financeiros tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
54-year-old Chico is married and works for the military. He is the father of seven children; one of them goes to the university, one is in secondary school, one has finished middle school, and four go to primary school. He owns the house where he lives.

With the requested amount, he is planning to buy iron, cement, stones, nails, wires, beams, and zinc sheets to continue with the construction works.

His dream is to finish building his house and give his family a better home. In the future, he would like to buy a vehicle for his everyday activities.

His main challenges are financial in nature. He has continued working and is planning to apply for more loans in order to overcome the difficulties and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, stones, nails, wires, beams, and zinc sheets to continue with the construction works.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in nails, wood, sheet metal and wire to change the roof and improve the quality of life in her home.

loans.name: Jaqueline Yamileth

texts.es:
Jaqueline, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, dejo de asistir a la escuela cuando quedó embarazada y se acompañó, ahora tiene tres años de vivir con su pareja, el cual se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas y también trabaja como jornalero para ayudarle en los gastos del hogar.

Jaqueline, es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a vender enchiladas, tostadas de plátano, empanadas y también hace tamales de gallina para salir a vender en su comunidad, es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que se gana la vida trabajando para que a su familia no se le falte lo necesario.

Ella, necesita el crédito para comprar plátano, maíz, papas y otros insumos para preparar los alimentos que vende, de esa manera seguirá trabajando con orgullo y honradez, para llevar el sustento a su casa y así sacar adelante a su familia. 

Jaqueline, sueña con ampliar más su negocio y también sueña con construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
