22-year-old Jaqueline studied up until the ninth grade. She stopped going to school when she got pregnant and went to live with her partner. She has now been living with her partner for three years. He works in agriculture and he also works as a day labourer to help Jaqueline with the household expenses.

Jaqueline is a very hard-working person. She sells enchiladas, fried plantains, and empanadas. She also makes chicken tamales, which she sells in the community. She is an enterprising and determined woman who earns a living with her work so that her family has everything they need.

She needs the loan to buy plantains, maize, potatoes, and other supplies in order to prepare the food that she sells. In this way, she will continue working with integrity in order to provide for her family.

Jaqueline dreams of expanding her business more and building her own house.

loans.use: to buy plantains, maize, potatoes, and other supplies for preparing the food that she sells.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar es un hombre de 20 años de edad que habita en vivienda muy humilde pero propia, por lo que se siente feliz de poder compartirla con sus padres y sus dos hermanos menores de edad. Oscar se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración de divisiones y repisas de tabla roca, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que se siente feliz. Oscar siempre está buscando la manera de su calidad de vida, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y una puerta  para instalar una puerta y repellar su vivienda y de esta manera tener mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Oscar is 20. The home where he lives is very humble, but it is his own. That's why he feels happy to be able to share it with his parents and his two younger siblings, who are under 18. For several years, Oscar has worked making sheetrock dividers and shelving. This has allowed him to help his family get ahead, which makes him happy. Oscar is always looking for ways to improve his quality of life, which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, and a door, in order to install a door and plaster his home to improve its security.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, and a door, in order to install a door and plaster his home to improve its security.

loans.name: Zoila Elizabeth

texts.es:
Zoila, de 22 años de edad, es una joven trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de comida y pupusas, que debido a la situación económica que tenían sus padres, solo pudo estudiar hasta noveno grado; está acompañada, tiene tres hijos junto a su esposo y cada día lucha por sacarlos adelante y darles lo necesario.

Zoila, trabaja vendiendo comida y pupusas desde hace 10 años, es de ese negocio que genera los ingresos para poder mantener a sus hijos, cuando estaba pequeña sufrió mucho debido a la falta de recursos económicos de sus padres, es por eso que hoy en día no quiere que a su hijos pasen por lo mismo que ella sufrió. 

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar, tomates, chicharrón, carne, quesillo, utensilios de cocina, entre otros; porque la demanda que tiene de comida cada día es más. 

El sueño de Zoila, es que su hijo pueda ser profesional y poder tener un negocio más amplio.
texts.en:
22-year-old Zoila is a hard-working young woman. She makes a living by selling food and pupusas (stuffed tortillas). Due to her parents’ financial situation, she was only able to study up until the ninth grade. She has a partner. She has three children with her husband and she works hard every day in order to provide for them and give them everything they need.

Zoila has been selling food and pupusas for ten years. This business generates the income she needs to be able to feed and clothe her children. When she was little, she went through a lot due to her parents’ lack of economic resources; for this reason, she does not want her children to go through the same experiences as she did.

She needs the money from the loan to buy tomatoes, pork crackling, meat, cream cheese, cooking utensils, and other supplies because the demand for her food is increasing every day.

Zoila’s dream is that her son would become a professional. She also dreams of being able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, pork crackling, meat, cream cheese, cooking utensils, and other supplies

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Senhora Albertina tem 40 anos de idade casada, mãe de 4 filhos dos quais três estudam frequentando o ensino primário e secundário e um sem idade escolar, é negociante, vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cimento cola, azulejos, lava- loiça para apetrechar a sua cozinha.
No futuro pretende construir uma loja para a venda de mercadorias diversas á grosso e a retalho de modo a colocar os produtos perto dos compradores.
A exiguidade de fundos retarda os seus projectos assim sendo vai apostar em trabalhar bem com a Hluvuku de forma a garantir futuros financiamentos para os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Albertina is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children; three of them go to primary and secondary school, and one is not of school age yet. She is a businesswoman and owns the house where she lives with her family.

She will use the requested amount to buy cement, tiles, and a sink to furnish her kitchen. In the future, she is planning to build a store to sell different products at wholesale and retail, in order to be closer to her customers.

The lack of funding delays her projects. Thinking of this, she will start to work with Hluvuku in order to ensure future loans for her projects.

loans.use: to buy cement, tiles, and a sink to furnish her kitchen.

loans.name: Jesus Pan De Vida Group

texts.es: Nicolaza  tiene 48 años de edad es conviviente con un hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta y productos naturales hace más de 5 años. Años a tras vendía flores. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas plátanos manzanas y más productos naturales medicinales. El grupo “JESUS PAN DE VIDA” agradece por el préstamo brindado. Nicoloza se encuentra sentada viste polo celeste con estampado y encaje negro en el cuello.
texts.en:
Nicolaza is 48 years old and lives with her partner and a dependent son. She has been making a living selling fruit and natural products for more than 5 years. Years before, she sold flowers. She will invest the loan in the purchase more fruit, including bananas and apples, as well as the purchase of additional natural medicinal products. 

The "Jesus Pan de Vida" [Jesus Bread of Life] group is thankful for the offered loan. In the picture Nicolaza is seated and wearing a blue patterned blouse with black lace around the neck.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and medicinal products.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
This is Haydee’s stall of accessories, located inside a multi-purpose hall in Buhangin, Davao City. From different colors and sizes of beads, she creates beautiful products such as arm bands, bracelets, necklaces, purses, pouches, and bags – a very efficient way of making usable items from small things. Two paid helpers assist her from creative planning to production and marketing.

Haydee’s business gives her a sort of relief from the absence of her husband, Ronaldo, an overseas Filipino worker (OFW). He’s been working abroad for several years already to support the education of their five children. Haydee tries her best to supplement other household needs like food, utilities and transportation allowances, with the aid of her business. Slowly, they are being relieved of huge educational expenses because two of their five children have already finished their schooling, while the other two are still studying in college and the youngest is in high school.

Now Haydee is giving extra attention to her business. She realized that she cannot get enough clients while waiting inside the store. Therefore, she concentrates on marketing and networking to get volume orders from schools, offices and workplaces. She promotes her products as affordable give-aways during special occasions.

She is anticipating mass production and she needs additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy a large volume of beads, nylon and other raw materials for her business.

She’s really working hard, hoping that her income would be enough to support all their needs, so that her husband need not work abroad anymore.

Praying that you could be God’s instrument to grant her request and contribute a few steps to make her family whole someday.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a high volume of beads, nylon and other raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina reside en un barrio popular del municipio de Barranquilla en donde encontró una oportunidad de negocio desde su vivienda al ofrecerle a sus vecinos servicio de billar y bebidas; alquiló una mesa de billar y compro dos canastas de cerveza, pero muy pronto tuvo éxito y fue comprando sus enseres y ampliando su gama de productos; adquirió un enfriador, sillas y mesas.  Todos los días vende sus productos pero los fines de semana la afluencia de personal es mayor y ella está a disposición a partir de las 10 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m. comercializando gaseosas, cervezas y chichas. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en canastas de cervezas y gaseosas, Luz Marina considera que esta inversión le será muy útil para conseguir producto a mejores precios y mejorar su margen de utilidad. Su meta a futuro es capitalizarse y comprar de contado.
texts.en:
Luz Marina lives in a popular neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. There, she has found a business opportunity out of her home, selling drinks and billiards games to her neighbors. She rented a billiards table and purchases two baskets of beer, however, she gained success very quickly and started purchasing equipment and expanding her product offerings. She purchased a cooler, chairs and tables.

She runs her business everyday, but the weekends are busiest for her and she ends up working from 10am to 10pm selling soda, beer and chicha (a sweet drink made from corn). She is seeking a loan, her first from Kiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase baskets of beer and soda. Luz Marina believes that this investment will be very beneficial for her since it will allow her to purchase products at a better price and increase her profit margin. Her goal is to increase her capital and be able to make her purchases in cash.

loans.use: purchase baskets of beer and soda.

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.en:
Juan is a 43-year-old man who has one daughter who is 14 years old. He lives with his family in the municipality of El Carmen de Viboral, a beautiful town close to Medellín. He has had a raising cattle business since 2005, work that he does with a lot of love and compromise. He learned all what he knows because of his father.

He wants to improve his sales so he can increase his profits, and he’s aware that he needs to invest in his business and work harder to accomplish all that he wants with his business.

He asked for a loan so he can buy pigs and food for them.

Juan has big dreams and he’s determined to accomplish them all. One of them is to buy a house for his family, so they can live safe and comfortably. He loves his daughter very much and wants the best for her, so he would like to give to her the best education.

You can help Juan with this dream with a loan; that would mean a lot to him and his family.

loans.use: buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Handaru

texts.en:
Handaru is an artisan from Java, Indonesia who specializes in handcrafted batik art.

He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood for his designs.

Handaru has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story: "I come from a region where batik has strong roots in the culture. I create beautiful wooden batik with Indonesian batik ornaments, but I focus more on Yogya and Solo classic batik motifs. The color I use is sogan, or brown, a trademark of the Yogya-Solo classic batik motifs. I enjoy my work greatly, and hope that my customers take pleasure in sharing our rich cultural heritage."

"Right now I am preparing my new wooden batik mancala and can use this capital to finish them. I hope that the world will know about the beauty of Indonesian batik, and that my work can spread happiness many homes. Thanks for your support."

Use the link below to view Handaru's handcrafted batik art on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/1572

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood for his designs

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
This woman is named Karine, 32 years old and she has a big and nice family. She lives with her husband (he is a builder), three children and mother-in-law (she is a pedagogue). Karine has higher education and specialty of pedagogue-psychologist, but she never managed to work of her profession, instead she is already a master in farming.

Karine has a big farm where she keeps cows, bulls, a calf, sheep, pigs and 100 chickens. Now she sells a lot of eggs and poultry, but the assortment of dairy-products for sale is very small; she sells only some milk and a little macun (national dairy-product). With this loan amount she greatly wants to buy one more cow for her farm. In this way she will enlarge the assortment of her farm’s dairy-products and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Honorine

texts.en:
Honorine is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. After an application process that considered her grades, test scores, and a personal interview, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants. She chose Kepler because of its academic quality as well as her desire to earn a degree from a high quality institution.

Cynthia plans to major in Health Care Management and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she hopes to manage a hospital or health NGO. She is committed to improving the well being of her fellow Rwandans, while also supporting her family.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Mykailo

texts.en:
Mykailo has owned a retail business selling bathroom equipment and construction materials for 10 years. Since Mykailo's last loan on KIVA, his family had one more child.

Mykailo is hardworking and responsible person. He plans to finish building his house and invest income in the education of the children.

Mykailo is a good specialist. He sells only good quality goods. The most popular goods are mixtures and tile adhesive.

Mykailo is asking for a loan of 60,000 UAH to purchase swimming pools to sell. He hopes to get a bigger income due to the loan and to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase swimming pools to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cement, sand, gravel, etc. to repair her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in wood, nails, screws, and adhesive as well as other products to make furniture and sell them to his clients.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es: Adán de 57 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposa y su hijo de 15 años de edad. El es un hombre muy emprendedor que se gana la vida cultivando granos básicos como maíz, frijol, café, los cuales posteriormente los vende es así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a su familia y brindado los insumos necesarios para el hogar. Adán desea brindarles mayor comodidad a su familia realizando unas mejoras a su vivienda ya que esta posee un corredor de tierra el cual cuando llueve se llena haciendo que el agua ingrese a su vivienda, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y grava para poder encementar el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Adán, 57, lives in a house that he owns with his wife and their 15-year-old son. He is an enterprising man who earns a living growing basic grains such as, corn, beans, and coffee, which he later sells in order to make a living and provide for his his family and household.

Adán hopes to provide his family with greater comfort by making some repairs to their home. Currently they have a dirt patio that causes their home to flood whenever it rains. For this reason, he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, and gravel in order to make a cement patio.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, and gravel to cement his house's patio.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es: El señor Eulogio tiene de 46 años de edad,  es casado y es padre de 6 hijos de los cuales 2 son mujeres y 4 varones, el señor Eulogio desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar en labores de agricultura sembrando granos básicos y también trabajaba en los plantíos de café y cuando era época de cosecha se dedicaba a cortar café la cual esto le permitía ayudar a sus padres. Hace 10 años se traslado a vivir a otro lugar junto con su familia en esa propiedad tiene sembrado café y granos básicos, la producción la destina para consumo y venta cuando tiene oportunidad, se dedica también a criar cerdos que luego él los vende, además compra uno o dos terneros para criarlos  y luego venderlos. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha podido compra sus animales, ha sacado a sus hijos adelante ya que todos están estudiando y comenta que los apoyara hasta donde el pueda. En la comunidad donde vive el señor Eulogio no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar el cual será instalado en la casa de habitación, este sistema será de gran beneficio ya que su esposa se levanta de madrugada para preparar el desayuno para la familia y se tiene que estar alumbrando  con candela o usar un foco y ya con luz producida por el panel solar podrá vivir mejor, además los hijos están estudiando y una de las hijas es profesora de la escuela de la comunidad y sus hijos tienen que hacer las tareas por las noches y se alumbran con candelas, pero si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar todo será diferente para toda la familia. don Eulogio estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para la compra de este sistema solar.
texts.en:
Eulogio is 46 years old, married and the father of six children, two girls and four boys. Eulogio since he was young has worked in agricultural work, growing basic grains and also worked on coffee plantations. When it was harvest time he worked picking coffee which allowed him to help his parents.

Ten years ago he moved with his family to another place. He has basic grains and coffee growing on this property. His produce is destined for their own consumption and for sale when he has the opportunity. He also raises pigs to later sell them and he buys a calf or two to raise and sell. Through his efforts at work he has been able to buy his animals and is raising his children, all of whom are in school. He comments that he will support them as much as he can.

In the community where Eulogio lives there is no electricity. It is for this reason he is requesting a loan to buy a solar energy system which will be installed in his house. This system will be of great benefit as his wife gets up early in the morning to prepare breakfast for the family and she needs to use candles for light or use a lamp.

With light produced by the solar panel they can live better. Besides the children study and one of the daughters is a teacher at the school in the community and his children have to do homework at night by candlelight. If they receive this opportunity with the loan to buy this solar home system everything would be different for the family. Eulogio would be very grateful for the opportunity of this loan.

loans.use: to buy a 100 watt solar home system with 4 lights installed.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn from Buhangin, Davao city. She runs two small enterprises, a “sari-sari” or variety store and a Piso Net. Her variety store sells various commodities like canned goods, candies, chips, biscuits, sachets of shampoo and conditioner, packs of condiments and spices, and many other things. Piso Net is a coin-operated internet PC with a typical rental fee of PhP 1 every four minutes. It is a budget-friendly internet café ,suitable for short-time internet users. Her income from these businesses can help provide for their everyday needs. But she’s a widow with two children who are studying in college, thus she has to generate higher profits to sustain their growing expenses.

She applied for PHP 29,000 loan to buy some computer paraphernalia to maximize its service to customers. She will also have them checked to maintain its optimum operation. Part of the loan will be utilized to purchase more supplies to widen the selection of her variety store.

She exerts all efforts to provide for her children’s needs and education, and to give them a better life someday. In due time, she dreams of having a bigger store and more PCs for her Piso Net business.

She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy some computer paraphernalia and pay for the maintenance of her internet cafe

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena’s humble place beside her house, where she sells fish and vegetables. To be able to save, she chooses this simple location instead of paying the rental fee in commercial areas. She wants to cut down her expenses because she needs higher capital during the rainy season. Fish and seafood are more expensive during this season and she can hardly afford it.

This is why she desires to have additional capital of PhP 15,000, to buy different varieties of fish in large quantities. She will also set aside some amount for emergency situations like typhoons, when there’s no chance to catch any fish. In that situation she plans to buy more vegetables.

This way, she can still earn some money even during rainy days and she can still sustain their usual everyday needs. You can be the answer to her prayers through your generous support. Thank you so much in advance and may God return more blessings to you.

Rowena is married to Roan and they have children who are studying in college. They are living in Buhangin, Davao city. They work persistently in order to see their children with a college diploma. Two or three years from now, she will be relieved of her children’s educational expenses and she can give full focus in her dream of improving her business.

She is a zealous member of CCT, where she gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of fish and seafood in large quantities.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.en:
Patulul is located in the southwestern portion of Guatemala where the climate is quite warm and humid. It is both a coastal and mountainous region. The area is an agricultural one where there are large coffee farms as well as farms where grain and bananas are grown and harvested. On a smaller scale, artisans fabricate items of leather and cotton weavings.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “San Antonio” was formed by 12 women who are involved in various commercial activities like the sale of dairy products, sales of cosmetics and clothing as well as a “tortilleria” where tortillas are freshly made three times each day. The group is made up women of all ages who joined together to made decisions and to make payments on their loans in a timely way.

Marta is a young mother who is 28 years old who has a tortilla business. She is firmly committed to supporting her 2-year-old son and giving him the highest quality of life possible. She is motivated to improve and expand her business so that she can increase earnings and offer her clientele better quality service.

Marta is requesting a loan that she will use to buy building materials for her “tortilleria”- to remodel her shop. She needs to purchase cement, blocks and metal sheeting. She also wants to buy corn.

A Friendship Bridge Facilitator meets once each month with Marta and her friends in the Trust Bank. After the ladies transact business on their loans, the facilitator will share knowledge with them about a variety of useful topics. One month, they may learn about health or hygiene or the use of medicinal plants. Another month, the women may gain knowledge about effective business practices like accounting, budgeting, marketing or customer service. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and small loans “Microcredit Plus”, and it is truly effective.

KIVA investors are valuable partners with Friendship Bridge for these women. Armed with their new tools, the women face a brighter future, benefitting themselves, their families and their community in Patulul, Guatemala. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to remodel her tortilleria shop; she will purchase cement, blocks and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Jeison

texts.es: Jeison es un joven de 31 años de edad que decidió seguir los pasos de sus abuelos quienes confeccionan prendas de vestir y fueron sus tutores en este arte.  Su microempresa inició en el año 2005, luego de haberse comprometido con su cónyuge, con sus ahorros empezó su producción sin embargo su especialidad son las bermudas y los pantalones masculinos.  Sus principales clientes están ubicados en municipios aledaños a Barranquilla y en su mayoría son almacenes mayoristas.  Como su producción es por grandes volúmenes, Jeison está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de telas exclusivamente. Esta inversión es muy significativa para su negocio, puesto que dinamiza las ventas al permitir confeccionar nuevas colecciones y tendencias a sus clientes. Jeison  tiene como meta a futuro crecer en su negocio hasta llegar a generar empleos y poder ofrecerle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Jeison, 31, decided to follow in the footsteps of his grandparents, who make garments and taught him this art. His small business began in 2005, after he became engaged to his partner and saved up to begin production, specializing in bermuda shorts and men's pants. His main clients are located in the area surrounding Barranquilla and are primarily wholesalers.

Since his production is in large volumes, Jeison is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he will invest it exclusively in purchasing fabrics. This investment is very meaningful for his business, since it energizes sales by allowing him to make new collections and trends for his customers. Jeison's future goal is to grow his business to the point that it will generate jobs and be able to offer his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing fabrics

loans.name: Dairo Del Cristo

texts.es: Dairo reside en compañía de su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, ellos aprovecharon la gran afluencia de personas que transitaban por el frente de su vivienda y decidieron iniciar su propio negocio de comidas. Su cónyuge con una larga trayectoria en la culinaria es la encargada de darle el toque secreto a los exquisitos almuerzos y fritos típicos de la costa caribe. Actualmente cuentan con 25 años de experiencia, ofreciéndole a sus comensales excelente calidad a precios accesibles. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres para la preparación de sus comidas; arroz, aceite, carnes, verduras, harina y demás.  Con esta inversión podrán variar la carta de comidas y dinamizar las ventas.  Su meta a futuro es realizarle unas adecuaciones a la vivienda y ampliar el local.
texts.en: Dairo lives with his spouse in a neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquilla. They have taken advantage of the considerable affluence of the people passing by their home, and decided to start their own business selling food. His wife, who has a long history practicing the culinary arts, is responsible for the secret touch in their exquisite lunches and typical fried snacks from the Caribbean coast. Currently, they have 25 years of experience offering their customers excellent quality at accessible prices. Dairo is now applying for a Kiva loan, his first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which he will purchase provisions for the preparation of his food: rice, oil, meat, vegetables, flour, etc. With this loan, he will be able to add variety to his menu, and stimulate his sales. His goal for the future is to make some modifications to his home, and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase provisions for his food preparation: rice, oil, meat, vegetables, flour, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a mother of three, but her sons are adults already. She is living with one of them, but the house is under construction, and Francisca needs a loan to build up a room for her at her son's house. 

She hopes you can help her because her son has his own expenses and the rest of her family has to take care of themselves. Francisca also works selling potatoes at the market, and she would like to use the room to rent it. In that way, she will be able to be more helpful for her son.

loans.use: to build up a room for her at her son's house

loans.name: San Bartolome De Chaclacayo Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “SAN BARTOLOME DE CHACLACAYO” conformada por 05 socias responsables. Ella es JULIA una de las socias de 23 años de edad Soltera con 1 hijo. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en un puesto de mercado desde hace más de 3 años que tiene dicho negocio. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de plátanos manzanas papas y cebollas. El grupo “san Bartolomé de chaclacayo” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Julia es la primera del lado derecho viste polo color blanco.
texts.en:
This is the new group "San Bartolomé de Chaclacayo" ["Saint Bartholomew of Chaclacayo"], which is made up of 5 responsible members. One of the members is Julia. She is 23 years old, is single, and has one child. She earns a living selling fruits and vegetables in a market stand and has been in business for more than 3 years. Her greatest desire is to be able to grow her business. She requested a loan to buy plantains, apples, potatoes, and onions.

The group "San Bartolomé de Chaclacayo" is thankful to the Kiva members who made this loan possible, as it allows the group to continue improving. Julia is the first woman on the right, wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy plantains, apples, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Jaypee

texts.en: Jaypee is 25 years old. He earns a living through his buying and selling of fish and other seafood products to the people in his place in Talibon, Bohol. Jaypee is asking for a loan to buy cement, plywood and paint  so he can build a proper toilet. He will also use the money to buy shrimp, crabs and fish.  It has been his dream to have a decent comfort room or toilet. The loan will also allow  him to provide the needs of the family especially their daily food consumption.

loans.use: to  buy cement, plywood, paint, to construct a toilet at home and also shrimp, crabs and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of pigs to raise them.

loans.name: Quilinco Group

texts.en:
The town of Chiantla is located in the cool northwestern part of Guatemala that is largely agricultural. There are fields of all kinds of beans including lima beans, corn, wheat, vegetables and fruits. There are some who raise sheep for wool as well as beef cattle, pigs and horses. The area is mountainous with beautiful and sweeping landscapes, spectacular sunrises and sunsets. The weather is cool, as it is right in the middle of the Cuchumatanes Mountains.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Quilinco” was formed by ten women whose average age is 30 years. The majority of the women are involved with the purchase and sale of vegetables, chickens, turkeys, pigs, sheep and cattle, while others have textile businesses. The ladies meet once each month to make payments on their loans and to discuss their small businesses. 

Paula is a 53-year-old business woman who is on her third loan cycle. She was only able to attend school until the third grade. She is a cheerful woman who buys and sells vegetables. Paula also makes women’s clothing. Along with her husband, Paula works hard to meet the needs (food and education) of her family. The couple has five children. She is requesting a loan to buy fabric to make more blouses, skirts and aprons to meet the demand of her clientele. Paula would also like to buy animals to raise and sell. She would like to see all of her children achieve a higher standard of living and wants them to be well-prepared. She shares that she has learned a great deal from the monthly trainings.

The women of the Trust Bank “Quilinco” are hopeful their first requested loan from KIVA will be funded by investors from throughout the world. They send this message: “Many thanks to the people who invest in our Trust Bank. Thanks to you all! With your help, we will be successful women eliminating poverty for ourselves, our families and our community.”

loans.use: To buy fabric to make more blouses, skirts and aprons to meet the demand of her clientele

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José Francisco es un pequeño productor de café que vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatros hijos, en una comunidad de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Desde hace más de diez años se dedica a la producción de este rubro, el cual cultiva bajo los criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo, CA.F.E. Practices y UTZ. 

En los últimos tres años la producción de su café ha incrementado en un 20 por ciento, dado el buen manejo que este productor implementa en su finca. Para continuar creciendo, ahora se ha propuesto implementar un plan de mejoramiento nutricional  de aproximadamente 4 hectáreas de café, para ello solicita un financiamiento que le permita comprar los insumos agrícolas requeridos y poder continuar incrementando su producción para lograr mejorar los ingresos y darle a su esposa y sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José Francisco is a small coffee producer who lives alongside his wife and their four children, in a community of the northern zone of Nicarauga. Since more than 10 years ago, he has been working in this sector, in which he works under the C.A.F.E. Practices and UTZ Fair Trade certification criteria. In the past three years the production of his coffee has increased by 20%, given the good management that this producer implements on his farm.

In order to continue growing, he has proposed implementing a nutritional improvement plan for approximately 4 hectares of coffee. Therefore, he is applying for a loan that will allow him to buy the required agricultural supplies and be able to continue increasing his production in order to achieve improving income and giving his wife and his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy the agricultural supplies that he requires in this production cycle for the maintenance of his coffee.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. She has two daughters and a son. Her elder daughter and son are married and they live with their families. Karine is divorced and she lives now with her youngest daughter. Karine has higher education and she has specialty as an economist. Many years till today Karine manages to work of her specialty and she is greatly happy in that fact. Her daughter is also employed.

Karine thanks to her and her daughter’s savings last year managed to do repairs of their flat but for the furnishing she has no money and needs financial support. She would like to buy a sofa and armchairs for her living-room and greatly hopes that Kiva lenders will help her with loan amount to make this purchase and finally make her flat comfortable and pleasant.

loans.use: to buy a sofa and armchairs for her living-room.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
El Sr. Julian tiene 45 años, está casado con la Sra. Liz, el comenta que se inició  trabajando con su tío como ayudante de electricista de quien aprendió el oficio y con quien trabajo por varios años.
Actualmente con mucho esfuerzo logro independizarse y le resulta muy bien. Gracias a esta  actividad puede darles una buena educación a sus hijos y llevar una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar un tester de electricidad y un soldador, taladros y escaleras para poder seguir con su servicio.
texts.en:
Julian is 45 years old and is married to Liz. He began working with his uncle as an electrician's assistant. He learned that trade from his uncle, with whom he worked for several years. After much effort, he has now started his own business, and has done very well.

His business has allowed him to provide a good education to his children, and to live a life of dignity. He seeks this loan in order to buy an electrical tester, a soldering iron, drills and ladders, to be able to continue with his services.

loans.use: to buy an electrical tester, a soldering iron, drills and ladders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, brick, re-bar, PVC pipe etc. for the construction of a bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cloth, thread, silk lace, lace, and needles to make smocks to sell in the municipal market.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 38 years old, married with four children. The oldest child is 15 and her youngest is 2 years old.
She is raising hogs for an income so she can help the needs of her family. She also operate a business called P.O. (Purchase Orders) business where customers will use her card as a guarantor to buy items at the mall. She plans to use her loan to buy hog feed to fatten her hogs and invest on her P.O. business as an additional bond. Joan hopes that she would be able to produce healthy hogs that will attract buyers from the market at a good price.
She plans to improve and increase the hogs that she is raising in the future so her business will be more stable.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten her hogs and invest on her P.O. business as an additional bond

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 58 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, school supplies, home product care, and other groceries.

Cristina has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, school supplies, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Purita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell tobacco business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Purita is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more tobacco and other supplies to use in her business for her buy and sell tobacco business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Purita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 55 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Juliana is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Juliana has been raising pigs for 38 years and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mardelita

texts.en:
Mardelita is a married woman with fourteen children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mardelita is 50 years old and has three children who are in school.

Mardelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mardelita requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Mardelita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Mardelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is a woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Enriqueta is 65 years old now.

Enriqueta has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. Enriqueta requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like toilet bowl cleanser, lotion, soap powder, beauty soap, shampoo, & etc..

Enriqueta has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Enriqueta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like toilet bowl cleanser, lotion, soap powder, beauty soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 61 years old and married with two children.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a geneal store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Emma has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the geneal store for 21 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Emma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Riza is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Riza has a buy and sell coco lumber business in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more coco lumber to sell.

Riza has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Riza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coco lumber to sell

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.en:
Purificacion is 59 years old and married with four children. Purificacion works very hard to provide for them.

Purificacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Purificacion has been in this business for 14 years. 

In the future, Purificacion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.en:
Adolfo has been married for over 15 years and he is father of two little boys. They are going to school.

He is the owner of a house made of adobe. He and his family make cheese and they sell the cheese at many places.

Adolfo needs a loan to buy a milking cow. He wants to increase his milk production so he hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Ruth Marinela

texts.es: Ruth de 51 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposo y su hijo de 17 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que brinda sus servicios como encargada de limpieza y es así como ella le ha sacado adelante a su hijo y llevando los insumos básicos a su hogar,  además recibe el apoyo económico con algunas cosas del hogar de parte del esposo. Ruth desea realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda para poder brindarle mayor seguridad y privacidad a su familia por lo que quiere construir una pared, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillos, cemento, barrillas de hierro, grava, arena, etc., para realizar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ruth is 51 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and 17 year old son. She is a hard-working woman who provides cleaning services which have allowed her to support her son and buy basic goods for her home. She also receives financial support with some household things from her husband.

Ruth wants to make some home improvements in order to provide greater security and privacy for her family. She therefore wants to build a wall and is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy: bricks, cement, iron bars, gravel and sand in order to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy: bricks, cement, iron bars, gravel and sand in order to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Dynamic Women -  N20P5Đsơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huệ is 57 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling soft drinks for 5 years. Huệ lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is unstable.
The main hardship that Huệ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase and resell more soft drink items.

This is Huệ first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Before borrowing money from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, Hue just sold a few drinks because of her limited money. After joining Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, she uses her loan to raise the quantity of drinks she sells so that the income also increases.

Huệ is the group leader of N20P5ĐSơn, which consists of 3 members.
With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase and resell more soft drink items.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en casa propia, su comunidad se dedica en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el dsitrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

José se dedica a la agricultura, posee terreno propio donde cultiva café de la variedad Catimor, desde hace 5 años, en el caserio de Ahuyaca. Él necesita del crédito para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de sus fincas de café , lo que le va a permitir incrementar sus rendimientos, y asi poder tener una cosecha saludable y un producto de calidad, lo que permitirá aumentar sus ingresos ya que lo podrá ofrecer a un mejor precio, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old, and he lives in his own house with his spouse and his young son. His community is dedicated primarily to agriculture and livestock-raising. It is situated in the district of Colasay, in the Jaén Province and the Cajamarca Region of Peru's northern sierra.

José works in agriculture. He owns land where he has been growing the Catimor variety of coffee for five years. It is in the small village of Ahuyaca. He needs the loan for the purchase of compost and fertilizer for maintaining his coffee crops. This will allow him to increase his yields, and thus have a healthy crop and a quality product.

This will allow him to increase his income, as he will be able to offer a better price and improve his earnings, and therefore, his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer for maintaining his crop.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elvira is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Elvira has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for four years. In the future, Elvira would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Jessica works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell used shoes business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Jessica is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of used shoes to sell for her buy and sell used shoes business.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Horacio De Jesus

texts.en:
Horacio is 31 years old and lives in the municipality of Mariquita, in Antioquia. He lives with his partner and has had a fruit growing business since 2011. His father used to do the same job, so he was the one who taught Horacio everything about the business. His business confronts issues which are the high cost of the inputs and the high competition in the field.

He wants to improve his sales and to expand his growing, because he expects that his business can last in time. He also wants to optimize the production and development of his business. For that he needs to invest in it so he can achieve this. He asked for a loan so he can buy inputs for his passion fruit and avocado growing.

For Horacio, the quality of life of his family is very important, so he always intends to give them the best things. Right now the house where they are living isn’t in the best condition, so he wants to repair it. You can help this responsible man to achieve all his goals. A loan can do a lot for him.

loans.use: buy inputs for his passion fruit and avocado growing

loans.name: Dolorosa

texts.en:
Dolorosa is 52 years old and has six children. Dolorosa is married and has one child still in school.

Dolorosa is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Dolorosa requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Dolorosa has been in this business for 13 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dolorosa would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: San Felipe 2 Group

texts.en:
The southwest route that goes out of Guatemala City, passes through extraordinarily beautiful landscapes in the mountains that surround Lake Atitlan. This area also has many rivers that flow into the lake, as well as rivers that flow down into the Pacific Ocean. To the southwest of the lake in the State of Suchitepéquez, is the city of Patulul where the six members of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “San Felipe 2” reside. These motivated women are seeking their first loan from Friendship Bridge because they were referred to the organization since it can help with the development of their businesses.

Odra Jeaneth is a 28 year old married woman with two very precious children. She has a high school diploma. Odra wants to contribute more to her household’s income by expanding her small business that currently sells cakes. She sees the importance of having other bakery items like donuts.

Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy a deep fryer for donuts, molds, spatulas, blenders, containers to put the donuts in, and other products such as eggs, flour, sugar, and milk. Odra’s dream is to have place to sell her cakes and donuts. Much later, when she is generating a good income, she would like to have a store to sell clothing. She knows these dreams will only be achieved through hard work and investing her income wisely.

Thank you Kiva investors for helping to make the dreams of young Maya women like Odra come true!!! The members of “San Felipe 2” are also grateful for the help that improves the quality of life for their children so that they too can reach their dreams!

loans.use: to buy a deep fryer for donuts, molds, spatulas, blenders, containers to put the donuts in and other products such as eggs, flour, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Friendly And Diligent - 02Ylộcđlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hà is 45 years old and she is married with 3 children.
She has worked in agriculture raising pigs for 6 years.Hà lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is unstable because when some diseases on pigs happen, they could be dead so she has nothing to sell and she will be in trouble with finance. The main hardship that Hà faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase food for her pigs.
In 2013, Hà joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hà has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the 02YLộcĐLộc, which consists of 3 members.
With her business profit, Hà hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase food for her pigs.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a farmer from the town of Pilar, Bohol. She toils the land and grows rice. She is married woman with five dependents. Her oldest child is 18 and the youngest is 1. She has been farming rice for 3 years now.
Her husband earns a living by being a private driver. She needs capital to support her farming livelihood.

She  is asking for a loan  to buy farm supplies like fertilizers. These will improve the yield of her farm. Thus, it could enables her to pay her obligations and provide the needs of her children as well.

She is trying her very best to improve her farm to be successful and to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers

loans.name: Jeanefer

texts.en: Jeanefer is a sari-sari store owner. She is from San Dioninsio, Iloilo. She is 36 years old and a mother of two children ages nine and eight years old. Her husband works hard as a farmer and a part time motorcycle driver. Jeanefer is asking a loan to buy grocery items for her sari-sari store business such as canned goods, noodles, spices, diapers, eggs, cooking oil, laundry soap, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and juice, chocolate drink, chips, biscuits and candies. She also buys fertilizer for their rice farm. Perhaps, most people in their place own a farm which is their main source of income. Jeanefer wants to uplift their livelihood. She dreams in the future to have a grocery store not just a small sari-sari store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, diapers, eggs, cooking oil, laundry soap, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and juice, chocolate drink, chips, biscuits, candies and fertilizer

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 26 years old and has two children. Flordeliza is married and has one child in school.

Flordeliza is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock.

Flordeliza has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en:
Sebastián is a 41-year-old married man who lives in the municipality of Tierralta. He has five children: three beautiful daughters who are 16, 14, and 11 years old respectively and two sons who are 10 and 6 years old. He’s a hard working man who loves his family very much. He has owned a mechanical workshop since 2005, a job that he learned by himself.

He’s expecting to expand his business in the future, and to accomplish that he wants to invest in it so it can improve and become more successful. He wants to increase his profits so that the business can last in time. He asked for a loan so he can do some renovations to the location where he works and so that he can buy some inputs like tools and oil.

For this father, his family is the most important thing in his life. That’s the reason why he works hard and dreams big. He hopes that someday he can pay for the best education so they can succeed in life and won´t have to suffer much. You can help Sebastián with a loan and get him closer to achieving his dreams.

loans.use: to do some renovations to the location where he works and to buy some inputs like tools and oil.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 53 years old and with one child in school, Eleonor works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Eleonor has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Eleonor would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.en:
Angélica is a 43-year-old married woman who has two children, a boy and a girl. She lives with her family in the municipality of Cerete, where she’s been running a livestock raising business for more than ten years. She learned all that she knows by herself and she does it not only for the needs of her family but because she loves working in that field.

She trusts a lot in her capacities and works a lot for her family and for her business. She expects that with an investment she can increase her clients and offer more products. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy more pigs. She sees her business being successful and with a lot more to offer in comparison to nowadays.

Angélica has big dreams, and one of them is the possibility of someday leaving the business to her children, but only when successful. This devoted and responsible mother is expecting a little help so she can offer a better quality of life to her children. Help her with a loan.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
As a single parent of four children, Regina works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Regina is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to buy meat, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food vending business.

Regina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food vending business

loans.name: Bismona Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (ANDREA ISAURA,  ELSA JUANA y MARIBEL) de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace 9 meses, para obtener préstamo en Pana Pana. El nombre de Bismona, que tomaron para su grupo solidario es en representación de una comunidad mískita.

ANDREA ISAURA: Es integrante del grupo solidario es una señora amable, casada, tiene 31 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja como cadete de un taxi. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y tener su propia fuente de ingresos vende frijoles cocidos y carbón en un tramo que alquila en uno de los mercados del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Gracias a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA le han permitido poco a poco establecer una pequeña pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chiverías, bastimentos y mariscos. Ella sueña con tener el suficiente capital para establecer una tienda de ropa usada y venta de accesorios de acero.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of three women (Andrea Isaura, Elsa Juana y Maribel) who belong to the Miskita people from the city of Bilwi, municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are all enterprising women that work every day with the intention of making their small businesses grow. They started a communal bank nine months ago in order to receive a loan from Pana Pana. The group’s name, Bismona, honors a Miskita village.

Andrea Isaura is one of the members. She is a kind woman. She is 31 years old and married. She has three underage children. Her husband works driving a taxi. With the intention to contribute to the home expenses and have her own income, she sells cooked beans and coal in a place she rents at one of the markets of Puerto Cabezas. The loans she received before from Pana Pana, financed by Kiva, helped her to get ahead with her small grocery store, step by step.

She is requesting a loan to buy cereals, snacks, food products, and seafood. She dreams of having enough capital to open a store to sell used clothes and steel accessories.

loans.use: to buy cereals, snacks, food products and seafood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cleaning products for resale.

loans.name: Annastancia

texts.en:
Annastancia is 40 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for five years. She earns a monthly income of four thousand shillings. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock cabbages, tomatoes, Kales, bananas, water melons and onions. 


She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy stock cabbages, tomatoes, kale, bananas, water melons and onions.

loans.name: Marie Redempta

texts.en:
Marie is a first-year student at Kepler. She grew up with her mother and four siblings in Kigali, Rwanda's capital. After a rigorous application process based on grades, test scores, and personal interviews, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. She chose Kepler because of its academic rigor and reputation for job placement. 

Marie plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate from Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. After graduating, she wants to pursue an MBA and found her own company. At Kepler, she hopes to refine her skills in technology, while approaching everything she does with determination and flexibility.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Cupboard Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Mabinty is a member of “Cupboard” solidarity group. She sells palm oil. Mabinty has been in the palm oil business for the past eight years. She uses proceeds of her business to pay for her child’s education and to provide livelihood for hers family. Mabinty is on the left of the group picture.

Mabinty and other group members of Cupboard solidarity are requesting for their first loan of 4,000,000SLL. Of this amount, Mabinty will personally receive 1,000,000SLL which she will use to purchase more 7 jerry can of palm oil for her business.

Mabinty is forty-eight year, divorced and has a cheerful family of four children. She hopes that her business continues to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and also prepare for her old age. Mabinty hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family
Mabinty and her group members thank you for financing their businesses

loans.use: to purchase more 7 jerry can of palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Snehalata

texts.en:
Snehalata is a 41-year-old widowed woman who lives in a small village of Odisha, India, with her 13-year-old son. Her son goes to school. For the last 10 years, Snehalata has owned a grocery store where she sells daily household items and cold drinks and serves tea, coffee, breakfast, and snacks to her customers. From this activity she earned 6,000 INR per month, which was not sufficient for her household expenses as her son went to a public school and his school fees are higher.

She wanted to work more than her regular working hours because she wanted to make her son educated. She wanted to start a food stall with her grocery shop so that she could make more money and the additional money would help her to pay more for her son's education.

Snehalata is requesting for a loan of 36,000 INR to purchase a gas stove, gas connection, and raw material for her food stall. The loan amount will help her to get her desired items and made her earn more. The additional income will help her pay the school fees of her son without any default. She is very thankful to Kiva and People's Forum for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase a gas stove, gas connection, and raw material for her food stall.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 26-year-old businesswoman. She is a married mother of one and she lives in the Nyaminyami district of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully buying and selling clothes and is being assisted by her family members. She started the business to provide for her family. She wanted to raise school fees for herself and her sisters.

Charity sells pants, blankets and assorted shoes. With the requested loan she intends to make bulk purchases of clothes and become a viable supplier of clothes in her community. When Charity is not working at the flea market, she is doing volunteer work including cleaning the school yard, the clinic and sometimes community parks.Charity was buying fish and selling in bulk. When she received the loan the business was down since her husband has been ill for a long time. She used some of the profits to pay for her husband’s medication and general fees for her child. With the rest of the profits, she bought cement and paid someone to plaster her house. She is using the profits to meet all family needs since her husband lost his job due to the long-time illness and she sometimes buys groceries for her parents. She needs to acquire a passport and buy clothes from neighboring countries since buying in Harare is expensive. She also intends to supplement and pass her Ordinary Levels. She desires to get a second loan for her further expansion of her loan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Bishakha

texts.en:
Bishakha is 37 years old and lives in a remote village in Khagrabari. She lives with her husband Amal and their only son. Bishakha could not receive further education after grade 7 because of her parents' inadequate resources. Her husband is illiterate but knows to sign his name. He has been a Toto (a kind of battery operated auto rickshaw) driver and his earnings are hardly enough to cover the educational expenses of their son after managing the household expenses.

Bishakha’s son 24 year old Mrityunjay is completing his Bachelor of Arts degree (B.A) from B.T. Evening College. He is now in the second year and being a very average student, he needs the guidance of private tutors very badly, but his parents are unable to provide that support. His parents are struggling to keep their son in college despite their meager income.

Hearing of BJS (Kiva’s partner), Bishakha applied for a loan from them so that her diligent son Mrityunjay can continue his education without any obstacle. With the loan, Bishakha wants to pay the private tuition fees and buy the necessary supplies to let her son precede a step further towards achieving good skills and knowledge.

Bishakha and Mrityunjay (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to provide her son an uninterrupted education to the level of graduation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Shania Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Shania, está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (EMELY, MARLENE y NINSKA IVANNIA), viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace año y medio, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

NINSKA IVANNIA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es señora luchadora de 32 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita, madre soltera de 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia y tener una fuente de ingresos, vende ropa nueva y accesorios de acero en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de la Ciudad de Bilwi. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua camisas, ropa interior y pantalones para hombres y mujeres, entre otros productos. Ella sueña en construir su vivienda de concreto, por mayor seguridad y durabilidad para su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Shania is comprised of three enterprising women (Emely, Marlene and Ninska Ivannia). They live in the city of Bilwi. A year and a half ago, they came together with the intention of working as one and to have access to loans from Pana Pana. This would help them to increase the stock levels of their small businesses, improve their income, and in that way improve, little by little, their families’ living conditions.

Ninska Ivannia is one of the group members. She is a fighter. She is 32 years old and belongs to the Miskita people. She is a single mother and has three teenage children that go to primary and secondary school. Thinking of getting ahead with her family and having a source of income, she started selling clothes and steel accessories in a place she owns at one of the marketplaces of the city of Bilwi.

She is requesting a loan to buy shirts, underwear, and pants for men and women, among other products. She will buy them in Managua.

Her dream is to build a concrete house for her family. Such a house would be safer and more durable.

loans.use: to buy shirts, underwear and pants for men and women, among other products.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg 2-G Group

texts.en:
Tapa is 49 years old and a widow who lives in a small village of Odisha, India, with her two sons who are 26 and 23 years old. Her elder son works in a private company as a clerk and her younger son goes to the university.

She owns a variety store where she sells personal care products, modern fashion items, gifts items, and stationery items. She earns 8,000 INR per month from this activity. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman. She keeps her shop open from 7 am to 10 pm daily. She is the one standing to the right hand side in the photograph.

Tapa wanted to expand her business by adding more varieties of personal care products and gift items, and for this she, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner, People's Forum. Every time the customers ask her for new types of gift items, so this loan will help her to maintain a broad range of gift items in her store and meet the demands of the customers and make them delighted.

loans.use: to expand her business by adding more varieties of personal care products and gift items

loans.name: Paril

texts.en:
38-year-old Paril is the mother of three children (two daughters and a son). She lives in a small village of Falakata. Her first priority in life is to provide a good education to her children. Two of her daughters are married and one son reads in grade 8. Her husband is engaged in agribusiness. His income varies with the season.

Paril is a housewife. Her son Koushik is a student of grade 8. He is 14 year old and reads in Barasoulmari Junior High School. Paril is facing difficulty in covering her son's educational expenses.

Koushik is sincere about his studies and school curriculum. If he is provided with proper guidance, he can perform well in his examination. Paril has been unable to take care of all the things her son needs to continue his studies.

Thus as a responsible mother, Paril applied for an educational loan. She thanks BJS (Kiva’s partner) for helping her; this loan amount will resolve her anxiety. She will use the loan to buy educational materials and engage a private tutor for her son Koushil.

Paril hopes this educational support will give a boost to her son’s education, so Paril and Koushik (in the picture) are now very happy after getting the loan and are thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to bear the educational expenses of her son’s uninterrupted schooling.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son mujeres luchadoras que se reúnen para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida y la de sus familias. 
La Sra. Liz, es una  las integrantes quien se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de productos artesanales, como ser los bijouteries, por medio de su trabajo tiene un pequeño ingreso para poder ayudar a su familia.
Liz pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus bijouteries, como hilos, pinzas, canutillos, y perlas, y de esa forma poder seguir con su emprendimiento para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
This group is part of a program to eliminate poverty. They are hard-working women who have joined together to improve their own and their families' living conditions.

Liz, one of the members, is in the business of making and selling crafts, such as jewelry. Through her work, she earns a small income with which she can help her family.
Liz is requesting this loan so that she can buy supplies for making jewelry, such as thread, pliers, seed beads, and pearls. That way she can continue with her business and help her loved ones through her work.

loans.use: buy supplies to make jewelry

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en: Raymundo is from the municipality of Talibon, Bohol. He is married with three children ages 5, 9 and 11. For a year now, he has been operating a chainsaw service business. He also fish for a living. He is asking a loan to buy a new fishing boat and hard wood. With these, he can increase productivity of his fishing ventures. Raymundo persevere because he want his children to finish their studies. His income will be for family daily consumption and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and hard wood

loans.name: Maria Verniza

texts.en:
Maria Verniza sold load to smart subscribers in her place.  She is  32 years old woman with two young children. It has been 5 years now that she sold prepaid load to the local in the community. 
In addition to that, she goes farming, she grows and sells rice.

Maria Verniza has requested a loan  to purchase  additional prepaid load and fertilizers for the farm. These will enables her to continue sold  load his customers and able to earn for a living. Her farm will also produce better yield also. Thus, she could start to pay her obligations and handle her finances wisely.


She is grateful for availing the funds, and these will improve her both sources of income that could lead her to have better living condition and also continue support the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to purchase  additional prepaid load and fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna of Buhangin, Davao City is a direct selling representative who sells Avon and Personal Collection products. She is married to Efren, a construction worker, and they have children who are studying in college and high school. Her husband’s job is occasional and his income cannot suffice for their everyday expenses and children’s education. This is the reason why Lorna aspires to improve her business with the aid of additional capital amounting to 8,000 PHP. She will use it to buy more Avon and Personal Collection products that she can sell to her friends, neighbors and other network. She’s positive that this additional capital will give her more profit to support their everyday expenses. Her dream is to have a stable space or a showroom for her business someday. 

Direct selling business is common in the Philippines especially for housewives who want to be productive and are willing to supplement the lack of family resources. Working people who want to earn extra money usually engage in this business also. It’s easy to venture into direct selling business since it typically requires low capital to begin with. The entrepreneur or direct selling representative will enhance the business by expanding her network and target consumers and proper rolling of capital.

Lorna also desires for a good future for her children and harmonious relationship among her family. She wants her family to serve the Lord inside and outside the church. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy personal and home products from Avon and Personal Collection

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel, 34, wishes to have better living conditions someday. That is why she works hard and saves little by little in order to expand her variety store business in their area in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. The people in Richel's community are quite familiar with each other, and when her neighbors ask for credit for her goods, she cannot refuse them. Sometimes it depletes her capital.

As of now, Richel needs additional capital of PhP 8,000 for her business. She will use it to buy more items for her inventory which will improve her profit and enable her to extend the blessings to her parents and siblings.
