She is single, but her responsibilities to her family cannot be underestimated. Richel is praying that you will be one of God’s instruments to help her. She would really appreciate your kind support.   

Richel is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty, and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her inventory

loans.name: Daylin

texts.en:
Daylin is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Daylin is 40 years old and has four children are presently in school.

Daylin has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. Daylin requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for manicure and pedicure services.

Daylin has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for manicure and pedicure services

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 56 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Cecelia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, vegetable, and other groceries.

Cecelia has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future, Cecelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, vegetable, and other groceries

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old and has seven children. Elizabeth is married and has four children are currently in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, farming sugar cane in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 34 years old and married with one child. Florence works very hard to provide for them.

Florence runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy more items of groceries to sell such as milk, canned goods, noodles, spices, sugar, eggs, bread, drinks, snack foods, and etc.

Florence has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future Florence would like to save money to provide and secure for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items of groceries to sell such as milk, canned goods, noodles, spices, sugar, eggs, bread, drinks, snack foods, and etc

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and married with five children. Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Teresita has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy vegetables, meats, breads, dairy products, and more

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Virgen del carmen ” está luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, todo a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que se esfuerzan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gabriela, integra este grupo, quien se dedica al humilde trabajo de venta de plantas, comenta que su sueño es poder tener un vivero grande donde pueda vender más variedad de plantas. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha y se esfuerza por sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de plantas para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando para poder esforzarse para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Virgen del carmen" group is fighting to improve their loved ones' living conditions through a program designed to eliminate poverty. These hard working women are striving to get ahead.

One of the members is Gabriela, who is in the humble business of selling plants. She said that her dream was to have a greenhouse where she could sell a greater variety of plants. She's a woman who has sacrificed a great deal and works hard for her loved ones. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy more plants to sell, keep up her business, and continue to fight to help her family.

loans.use: buy plants for sale

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
This is Fely from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She is 50 years old, single, who carries many responsibilities for her siblings, nephews and nieces. She extends financial assistance to them regularly. They are the reason for her perseverance, as she doesn’t want to work for herself alone.

She runs a “sari-sari” or variety store that sells the usual commodities like eggs, bread, repacked condiments, toiletries and many other things. She includes retailing of rice in her inventory for additional income. Her income provides for her everyday needs and financial assistance for her relatives. She knows that the competition is stiff and profits are irregular, hence Fely wants to strengthen her business even more.

She is requesting a PHP 28,000 loan to buy sacks of rice and beverages to further improve her inventory.

Her nephews and nieces are expecting from her because they know that she has no children to support. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and beverages for her variety store

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a zealous member of CCT Credit Cooperative for almost seven years, Rosemarie gains good values on entrepreneurship that she applies to her business as a rice retailer.

She has some problems on delayed payments by her customers, but she can still manage her business well through proper application of capital. Although of course, her family’s daily sustenance and her children’s everyday allowances are affected by these long time debts. She has been very considerate to her debtors, but she needs to maintain her business, too.

This is why Rosemarie wants to borrow additional capital of PhP 16,000 to buy more sacks of rice.

This will bring extra profit for her and will help provide for their daily needs and the children’s education. Later on, she will add another source of income, which is hog-fattening. She and her husband, Jorine, a contractor, both work hard in order to see their children finish their schooling.

She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through sharing of experiences and study of the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Shella Mae

texts.en:
This is Shella Mae, 23 years old; she married to Arnel, a construction worker, and they are still praying for a child. As of now, Shella Mae focuses her attention in developing her variety store business. She just started her business two years ago; that is why she aims to improve it more. She faces stiff competition in their area in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo.

She plans to add more supplies to expand her inventory and attract more buyers. A loan worth PhP 15,000 would be enough for this purpose.

She can roll this capital wisely to generate more income. She hopes that if their first child arrives, she has enough money to provide for his/her needs and some savings for educational expenses.

She also aspires to build their own house, a typical dream of a starting couple.

She shares her experiences and aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to add more supplies to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additional types of drinks, sugar, spoons, and milk

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Luis is a young and single man.  He lives with his father and helps his family make cheese.  His father taught him well about the business and Luis is doing his best.  Luis needs a loan to buy a milking cow.  The animal will be his property but he will work at his father's farm.  Luis would like to have his own farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.es:
La Sra. Wilfrida es dueña de un copetín, por medio de su trabajo cría a sus hijos, y les da una vida digna y sin privaciones, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en comprar insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas, lo cual le ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide de este nuevo préstamo ya que quiere comprar bebidas, golosinas y otros productos variados para poder seguir con sus ventas y también para poder seguir creciendo en el emprendimiento que tiene.
texts.en:
Wilfrida owns a snack shop, and through her work she is raising her children in a dignified life, free of deprivation. She says that she used her previous loan to buy supplies to keep her sales running, and it's been a great help.

Today she is requesting a new loan which she will use to buy drinks, sweets, and more products to sell. This will help her keep running and growing her business.

loans.use: buy drinks, sweets, and other items

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de San Pedro, tienen 17 integrantes, son mujeres luchadoras que se esfuerzan para poder dar a sus seres queridos una mejor vida y ayudarles a no pasar por privaciones.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Tomasa, quien trabaja como comerciante, trae artículos diversos para la venta, y con su negocio está esforzándose para mejorar poco a poco sus condiciones de vid ay la de sus seres queridos.
Tomasa pide este préstamo para poder comprar comestibles, bebidas y otros, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir creciendo y ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of San Pedro. It has 17 members, all hard-working women who are struggling to provide their loved ones with a better life and see to it that they don't suffer from want.

One of the members is Tomasa, who works as a vendor. She takes various items to market, and through her business, she is improving her living conditions and those of her loved ones little by little.

Tomasa is requesting this loan so that she can buy foods, beverages, and more. This will help her to keep growing her business and helping her loved ones.

loans.use: buy foods, drinks, and more

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 38 years old and has four children. Gloria is married and has three children are currently in school.

Gloria is in the agricultural business, farming sugar cane in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gloria has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mantu

texts.en:
Mantu, 45, is a differently abled man from a small village of Nabarang Pur district, Odisha, India. He has a small family comprising his wife and two sons, who are currently pursuing their studies in secondary school. Mantu, being a very ambitious and industrious man, never broke down. He faced all the problems and hurdles in his life very sportively.

He owns a laundry shop and has experience of 12 years in this profession. He is the only breadwinner in the family, and he works very hard in order to meet and fulfill all the needs of his family. Mantu's laundry shop is in a very miserable condition due to long years of wear and tear, and his shop seriously needs repair.

Therefore, Mantu is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR to repair and remodel his laundry shop so that he can continue his work smoothly and enjoy a happy living with his family. Mantu is eagerly awaiting your kind support.

loans.use: to repair and remodel his laundry shop.

loans.name: Durgarani

texts.en:
Durgarani, 34, is a widow who hails from a small and remote village of Nabarangpur district, Odisha, India. She has two sons in her care who are studying in primary school. Durgarani faced a lot of difficulties after the death of her husband. Life was not easy for her after her husband's demise. But her strong willpower and determination made her self-independent, and she started her grocery business.

The income that she generates from her grocery shop is used to meet the daily household needs, fulfill the basic requirements of her children, and pay the house rent where she resides.

Durgarani is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR to purchase additional stock for her grocery shop such as biscuits, bread, jams, pickles, walnuts, chips, and beverages. The loan amount will help her in matching the customers' demand with her supply, and thus enhance her cash flow so that she can enjoy a better standard of living.

Durgarani is in dire need of your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her grocery shop such as biscuits, bread, jams, pickles, walnuts, chips, and beverages.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, etc for her restaurant business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Ram Pyari

texts.en: Mrs. Ram Pyari is a resident of Badikhel Lalitpur where she is engaged in small tea shop where she sells tea, coffee and tiffin for the local people. She has two kids of age 14 and 12. She started this business 15 years back and is still doing well to sustain her family. They are working hard in the shop from the very morning for the whole day 10 to 12 hours daily. It is her first loan from BPW.

loans.use: to invest in food stuffs for her cafe and tiffin shop.

loans.name: Om Kumari

texts.en:
Om Kumari is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supported her family.

She has started one more work in her free time of farming, which is bamboo work. She makes different items of bamboo. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizers for the farm and in addition supplies of bamboo, for bamboo work

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Isidro está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty, la cual es una zona que aún se encuentra en crecimiento.  Por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Francisca es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su pequeño trabajo de negocio de despensa, tiene todo tipo de productos y está luchando para poder mejorar su emprendimiento, y dar lo mejor a sus seres queridos. Francisca es una mujer luchadora que pese a los obstáculos ha logrado salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser carnes, panificados, bebidas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The group San Isidro is in its first cycle of the women's committee program. It is in the city of Curuguaty, which is an area that is still developing. For that reason, the members of this group are determined to improve their conditions in life and those of their loved ones.

Francisca is one of the members. She has her own small store that has all kinds of products and she is determined to be able to improve her business, and give the best to her loved ones. Francisca is a brave woman and who despite obstacles, has managed to get by.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies for her store, like meats, breads, and drinks, so she can keep her sales up as they are. She is thankful for this opportunity she has to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy meats, baked goods, drinks, and other consumables to sell.

loans.name: Gul'niso

texts.ru: Гульнисо проживает на районе Хуросон. Гульнисо мать троих детей. Муж работает учителем в средней школе. Гульнисо занимается в родном районе животноводством. Она 4 года своей жизни занимается этой деятельностью. Бахтинисо любит домашних животных, по этой причине она занимается животноводством. Ей в деятельности нравится доить коров и обеспечивать семью молоком и молочными продуктами. Гулнисо хочет отремонтировать дом и жить комфортно и уютно. Она добрая и заботливая мать. Гульнисо любить своих детей, и хочет улучшить их условия жизни. Из-за нехватки денег она обратилась за кредитом.  В будущем за счет дохода от животноводства Гульнисо планирует увеличить поголовье скота. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Gul'niso lives in the Khuroson district of Tajikistan.  She is the mother of three children.  Her husband works as a teacher in a secondary school.  Gul'niso herself has been involved in animal husbandry for the past four years of her life, and she works in her native district.  She loves domestic animals, which is the reason why she chose to raise livestock.  She particularly enjoys milking her cows, thus providing her family with milk and dairy products.

Gul'niso wants to renovate her house and to live well and comfortably.  She is a kind and caring mother.  She truly loves her children and she wants to improve their living environment.  She is taking this loan due to a lack of personal resources.  In the future, she is planning to use the income she makes from animal husbandry to increase her livestock headcount.  She is hoping to receive your support.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elvira is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

Elvira has a buy and sell scrap business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Elvira has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell

loans.name: Alvarez

texts.en:
Alvarez is 35 years old, married with three children.

Alvarez works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy more items of groceries to sell such as milk, canned goods, noodles, spices, sugar, eggs, bread, drinks, snack foods, and etc.

Alvarez has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Alvarez aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items of groceries to sell such as milk, canned goods, noodles, spices, sugar, eggs, bread, drinks, snack foods, and etc

loans.name: Lea Jean

texts.en:
Lea Jean is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lea Jean is 21 years old and has one child still in school.

Lea Jean has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. Lea Jean requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy gasoline, spare parts and maintenance for her motorcycle transportation.

Lea Jean has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save money to provide and secure for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and maintenance for her motorcycle transportation

loans.name: Leizl

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Leizl works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Leizl is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Leizl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 42 years old and married with one child. Mary Jean works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jean runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy more items of groceries to sell such as milk, canned goods, noodles, spices, sugar, eggs, bread, drinks, snack foods, and etc.

Mary Jean has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items of groceries to sell such as milk, canned goods, noodles, spices, sugar, eggs, bread, drinks, snack foods, and etc

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Charito works hard to support her family.

She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a furniture-making shop. Charito is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Charito has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Noreta

texts.en:
Noreta is 51 years old and married with nine children. With four children in school, Noreta works very hard to provide for them.

Noreta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Noreta has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Noreta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, condiments, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: P.alvin

texts.en:
P.Alvin, 22, is a differently abled married lady from a small village of Nabarangpur district, Odisha, India. She is a tailor by profession, and her husband works as a carpenter. She has a small son in her care. She has as her source of work the creation of all types of articles of clothing, which she does in the workshop of a neighbour in the neighbourhood where she lives.

P.Alvin is requesting a loan amount of 25,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine, which she needs to be able to fulfill the requests of her customers.

She has a future plan to implement her own sewing shop in her house and continue offering a better quality of life to her son.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, which she needs to be able to fulfill the requests of her customers.

loans.name: Krishna Kumari

texts.en: Mrs. Krishna Kumari is a 53 yrs old married woman with 4 children. She has a farm and she works in the fields for 8 hrs a day and 7 days a week. But she gets free time some days for a few hours, which she utilizes in bamboo weaving work to make different items. Her main occupation is seasonal vegetable farming and with this she is supporting her family. it is her first loan from BPW.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and on free time, additional bamboo weaving

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
La socia Libia pertenece al banco comunal MARIA ELENA MOYANO.
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros, la socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia sigue vendiendo faros, entre otros a sus clientes, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar parabrisas entre otros.
texts.en:
Libia is a member of the Maria Elena Moyano communal bank. She continues making her living selling auto parts. She sells headlights to her customers, among other things. She has had her business for a good while, and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.

She is grateful for the support she will receive, and promises to comply in a disciplined manner with the required loan payments. Through her business she is moving her family forward. She seeks a loan to buy windshield wipers, among other things.

loans.use: to buy windshield wipers, among other things.

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru: Вера досрочно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Она установила пластиковые окна в квартире, подреставрировала стены. Вера вновь обратилась в Банк "Бай Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом для проведения ремонтных работ в остальных комнатах, утепление спальни. Свои доходы Вера будет вкладывать в образование ее внуков, так как именно они ее главная ценность в жизни.
texts.en:
Vera repaid her previous loan on time, after using it for its intended purpose.  She is thankful to Kiva and to all the lenders who helped her obtain this financing.  She was able to install vinyl windows in her apartment and to repair her walls.

Vera has once again contacted Bai Tushum and she is now taking a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to perform renovation works in other rooms and install a heating system in her bedroom.  She intends to use her income to pay for her grand-children's education, as they are what is most important to her in this life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to insulate and renovate her apartment.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia Josefina  pertenece al banco comunal MARIA ELENA MOYANO.
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia sigue elaborando desayunos, almuerzo y cena para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, menestras entre otros.
texts.en:
Josefina belongs to the "Maria Elena Moyano" communal bank.  
She is still making her living with a restaurant.  Josefina is grateful for the help she will be receiving, and she promises to be diligent in repaying her loan. 
Josefina is a responsible, hard-working person who makes breakfasts, lunches and dinners for the customers who order from her.  That is how she is able to get her family ahead. 
Josefina is requesting the loan to purchase rice, vegetable stews and other items.

loans.use: to purchase rice, vegetable stews and other items.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi is a 38-year-old married woman with four children. She has buffaloes. Normally she works eight hours a day and seven days a week.

But, she gets free time some days and some hours, which she utilizes in bamboo knitting work to make different items when she has time off from keeping the buffaloes. With her bamboo work in her free time and keeping buffaloes, she is supporting her family.

This is her first loan from BPW.

loans.use: to buy food and medicine for her buffalo and bamboo for her free-time work.

loans.name: Almagul

texts.ru: Алмагуль, 50 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает волонтером, также занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая люцерну на 3,60 ГА собственной земли картофель, люцерну и пшеницу. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 3 овцы. Ежемесячный доход Алмагуль около 5,600 сом (KGS). Алмагуль решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Алмагуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, что поможет ей улучшить благосостояние семьи и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Almagul is 50, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a college education and does volunteer work.  She is also involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, growing alfalfa, potatoes and wheat on 3.6 hectares of her own land.  She also has two cows and three sheep on her farm.  She makes a monthly income of about 5,600 som (KGS).

Almagul has decided to turn to Bai Tushum to request a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy animal feed and some livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her business, which will help her to improve her family's well-being and to save some money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Rocio Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia Roció Alejandra pertenece al banco comunal MARIA ELENA MOYANO, la socia sigue dedicándose  a  trabajar en un jardín para niños, la socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de papeles, colores, plumones entre otros.
texts.en:
Roció Alejandra belongs to the "Maria Elena Moyano" communal bank. She is still making her living working in a kindergarten. She is grateful for the help she will be given and promises to be disciplined in repaying her loan. Roció is a responsible and hard-working person, which is how she gets her family ahead.
Roció is requesting the loan to purchase paper, colored pencils, markers and other items.

loans.use: to purchase paper, colored pencils, markers and other items.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix raises and sells hogs to support his family. He has been raising hogs for 15 years now. Aside from hog raising he also farms; he grows and sells rice. Felix is a 56 year old married man with five grown children. Together with his family, he lives in the town Sagbayan, Bohol.

Felix is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and fertilizer for the farm. He then could raise quality pigs and sell them in a few months to come. His farm will have a higher harvest and this could augment his earnings. Thus Felix could purchase nutritious meals and settle his obligations.

In the future, Felix is aiming to have better income by expanding both sources of his income for sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 69 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

loans.name: Yanett Dionisia

texts.es:
La socia Yanett Dionisia pertenece al banco comunal MARIA ELENA MOYANO.
La socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de plata, la socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas, a la vez la socia continua ejerciendo su carrera de enfermera, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de anillos entre otros.
texts.en:
Yanett Dionisia is a member of the communal bank Maria Elena Moyano.

She continues to work in her business selling silver. She is grateful for the support to be granted and likewise agrees to comply in a disciplined manner with the loan payments. At the same time she will continue working as a nurse; she is a responsible person, and this is the way she helps her family get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy rings and other items.

loans.use: buy rings and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in wholesale corn in order to increase her income and meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Carmen Rosa continua con su negocio de venta de desayunos como quinua con leche, leche, quinua con manzana, entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia. 
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de quinua, azúcar, entre otros.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
 Los socios en general  agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco District, which is a part of Cusco Province and Cusco Department.
The member Carmen Rosa still has her business selling breakfasts, such as quinoa with milk, milk, quinoa and apples and other dishes that her customers ask her for.  She is a responsible, hard-working person.  She has had her business for quite some time, and it brings her personal satisfaction because it is how she is able to get her family ahead. 
Carmen is requesting the loan to purchase quinoa, sugar and other items. 
The member whose photo is inset came to the meeting late because she had to work. 
All of the communal bank members are grateful for those who are forming a part of their dreams through the loan, and they promise to comply with the established repayment plan. 
The person whose face is covered with a white circle is not a member of the communal bank.

loans.use: to purchase quinoa, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Los Leones De Umamarca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS LEONES DE UMAMARCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Modesta ella es conviviente y tiene 46 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Los Leones de Umamarca" communal bank. This bank is located in the Paucartambo district, which belongs to the Paucartambo province and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Modesta. She is in a relationship and is 46 years old with 3 children. She works in a business that sells cereals. She sells corn, wheat, and quinoa. She works from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening. She is an enterprising and hard working woman, who, through this business, takes her children forward. Her dream is to have a location where she can sell the cereals. She requests the loan to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

The other members are dedicated to selling animals, selling cereals, running a grocery store, and selling food.

Mrs. Modesta is thankful to those who make up part of this dream through this venue, and she promises to make her repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Slow But Sure Group

texts.en:
Dora is a member of Slow but Sure Solidarity Group. She is married with three children. In the group picture, Dora is on the left of the picture.

Fourteen years ago Dora established her drinks and pure water business to support herself and her children's school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food from the profit she gets from the business. She sells 6 days per week from 9am to 6pm.
Dora plans to use the loan to buy an additional five crates of soft drinks, five bundles of rubbers (drinks containers) and bundles of pure water for resale. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account which will be used in developing herself.

Dora and her group members need a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL of which she is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL.

Dora plans to build a house and live a happy life.

Dora and the rest of the group members thank you for your support

loans.use: to buy an additional five crates of soft drinks, five bundles of rubbers (drinks containers) and bundles of pure water to sell.

loans.name: Kamu-Kamu Kasambya Group

texts.en:
Senyonjo is a resident of Kagadi-Uganda, aged 44 years, married and a mother of five children. Senyonjo is very honest and hardworking. Senyonjo operates a restaurant, a business she established in 2002 for family support and maintenance. Senyonjo supplements her business with income from farming.

Senyonjo is a member of a group where they do not pledge collateral to access loans. Senyonjo needs a loan to buy foods like bananas, rice, and sodas to sell. She has plans of educating her children so she can have an organized family. Senyonjo faces challenges of food-price fluctuations and few customers at times, reducing her projected incomes.

loans.use: to buy foods like bananas, rice, and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Las Ñustas De Quillarumiyoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal LAS ÑUSTAS DE QUILLARUMIYOC, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ancahuasi,provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eusebia ella es soltera y tiene 37 años y tiene 3 hijos La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganaderia, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank Las Ñustas De Quillarmiyoc. The bank is located in the district of Ancahuasai, in the Anta province in the department of Cusco.

One member is Eusebia. She is single and is 37 years old and has 3 children. She works in her business of cattle farming. She fattens and raises the cattle and then she sells them at different markets. Eusebia works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. Through this work, she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her business selling cattle. She is requesting a loan to buy cattle.

The other members earn a living selling animals, raising cattle, running a grocery store, and running a restaurant. Eusebia thank those that form a part of this dream through Kiva, and commits to make the payments as established.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: La Gran Alianza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA GRAN ALIANZA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luisa, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los socios en general  agradecen  el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas
texts.en:
The members belong to "La Gran Alianza" (The Great Alliance) communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

One member, Luisa, alternates her daily activities. She is dedicated to a grocery store business. She brings a good attitude to this business, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into the business everyday. She is a responsible and diligent person. She wants to be able to continue working, since this helps her support her family.

She requests the loan to buy rice and sugar, among other things.

The members in general are thankful for the loan offered, and they promise to make their repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Hermelita

texts.en:
Hermelita is encouraged that she was previously granted a loan for the first time. Its proceeds have certainly helped sustain her buying and selling of various gadgets. She is thankful that her business income helped send her children to school. In a third world country like the Philippines, education is their hope for better opportunities to improve their quality of living.

To help Hermelita continue her business she is again hoping to avail of a Php 35,000 loan to pay for units of cellphones, laptops, tablets and digital cameras to sell. Her only challenge is at times difficulty in collecting payments from some of her customers who buy on credit, but she is happy that her customers are increasing in number.

Hermelita's dream is to grow her business and own a store to display her products. She aims to send both her children to college. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for various gadgets, such as cellphones, tablets and laptops, to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Carmelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell school supplies business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling multivitamins and medicines. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of school supplies to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of school supplies to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 44 years old and has three children. Erlinda is married and one of her children is still in school.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. Erlinda has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de Jesús es un caficultor del norte de Nicaragua. Vive en su pequeña finca con su compañera. Muy contento, este pequeño productor dice que en los últimos 3 años la producción de su café ha presentado un incremento pasando de 18 a 70 quintales pergamino. 

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que le permitan darle un adecuado mantenimiento a su cafetal y continuar mejorando los rendimientos y calidad de su café. 

Su sueño es incrementar las áreas productivas de café en los próximos años, y tener una mayor producción para poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones, porque está seguro que este rubro tiene un gran potencial económico.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesús is a coffee grower from northern Nicaragua. He lives on his small plantation with his partner. This small producer is very pleased to say that over the past 3 years his coffee production has increased from 18 to 70 quintals of parchment coffee.

For this cycle, he is requesting a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers which will allow him to maintain his coffee plantation adequately, while continuing to improve his yield and the quality of his coffee.

His dream is to increase the coffee producing areas in the coming years, and to have a greater yield in order to be able to give his family better living conditions, because he is certain that this plan has great financial promise.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es:
Marlon, con 29 años de edad y con 5 años dedicados a la caficultura, vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. La producción de café es la principal actividad económica de Marlon y su familia. Su finca es manejada bajo criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo.

Este pequeño productor señala que en los 3 años anteriores su producción de café ha presentado un aumento significativo, hasta de un 90 por ciento, y para seguir mejorando la productividad de su finca está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos y abonos que requiere su cafetal.

Su sueño es seguir incrementando su producción a través de un aumento en rendimiento y áreas establecidas, para ello menciona que el principal desafío es la falta de recursos que le permitan hacer una inversión a mediano plazo, sin embargo confía en que a través de organizaciones como PAC pueda acceder a este tipo de recursos más adelante, para continuar mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marlon is 29 years old and has spent 5 years dedicated to growing coffee. He lives in a community in the north of Nicaragua. Coffee production is Marlon and his family's main work. Their farm is certified Fair Trade.

This small producer notes that in the 3 previous years, his coffee production has increased a lot--by 90%. To continue improving his farm's production, he is requesting a loan to buy supplies and manure that his coffee crop needs.

His dream is to continue growing his production through an increase in efficiency and established areas. For this, he says that his main challenge is the lack of resources to make a medium-sized investment. Nonetheless, he says that through organizations like PAC, he will be able to get this type of resources faster, so that he can continue improving his and his family's lives.

loans.use: to buy supplies and manure for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL COPACABANA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Ghina, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de refrigerios para los distintos clientes que le solicitan como jardines, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua trabajando conjuntamente con su mama, la socia lleva buen tiempo con el negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para preparar los refrigerios.
Los socios en general agradecen a quienes  forman parte de este sueño  y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
El socio que sale adjunto a la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde a  la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Virgen del Copacabana" communal bank. The bank is located in Cusco District, which is in Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

The member Sra. Ghina still has her business selling snacks to different customers, like kindergartners. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She still works together with her mother, and she has been in the business for quite some time. Her works brings her personal satisfaction. She hopes to be able to keep working so she can keep supporting her family.

Sra. Ghina is requesting the loan to purchase supplies for making snacks.

All of the communal bank members are grateful to those who are forming a part of their dream through the loan, and they promise to comply with their established repayment plan.

The member whose photo is inset was given permission to come late to the meeting because he had to work.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

loans.name: Norma Elena

texts.es:
Norma tiene 26 años de edad y es madre de 3 hijos. Vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua, donde existen condiciones climáticas favorables para la producción de café, rubro al que junto a su familia se dedica desde hace 5 años; aunque desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron el amor a la agricultura y siempre han dependido de la caficultura como principal fuente recursos.

La producción de café de esta emprendedora ha venido mejorando en los últimos tres años, y para mantener este incremento ella está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos y fertilizantes que necesita su cafetal, para tener una buena producción en este ciclo y con ello garantizar los ingresos para su familia, la cual es la prioridad para esta emprendedora que día a día se esfuerza para darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.ue
texts.en:
Norma, 26, is the mother of three children. She lives in a community in the north of Nicaragua where favorable climatic conditions for the production of coffee exist. She has been making a living in this line of work with her family for five years. When she was little, her parents taught her the love of agriculture and they have always depended on coffee cultivation as a principal source of income.
The coffee production of this enterprising woman has been improving in the last three years. In order to maintain this increase, she is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy the supplies and fertilizers that her coffee plants need in order to have a good production in this cycle and with this to guarantee income for her family, which is a priority for this enterprising woman who daily exerts herself in order to give a better future to her children.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies that her coffee plants need.

loans.name: Cassimo

texts.pt:
Senhor Cassimo tem 40 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos na sua responsabilidade dos quais 3 estudam frequentando o ensino primário e secundário é polícia, vive em casa própria com a sua família a qual sustenta.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de pintos, rações, farelo, vacinas, vitaminas para a produção de frangos para revenda.
No futuro pretende ampliar os seus aviários de modo a a criar em grandes quantidades de modo a aumentar a renda familiar.
O seu maior desafio é de criar poupanças financeiras para o futuro dos filhos e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir empréstimos subsequentes.
texts.en:
Cassimo is 40 years old and married. He has five children under his care, and three of them attend primary and secondary school. He's a police officer and lives with his family in a house that he owns. He's the breadwinner.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase chicks, feed, bran, vaccines and vitamins in order to raise chickens for re-selling.
In the future he intends to expand his chicken farm so that he can raise them in larger quantities and therefore increase his family's income.
His biggest challenge is saving money for his children's future. Another challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency as a way to guarantee that there will be more loans.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed, bran, vaccines and vitamins to raise chickens for re-selling.

loans.name: Señor De Puquin Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE PUQUIN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Yaquili; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio,  la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, arroz, entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el credito otorgado y se comprometen  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to he “SEÑOR DE PUQUIN” communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco District, which is in Cusco Province and Cusco Department. 
Sra. Yaquili is a member who spends her day earning a living with her small grocery.  She has had her busienss for quite some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it each day.  Sra. Yaquili is grateful to those who are helping to make her dream come true with through loan, and she promises to comply with the established repayment plan.  Sra. Yaquili sells basic necessities to the customers who come to her.  She wants to continue working so she can keep supporting her family. 
Sra. Yaquili  is requesting the loan to purchase milk, rice and other items. 
All the members of the communal bank are grateful for the loan they have been granted.  They promise to comply with the established repayment plan. 
The members whose photo is inset were given permission to arrive late to the meeting because they had to work.

loans.use: to purchase milk, rice and other items.

loans.name: Chino

texts.en:
Chino is a 27-year-old man from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is married with two children aged six and four years. Chino works hard to provide for the needs of his family.

To earn a living, Chino is engaged in a fishing business. Aside from fishing, he also buys and sells dried fish to the community. He is asking for a loan to pay for boat maintenance and to buy more dried fish to sell.

In the future, Chino wants to increase his business to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to pay for boat maintenance and to buy dried fish.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita prepares and sells coconut vinegar. She is married with two children, ages 22 and 18. She has been producing coconut vinegar for more than ten years now. She needs capital to sustain her current source of income. Her husband is a tuba (coconut wine) collector. He sells tuba to earn a living.

She is asking for a loan to purchase more coconut. This is the main ingredient and will be used in making native vinegar, which she will sell in her local community. Thus, her income will improve and enable her to expand her business for additional income.

She hopes that her livelihood will improve and be sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut.

loans.name: Hector Misael

texts.es: Con 22 años de edad Héctor ya muestra su emprendedurismo, ya que desde hace varios años cuenta con una pequeña granja en la que cría pollo que luego vende con las señoras que vende por libra en el mercado, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes y no logra dar a basto a los pedidos. Héctor vive junto a su madre y sus dos hermanos menores de edad a los que apoya, ya que él desea que estudien. Héctor ha decidido invertir en su granja para cumplir con los pedidos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado, vitaminas y tela metálica para agrandar su granja de pollos.
texts.en:
Hector at 22 years of age already shows his entrepreneurial skills since for several years he has had a small coop where he raises chickens which he later sells to the women who sell them by the pound in the market. Because of this, he has many customers and he can't keep up with the demand.

Hector lives with his mother and his two minor siblings whom he supports since he wants them to study.

Hector has decided to invest in his chicken coop in order to keep up with the demand. For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in chickens, concentrated feed, vitamins, and wire mesh to expand his chicken coop.

loans.use: to invest in chickens, concentrated feed, vitamins and wire mesh to expand his chicken coop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un hombre casado y trabaja como operador en una fábrica desde hace 10 años, su anhelo es apoyar a su esposa  con un tratamiento de ortodoncia ya que sufre  de un severo  mal alineamiento de los dientes desde muy joven, actualmente sufre de fuertes dolores maxilares, aparte de que su evidente problema estético le ha causado baja autoestima.
texts.en: He is a married man and has been working as an operator in a factory for 10 years. He wishes to help his wife obtain orthodontic treatment, as she has suffered from a severe teeth alignment problem since she was very young. Currently she suffers severe jaw pain, apart from the fact that the obvious esthetic problem has caused her to have low self-esteem.

loans.use: to obtain dental treatment.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a 30-year-old married woman living with her three children in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

Sauda deals in selling fresh foods as a vendor in the markets and earns additional income from growing and selling cocoa. She is very hardworking but is challenged by inadequate capital; she hopes to expand her business and also to educate her children up to university.

Sauda has requested a loan to buy food stuffs like millet and cassava flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs like millet and cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cattle and in this way improve his income.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo tiene 28 años y es padre de 2 hijos. Vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua y desde pequeño ha estado relacionado con la caficultura, actividad a la que se dedica y señala que ha sido herencia de sus padres. Ahora, este pequeño emprendedor maneja su finca bajo los criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo, C.A.F.E. Practices y UTZ.

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal, y tener una mejor producción este año y con ello mejores ingresos para su familia. Su meta es incrementar el área productiva de su finca, bajo un plan de manejo integral y con ello tener mayores rendimientos para dejarle a sus hijos una finca productiva.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo is 28 years old and the father of 2 children. He lives in a community in northern Nicaragua, and has been involved in coffee-growing since he was small. It's his job, he points out, passed on to him by his parents.

Now, this small businessman manages his farm according to the standards for certified fair trade, C.A.F.E. practices and UTZ.

For this cycle he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy the fertilizers his crop needs and to have a better yield this year, and with that, better income for his family. His goal is to increase the productive area of his farm with a comprehensive management plan, and with that have a greater yield, in order to leave his children with a productive farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers that he will apply to his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in wire, bags, fertilizer, seeds and other items for his nursery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 27-year-old mother of three school-going children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is in the business of selling and buying cocoa, which she has operated for four years.

Alice does not regret having engaged in a business that has seen her educate her children, feed them and pay their medical bills. She faces a challenge of seasonality with cocoa, which causes price changes. She hopes that, through her hard work, she will be able to expand her business by buying cocoa plantations.

Alice wants to use this loan to buy cocoa to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cocoa  to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a young farmer from Kibugua, a remote village in Chuka, Kenya. She has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. She is the mother of four children and has been farming for the last five years to supplement her income. Harriet does crop farming and raises cattle, and she enjoys farming a lot. Her biggest challenge is the lack of finances to improve her farming and prevent diseases. She is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase a goat. By the end of the year, the goat will have given birth to at least four other goats. Through goat keeping, she will be able to get goat skin, which is very expensive and fetches more profits. This translates to more income and improved living conditions for her family. Also, she will be able to sell goat meat which will increase her income level. The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and grow the business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy goat.

loans.name: Aloja

texts.en:
Aloja is 37 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Aloja works very hard to provide for them.

Aloja runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Aloja has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, biscuits, etc..

In the future, Aloja would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 33 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are still in school.

Mercy is in the agricultural business, farming sugar cane in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mercy has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain dental treatment.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es: Fermina es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica desde hace 12 años a la crianza de animales de granja lo cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, además ella presta sus servicios domésticos para obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Fermina cuenta con 43 años de edad y desde hace 24 años logro construir su vivienda en la que vive junto a sus 3 hijos de 22, 18 y 11 años de edad a los que ha logrado sacar adelante gracias a su negocio y al apoyo de su esposo. Fermina desea aumentar su producción en la granja, ya que cada día cuenta con más clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: conejos, concentrado y vitaminas para aumentar su producción y cumplir con la demanda de productos que le solicitan.
texts.en: Fermina is an enterprising woman who breeds farm animals for 12 years which has allowed her to support her family. Aside from this she provides domestic services to obtain a better income. Fermina is 43 years old. 24 years ago she was able to build her house in which she lives with her three children aged 22, 18 and 11 years of age. Children that she has managed to raise with her business and support from her husband. Fermina wants to increase the production on the farm, as each day she has more clients requesting her products. For which she has decided to apply for a loan at FUSAI to invest in rabbits,feed and vitamins to increase production and meet product demand requested by her customers

loans.use: to invest in rabbits, feed and vitamins to increase production and meet product demand requested by her customers.

loans.name: Lauren Isabel

texts.es: Lauren es una emprendedora mujer que trabajó durante varios años en restaurantes de gastronomía típica de la región Caribe y gracias a estas experiencias laborales tomó la decisión de iniciar su propio negocio desde su apartamento; elaboración y venta de almuerzos corrientes a sus vecinos, amigos y transeúntes del sector.  Su capital semilla se lo otorgó la alcaldía distrital de Barranquilla, dotándola con utensilios de cocina y con el pasar del tiempo su negocio se ha fortalecido, siendo el pilar fundamental para el sustento de su familia conformada por su cónyuge e hijos.  Todos los días a partir de las 6 a.m. inicia sus labores culinarias para que sus comensales tengan listo su almuerzo justo al medio día. Sus ventas se generan de contado y sus compras las realiza a graneros y abarrotes en el centro de la ciudad, en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de víveres y otra variedad de productos: helados, mecatos y refrescos.  Con esta inversión continuará brindando bienestar a su familia y tendrá más oportunidad de hacerse realidad su meta a largo plazo de realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda y apoyar en los estudios profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lauren is an entrepreneurial woman who worked for a number of years in restaurants serving gastronomy typical of the Caribbean region, and thanks to these work experiences, she decided to begin her own business from her apartment: making and selling basic lunches to her neighbors, friends, and people passing through the sector. The district mayor of Barranquilla awarded her seed capital to her, providing her with cooking utensils. With the passing of time, her business has strengthened, becoming the fundamental base for the sustenance of her family, which consists of her husband and children.

Every day around 6 a.m. she begins her culinary work so that her guests have their lunch ready right at midday. Her sales are made for cash, and she makes her purchases at grocery stores and shops in the center of the city. 

She is now applying for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will invest it in the purchase of groceries and other sorts of products, such as ice cream, snacks, and soft drinks. With this investment, she will continue offering well-being to her family, and she will have more opportunities to make a reality of her long-term goal of making modifications to her home and supporting the professional education of her children.

loans.use: to buy groceries and a variety of products: ice cream, snacks, and soft drinks

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en: Hayde is a 50-year-old woman from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married with three school-aged children who are 20, 15 and 8 years old. Her husband works hard as a farmer while Hayde works at her hog-raising business. She has been doing this for 11 years. Aside from raising pigs, Hayde and her husband run a rice farm as their main source of income. Hayde wants to increase their livelihood. She wants to reach her goal to be successful. With that, she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feed for her pigs. She will also buy fertilizer and pesticides for their farm.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs, as well as fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy candies, beverages, food, and other items.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio operates a habal-habal (motorcycle) transport service. He transports passengers from one place to remote areas. He is a 66-year-old married man with seven grown children. Aside from operating a motorcycle service, he also does farming. He grows rice.
He has been engaged in that kind of business for more than 20 years now.

Gregorio is asking for a loan to buy fuel and pay for maintenance and fertilizers for the farm. It would help his motorcycle to be well maintained and enable him to travel safely when transporting his passengers. Also, his farm will become productive, and as a result he could sell more rice. Thus, Gregorio could handle his income and settle his obligation.

He is doing his best to improve both of his sources of income so that he can purchase another brand new motorcycle in order to have another source of income to sustain his living.

loans.use: to buy fuel, as well as maintenance and fertilizers for the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy supplies to continue making food.

loans.name: Trustworthy Repayment - 30Hbắchlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy is 41 years old and married with three children. She has operated a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years. Thúy lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this region often suffers natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea.

The main hardship that Thúy faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to catch fish. In 2014, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thúy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the 30HBắcHLộc, which consists of three members. With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to catch fish.

loans.name: Giselle

texts.en:
Giselle is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Giselle is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Giselle has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Giselle requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Giselle has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Giselle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Susana is 47 years old.

Susana has a business buying and selling personal product care items in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, make-up, and groceries.

Susana has been in this business for three years. In the future, Susana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, make-up, and groceries.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 47 years old and has six children. Luisa is married and has three children who are in school.

Luisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Luisa requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Luisa has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Luisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 37 years old and married with four children, all of whom are still in school. Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, etc.

Myrna has been in this business for one year.

In the future Myrna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, drinks, spices, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Corazon is 38 years old and has one child in school.

Corazon has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Corazon has been in this business for one year. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Amor Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres que pertenecen a la etnia miskita y viven en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan diario para generar ingresos desde sus pequeños negocios. Se organizaron hace año y medio, con el propósito de acceder a créditos en PANA PANA con garantía solidaria.

ADELA ADAYLA: Es una señora jovial, luchadora de 32 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos, el mayor de 11 años estudia su quinto grado y una pequeña de 9 meses. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como pescador. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 2 años estableció en un tramo que alquila una pequeña pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener el suficiente capital para establecer una miscelánea.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is formed by three women who belong to the Miskita ethnic group and live in Bilwi, in the township of Puerto Cabezas. They are entrepreneurial women who strive every day to generate income from their little businesses. They organized themselves a year and a half ago, with the goal of accessing loans from Pana Pana with a solidarity guarantee.

Adela Adayla is a cheerful, hard-working woman of 32. She is married and has two children: the oldest, who is 11 and is in fifth grade, and a little nine-month-old daughter. Her husband works informally as a fisherman. With the goal of having her own source of income and contributing to the household expenses, she established a little grocery store two years ago in a stall that she rents. She is applying for financing in order to buy basic grains and snacks, among other products. She dreams of having sufficient capital to establish a general store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and snacks, among other products.

loans.name: Marialina

texts.en:
Marialina is 53 years old and has two children.

Marialina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marialina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marialina has been raising pigs for three years and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marialina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 56 years old and single with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Myrna has been raising pigs for 25 years and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer, among other things.

loans.name: Narme

texts.en:
Narme is 26 years old and has three children. Narme is married and has one child who is in school.
