Narme is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Narme requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies.

Narme has been in this business for two years, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to provide and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 30 years old and married with two children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Gina has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 45 years old and married with three children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies.

Rowena has been in this business for six years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 27 years old and married.

Joan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Joan has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Joan aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза, 31 год, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как об ответственной, честной женщине. Наргиза в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2011 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. Дополнительно у Наргизы есть земельный надел мерою 1,78 ГА, где она выращивает арбузы и кукурузу. Благодаря упорному труду Наргизы, ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Наргиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, в будущем она хочет накопить на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en: Nargiza is 31 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. She has a specialized secondary education and good references from her neighbors. They think she is a responsible and honest woman. To provide the primary income for her family, Nargiza has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2011. She has 2 cows on her farm. Additionally, Nargiza has 1.78 hectares of land, where she grows watermelons and corn. Thanks to Nargiza's hard work, her business yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month, which provides the basis for covering the family's food and consumer expenses. To continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock. Nargiza plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and wants to save money to buy a car in the future.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to grow her business

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ruby works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from e-loading. Ruby is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy foods like eggs, peanuts, snack foods, and bottled drinking water to sell.

Ruby has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy foods like eggs, peanuts, snack foods, and bottled drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cynthia is 57 years old and has two children who are in school.

Cynthia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cynthia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Cynthia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Cynthia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Shella

texts.en:
Shella is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Shella is 30 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Shella has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Shella requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

Shella has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marcelina is 53 years old and has one child in school.

Marcelina has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Marcelina has been in this business for one year. In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 48 years old and has nine children. Shirly is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Shirly is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Shirly requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies.

Shirly has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Anita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.name: Mirbek

texts.ru: Мирбек, 33 года, женат. Образование-среднее. На протяжении 5 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря своей упорной работе и ответственности, на сегодняшний день Мирбек имеет хорошее хозяйство: 4 коровы, 6 овец, лошадь. На 1,0 Га земли выращивает картофель. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мирбек обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для разведения и содержания. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en: Mirbek is 33 years old and married. He has a secondary education. He has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 5 years, having started this business with 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to his hard work and responsibility, today Mirbek has a good farm with 4 cows, 6 sheep and a horse. He grows potatoes on 1.0 hectare of land. To continue developing his business, Mirbek requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy a cow for fattening up and keeping. He plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing his livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy one cow in order to increase his livestock headcount

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали из района Хуросон. Ему 49 лет. Он женат и имеет отец одного сына. Курбонали заботливый, добрый, ответственный муж и отец. Он любить свою семью и всегда думает о семье. Его жена домохозяйка, и во  дворе выращивает скота. Сам Курбонали занимается сапожником. В этой деятельностью он занят уже 13 лет. Курбонали уже опытный сапожник. Он хочет улучшить условия жизни семьи, чтобы жить комфортно и уютно. Курбонали решил отремонтировать свой дом, но для ремонта у него нет такая сумма  денег, и он решил взять кредит и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Kurbonali is from the Khuroson district. He is 49 years old. He is married and is a father of one son. Kurbonali is a caring, kind and responsible husband and father. He loves his family and always thinks of his family. His wife is a homemaker and raises livestock in their yard. Kurbonali is involved in shoe repair. He has been in this business for 13 years. Kurbonali is an experienced shoe repairman. He wants to improve his family's life, so that they can live comfortably. Kurbonali decided to repair his house, but does not have enough money for the repair, so he decided to obtain a loan and repair the house.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Irene is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Irene has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Irene has been in this business for two years. In the future, Irene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rafaela has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rafaela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more scrap to sell

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Marissa has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

loans.name: Marycho

Marycho is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marycho is 33 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Marycho has a business buying and selling personal products in the Philippines. Marycho requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more personal products like beauty soap, bags, perfume, body lotion and other personal care products to sell.

Mercedes has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mercedes requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing material like fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

Mercedes has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

Merlina has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Myren

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Myren works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling animal feeds in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Myren is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of animal feeds to sell in her local market.

Myren has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of animal feeds to sell in her local market.

loans.name: Zemstaaba 2 Homme Group

texts.fr:
Mr NABYOURE SALIFO est responsable du groupe ZEMSTAABA 2 HOMME. Il est marié et père  de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 32 ans et le moins âgé  a 25 ans. 0 enfant ne va l’école et il a 06 personnes en charges.
Mr fait du jardinage depuis plus de 18 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 04 sacs d’engrais, 02 boîtes d’oignon, 01 carton d’insecticide.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour épargner et renforcer son activité de  plantation de papaye. Il ambitionne construire sa concession.
texts.en:
Mr. Nabyoure Salifo is the person responsible for the Zemstaaba 2 Homme group. He is married and the father of three children, the eldest of whom is 32 years old and the youngest 25. None of the children attend school and he has six persons to care for.

He has been a crop gardener for over 18 years, and resupplies in surrounding markets.

He will use the money granted to buy four bags of fertilizer, two boxes of onions, and one carton of insecticide.

He wants to use the profits from the loan to save and strengthen his papaya plantation activity. He aims to set up his own concession.

loans.use: buy four bags of fertilizer, two boxes of onions, one carton of insecticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Lesya

texts.ru:
Lesya sells bicycles and spare parts, also skates and sleighs. In winter she sells thermal underwear to support her gross income as in winter sales go down.

Lesya's family have become very involved with community activities. They are organizing biking competitions for children and their parents, during which they become closer to each other, and it deepens mutual understanding between parents and children. There is a lot of positive feedback from families attending these events. Also they involve youth from the local church as volunteers for such events.

Lesya has moved her business to a bigger facility. She is asking for a loan of 100 000 UAH to buy goods and furniture for the new store. Also she wants to do advertisement for the store. Lesya is married and has three sons. Lesya runs a family business with her husband.
texts.en:
Lesya sells bicycles, spare bicycle parts, skates and sleighs. In the winter, she also sells thermal underwear to support her gross income as winter sales are typically low.

Lesya's family have become very involved with community activities. They are organizing biking competitions for children and their parents, during which they become closer to each other, and it deepens mutual understanding between parents and children. There is a lot of positive feedback from the families who attend these events. They also involve youth from the local church as volunteers for such events.

Lesya has recently moved her business to a bigger facility. She is asking for a loan of 100,000 UAH to buy goods and furniture for the new store. She also wants advertise for the store. 

Lesya is married and has three sons. She runs the family business with her husband.

loans.use: to buy goods, furniture, and pay for advertisement for her new store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina owns and operates a furniture business. She caters for orders of chairs, dining tables, cabinets and doors made of wood. She is a 40-year-old married woman with 3 dependents, aged 10 to 20. Her husband also helps in running the business - the family's source of living.

Cristina has requested a loan in order to purchase materials like wood, plywood, varnish, wood glue and nails. With the presence of these materials, Cristina would be able to cater more to her customers demands. Thus, her income will increase and help her meet the needs of her family. In addition, she could also pay her obligations and start to expand her furniture business.

In the future, Cristina hopes that her livelihood will be successful in order to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase materials to grow her furniture business.

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es:
Oscar, de 36 años de edad, es un campesino trabajador, se dedicado a la agricultura y al transporte de pasajeros, no pudo estudiar por motivos de escasos recursos, actualmente está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa.

Oscar, necesita el crédito para colocar un molino de motor eléctrico, porque anteriormente él tenía este negocio en su casa, pero el molino se le daño por desperfectos mecánicos, además necesita comprar insumos agrícolas.

Su principal sueño es ver funcionando su molino y seguir trabajando en el campo.
texts.en:
Oscar is 36 years old and a hard-working countryman. He works in farming and providing transport services to passengers. He could not study owing to a lack of money. Oscar currently has a partner; she is a housewife.

Oscar needs this loan in order to install a mill with an electric motor in his home. He had a milling business in his home previously but it became damaged. Oscar also needs to buy farming supplies.

Oscar's biggest dream is to see his mill in working order and to continue working in the fields.

loans.use: to install a mill with an electric motor in his home, and to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as manure, anti-disease treatments and weed-killers to prepare the land.

loans.name: Gulshod

texts.ru: Гулшод 35 летняя молодая жена. Она живет в районе Хуромон вместе семьей. У нее дружная и не большая семья. Гулшод домохозяйка, но сидя дома она  зарабатывает и помогает мужу обеспечить семью. Она занимается шитьем женской одежды. У нее хороший бизнес, и ежедневный доход. Муж занимается разнорабочим в Российской Федерации. Данный момент он находится у себя в стране. Сейчас муж нашел себе работу в стране и хочет уехать и поскорее зарабатывать и отправить деньги домой. Для купли билет у него нет денег, и Гулшод решила взять кредит и купить мужу билет. Гулшод верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulshod, age 35, is a young married woman who lives in the Khuroson district of Tajikistan with her small but friendly family.  Although she stays at home,  she makes some money working from home and she helps her husband support the family.  She has a good business (she sews women's clothes), from which she makes a daily income.  

Gulshod's husband works different jobs as a migrant worker in Russia.  At the moment he is at home in Tajikistan.  However he needs to return abroad as he has found a job there.  He wants to start working as soon as possible and send money home.  Gulshod's husband doesn't have enough money to buy his plane ticket, so Gulshod has decided to take a loan to buy his ticket.  She relies on you and on your support.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for her husband.

loans.name: Pablo Nelson

texts.es:
Pablo, de 45 años de edad, es agricultor, estudió hasta cuarto grado, pero por diferentes dificultades no pudo continuar, está casado, su esposa es ama de casa y estudio hasta séptimo grado, sus hijos son menores edad y están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad en donde viven.

Pablo, se dedica a la agricultura desde la edad de 15 años, aprendió este trabajo para apoyar a su padre en la siembra de granos básicos, eso le ha servido de mucho porque ahora, él siembra y de eso ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, pero tambien vende pan en los alrededores de la comunidad, todo para generar más ingresos y cubrir algunas necesidades del hogar.

Pablo, necesita el préstamo para comprar una motocicleta para trasladarse a las comunidades a vender pan, teniendo su motocicleta, podrá movilizarse más rápido y cubrir más comunidades.

Pablo, anhela comprar una casa, porque en donde viven es propiedad de un familiar; también desea que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Pablo is 45 years old and is a farmer. He went to school until fourth grade, but due to various difficulties he could not continue. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. She went to school until the seventh grade. Their children are minors and they are studying in the community school where they live.

Pablo has earned his living through agriculture since he was 15 years old. He learned this trade so he could support his father with sowing grain. This has been very useful because now he sows for himself and because of this he has been able to provide for his family. However, he also sells bread in the surrounding areas of his community so he can generate more income and cover some necessary home expenses.

Pablo needs the loan to buy a motorbike for moving around the communities selling bread. Using his motorbike, he will be able to move more quickly and cover more areas.

Pablo longs to buy a house because his current home is a family member's property. He also wants his children to study and be professionals.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike so he can move around his community selling bread.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Agnes started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Chuka, a remote rural town in Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud.

Although she makes a profit through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit so she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have an easier time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Agnes believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Agnes waits for your kindness. Help this Kenyan smallholder farmer with a loan today!

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Damaris, one of the most hardworking and dedicated women on planet earth. She is based in Maili kumi, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is happily married. She is blessed with two lovely children. For the past 10 years she has been engaging in mixed farming and through selling milk and a variety of food crops she has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests.

Although Damaris makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is the lack of water to irrigate her farm and water for home consumption. Damaris comes from an area where there is no water connection and she is always forced to walk for a long distance for this “precious commodity.” Because of her age, she faces challenges carrying water on her back.

Damaris is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain fed agriculture but Damaris wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan she intends to harvest rain water which always goes to waste and store it in the tanks. She intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to her farm. With your loan Damaris will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water and she will have enough water for home consumption.

Irrigating her farm will boast productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops. Damaris is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Damaris’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank to store rain water,  water pipes and a pump.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a hardworking 44 year old woman from Nkubu area of Kenya. The main source of her income is milk, crop farming and some personal business. Beatrice enjoys dairying above any other income-generating activity she is involved in. She owns 2 high breed cows that produce enough milk for her family's consumption and surplus for sale.

Beatrice has one problem that she wishes to tackle with the help of your loan. There is nothing like a tap water system in her remote village where she comes from. She relies on pails to fetch and store water for domestic and agricultural use. Beatrice is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. The tank will hold the same volume of water as at least 50 buckets. This investment will ensure continuous supply of water on Beatrice's farm. Rain water will be harvested to fill the tank. The impact of this loan is not only for Beatrice's family, but also a step forward for the community in her village to start adopting best water management practices.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and water pipes to collect rain water for both domestic and farm use

loans.name: Iyubake Group

texts.fr:
Pétronie  fait partie du groupe  Iyubake et  habite à  Gitega. C’est une veuve de  43 ans. Elle a  7 enfants âgés de 7 à 25 ans, tous étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge  sa petite fille. 

Elle fait le commerce de farine de manioc, de maïs et de haricot  depuis  15 ans. 

Elle est à son vingtième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  maïs et de haricot  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  construire ne belle maison, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Pétronie is part of the Iyubake group and lives in Gitega. She is a 43-year old widow. She has seven children aged 7 to 25, they are all in school. She takes care of her grand-daughter.
Pétronie has been selling cassava flour, corn and beans for fifteen years. She is on her twentieth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she will receive, she will increase her capital and purchase large quantities of corn and beans to sell and earn more income. In the upcoming years, she would like to build a nice house, and see her children study.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of corn and beans to sell and earn more.

loans.name: Delwende 2 Tangsega Group

texts.fr:
Mme K. PASCALINE est la représentante du groupe DELWENDE 2 TANGSEGA. Elle est mariée sans enfant avec 05 personnes en charge.
Mme fait la transformation du mil germé depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 02 sacs de sorgho rouge.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité et payer des grandes jarres. Elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mrs K. Pascaline is the representative of the Delwende 2 Tangsega group. She is married with no children, and takes care of five persons. She has been processing millet sprouts for over twenty years. She gets her supplies in the surrounding markets.
With the funds received, she intends to buy two bags of red sorghum. She wants to use the income from the loan to build her activity and buy large jars. Her goal is to purchase some land.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of red sorghum.

loans.name: Simbimanga Group

texts.fr:
Athanase  fait partie du groupe  Simbimanga et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 47 ans et est marié à Gisele, une infirmière. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants  l’un a 1 an et l’autre  2 ans.
Il a sous sa charge 1 enfant membre de sa famille élargie, qui étudie. 

Il est menuisier fait le commerce de tables,de chaises,…depuis  10 ans. 

Il est à son  deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup  des planches  pour fabriquer des chaises et des tables  à vendre pour gagner plus.  

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  être  un grand commerçant de limonade et   voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Athanase is part of the Simbimanga group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 47 years old and is married to Gisele, a nurse. Together they have two children: one is one year old and the other is two years old. He also takes care of one child from his extended family who is studying.
Athanase is a carpenter who has been trading in tables, chairs etc for ten years. He is on his second loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he will receive, he will increase his capital and buy many boards to build chairs and tables in order to earn more. In the upcoming years, he wants to be a great lemonade seller and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy many boards to build chairs and tables.

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.es:
Bernabé, de 65 años de edad, solo estudio hasta segundo grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, juntos tuvieron 4 hijos, de los cuales ninguno vive con ellos.

Bernabe, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, también cultiva yuca y esa es la fuente de ingreso que tiene; el trabajo lo aprendió con su padre y decidió dedicarse a eso, porque es un trabajo bueno que le genera ganancias.

Bernabe, necesita el crédito para comprar abono para el cultivo de maíz y de esa manera tener los insumos necesarios para asegurar la producción.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando y tener una mejor calidad de vida con su esposa.
texts.en:
Bernabé is 65 years old and only studied until the second grade. He is married and his wife is a homemaker by profession. Together they have 4 children, none of whom live with them.

Bernabé has earned a living through agriculture for a long time. He also grows cassava and this is the source of income that he has. He learned to work with his father and he decided to pursue this because it is a good job that generates profit.

Bernabé needs the loan to buy fertiliser for growing corn and so he will have the necessary supplies to ensure production.

His dream is to keep working and have a better quality of life with his wife.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser for farming corn.

loans.name: Wakulima Kawizi Group

texts.fr: Kiza, la présidente et l'unique femme du groupe WAKULIMA KAWIZI s'occupait jadis de la culture du manioc et d'autres produits vivriers; c'est seulement par après qu'elle a pris l'initiative de s'adonner à la culture de la tomate vu sa courte durée de moisson. Avec la tomate, elle est parvenue à plusieurs réalisations dont l'achat d'une parcelle, la prise en charge familiale,...La saison passée, elle a pu récupérer le montant mis en jeu comme charges d'exploitation et réaliser un résultat positif de deux cents dollars. Elle se plaint de l'insuffisance de fonds pour financer ses activités mais reste confiante du fait qu'avec un espace plus grand, elle pourra réaliser un bon rendement, atout pout améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et prévenir la scolarisation de ses enfants qui n'ont pas encore commencer les études.
texts.en:
Kiza, the president and only woman of the Wakulima Kawizi group, used to plant cassava and other food crops; it was after that she took the initiative to plant tomatoes given their short harvest period. Thanks to tomatoes, she has achieved many things including purchasing a plot of land, taking care of her family...
During the last season, she was able to recover the amount invested in operating expenses and make a net profit of two hundred dollars. She complains about the insufficiency of funds to finance her activities but remains confident that with a larger space, she will achieve a good yield, which will be an advantage to improve her family's living conditions and prepare for her children's schooling, as they have not yet started their studies.

loans.use: to carry out weeding and mulching, and to purchase pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy large quantities of rice and beans for sale to earn more.

loans.name: José Damian

texts.es: En las alegóricas calles de Cartagena de Indias, se pregona de la frescura y jugosidad de las frutas y verduras que comercializa José en su carretilla, que deambula diariamente en los diferentes sectores de este municipio.  Ante la falta de oportunidades laborales y siendo un padre responsable del sustento de su familia, decidió usar sus ahorros e invertirlos en esta actividad en la que gracias a su dedicación y constancia, le ha permitido obtener muy buenos resultados. En la actualidad él ofrece frutas como mango, banano, naranjas, mandarinas, pomelos, entre otra variedad y con la finalidad de surtir su carretilla con nuevas variedades, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de Corozo, Platanito, Coco, Tomate, Ají y Moras.  Su meta a futuro es continuar con el negocio bien surtido y poder ofrecerle una educación de calidad a su hija.
texts.en:
In the allegorical streets of Cartagena de Indias, José proclaims the freshness and juiciness of the fruits and vegetables that he sells in his cart, as he wanders daily in the different areas of this town.

Facing a lack of work opportunities and being a father responsible for supporting his family, he decided to use his savings and invest them in this job, which has allowed him to obtain very good results thanks to his dedication and perseverance.

At the moment he offers fruit such as mangoes, bananas, oranges, mandarins, grapefruits and other items. With the objective of filling his cart with new varieties, he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest this in buying corozo nuts, plantains, coconuts, tomatoes, peppers and blackberries.

His goal for the future is to continue with his well-stocked business and be able to give a quality education to his daughter.

loans.use: to invest in buying corozo nuts, plantains, coconuts, tomatoes, peppers and blackberries.

loans.name: Jose Julio

texts.es:
José, de 37 años de edad, solo estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado, su pareja se dedica a trabajar en una farmacia, tienen 3 hijos que están en la escuela.

José, se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace más de 2 años y decidió hacerlo porque es un negocio que le genera ganancias; en este negocio se involucran una cuñada de él para apoyarle en las ventas.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar más verduras y surtir más el negocio y tener más ganancias.

José, sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old and only went to school until the ninth grade. He is married and his partner works in a pharmacy. They have 3 children that are in school.

José earns a living by selling vegetables in the market. He has worked in this business for more than 2 years and he decided to do it because it is a business that generates profits. His sister-in-law is involved in the business to support him with sales.

José needs the loan to buy more vegetables and stock his business better so he can make more profit.

José dreams that his children will be successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to stock his business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Ruth de  47  años de edad es madre soltera y  vive con sus  hijos que no dependen en casa propia y se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en general.
Doña Ruth vende arroz, azúcar, maíz, café, frescos, manteca, frijoles, papel higiénico, etc. es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Ruth está solicitando el préstamo para compra de frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, huevos, queso, pan, harina, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del 2015.
texts.en:
Ruth is 47 years old. She is a single mother and she lives with her children, who are not dependent, in her own home. For 20 years, she has worked in the business of a general store.

Ruth sells rice, sugar, corn, coffee, beverages, lard, beans, toilet paper, etc. She is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and who fights day to day to improve her quality of life.

Ruth is asking for the loan to buy beans, rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, cheese, bread, flour, etc. With the support of this loan, she intends on improving her income and her quality of life as well. She is a continuing client who wants to keep working with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele and at the same time the future with her family.



San Lorenzo, Honduras - July, 2015.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, coffee, eggs, cheese, bread, flour, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cinthia es integrante del BM Mujeres Visionarias, es madre de una hija y ha solicitado 2 créditos con Fundación Mujer, trabaja la actividad de cocina y panadería, denominada La Cocina de Cinthia, además de producir pan en las mañanas, vende almuerzos en la zona y a instituciones públicas, además da el servicio de comidas para actividades de empresas e instituciones. Cuatro años en el negocio respaldan una empresa consolidada en la zona. Compra su materia prima en supermercados y almacenes de Puntarenas, y cuenta con el equipo para la producción de pan, comidas a domicilio y una clientela diaria, que le paga de contado. Por situaciones de salud de su papá ha tenido que realizar gastos en medicinas y requiere de capital para su negocio, que a la fecha no ha podido hacer frente a  los pedidos de su clientela en crecimiento. Con el grupo ha demostrado una actitud de líder una buena conducta de pago.

Cuenta con equipo industrial, cocina, refrigeradora batidora entre otros, además trabaja en un local propio, lo que le permite operar de una manera eficiente y además estar al cuidado de su familia.  Atiende a sus clientes y distribuye su producto con el apoyo de una hermana, quien cuenta con un vehículo; así  genera ingresos al hogar, apoya la economía familiar

La cocina de Cynthia cuenta con un mercado en la zona, que incluye instituciones públicas y privadas en donde distribuye almuerzos, atención de actividades y eventos de empresas e instituciones, repostería y venta de pan, tiene una cobertura en casi toda la zona metropolitana de Puntarenas. Está en proceso de obtención de sus permisos, y trabaja durante todo el año.
texts.en:
Cinthia is a member of BM Mujeres Visionarias. She is the mother of a daughter, and she has asked for 2 loans from Fundación Mujer. She works in the activity of cooking and baking and her business is called La Cocina de Cinthia. In addition to baking bread in the morning, she sells lunches in the area and at public institutions. She also offers the meal service for business and institutional activities. Four years in the business support a consolidated business in the area. She buys her raw materials in supermarkets and stores in Puntarenas, and she has the equipment to make the bread and the meals she delivers and sells to regular customers, who pay her upfront. Due to her father's health situation she has had to pay for some medical expenses and she needs capital for her business, because at this time she hasn't been able to cover the orders from her growing clientele. With the group, she has shown an attitude of leadership and good payment behavior.

She has industrial equipment such as a stove, a refrigerator, a mixer and more. She also works in her own locale, which allows her to operate in an efficient way in addition to caring for her family. She serves her customers and distributes her products with the help of her sister, who has a car. In this way, she generates income for her home and supports her family.

La Cocina de Cynthia has a market in the area, which includes public and private institutions where she distributes lunches, and caters events and activities for businesses and institutions, as well as pastry and selling bread. She covers almost the whole metropolitan area of Puntarenas. She is in the process of obtaining her permits, and she works all year around.

loans.use: to buy materials to make food and pastries.

loans.name: Maritza De Jesus

texts.es:
Maritza, de 42 años de edad, solo estudio hasta noveno grado, está divorciada, tiene dos hijos pero ya no dependen de ella porque ya trabajan y tienen sus propios ingresos.

Maritza, se dedica a vender comida todos los días de la semana en la colonia donde vive, ella se dedica al negocio desde hace más de 12 años y lo aprendió con su madre, porque era una mujer ejemplar y muy buena en los negocios, ahora ella trabaja cerca de su casa y en el negocio se involucra una prima de ella. 

Maritza, necesita el préstamo para comprar más utensilios para la cocina, porque los que tiene son pocos, con este préstamos ella podrá tener todo lo que necesita para preparar sus alimentos.

Su sueño es superarme y seguir estudiando el próximo año.
texts.en:
Maritza is 42 years old and only went to school until the ninth grade. She is divorced and has two children but they are no longer dependent on her because they work and have their own incomes.

Maritza earns a living selling food every day of the week in the community where she lives. She has worked in this business for more than 12 years and she learned it from her mother because she was an exemplary and very good businesswoman. Now she works near to her home and her cousin helps with the business.

Maritza needs the loan to buy more cooking utensils because she only has a few. With this loan she will be able to have everything she needs to prepare her food.

Her dream is to better herself and keep studying next year.

loans.use: to buy more cooking utensils.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es:
Blanca, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando, desde muy pequeña trabajo vendiendo yuca, tostadas de plátano y productos Avon, todo para ayudar en los gastos de su familia; se acompañó y tuvo dos hijos junto a su pareja, el mayor de sus hijos tiene 14 años de edad y tiene una niña de 6 años de edad; hace tres años su esposo falleció.

Blanca, es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica al comercio pan desde hace tres años en los alrededores de su comunidad, pero además de la venta de pan, también vende ropa y de esa manera genera ingresos extras para llevar el sustento diario y para mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, para que en el futuro tengan una mejor estabilidad y puedan optar por un mejor trabajo. 

Blanca, necesita el crédito para comprar pan y ropa para salir a vender y tener más ingresos y ganarse la vida honradamente, luchando por sus hijos.

Blanca, sueña con construir su propia vivienda, porque la casa donde vive es alquilada y tiene que cancelar mensualmente una cuota.
texts.en:
Blanca is 31 years old. She studied to 6th grade. She did not have the opportunity to continue studying. From a very early age, she worked selling cassava, plantain chips, and Avon products, all to help with family expenses. She was married and had two children with her partner. The oldest child is 14 years old and she has a 6 year old daughter. Her husband died three years ago.

Blanca is a very hardworking person. She has made a living selling bread for the past three years around her community, but besides selling bread, she sells clothes as well, and thus generates extra income to bring home the daily bread and to send her children to school, so that in the future they have better stability and are able to choose a better occupation.

Blanca needs the loan to purchase bread and clothes to go out to sell and to earn more income and earn an honest living, fighting for her children.

Blanca dreams of constructing her own house, because the house where she lives is rented and she has to pay a monthly fee.

loans.use: to purchase bread and clothes to go out to sell.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita runs a general store. She sells items like powdered milk, soap, beverages, noodles, feeds, soft drinks, and assorted canned goods.

She is 56 years old, a married woman with four grown children. She lives in the town of Alicia, Bohol. She decided to take a loan to have additional capital for her existing business.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies like canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, flour and salt. These could filled the shelves of her store and attract buyers to shop. This will improve her earnings and enable her to balance her finances.

In the future, Lucita is aiming to have more capital to make her store financially stable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy supplies like canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, flour and salt.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a 31-year-old woman and a mother of three children, ages 9, 6 and 4 years old. She dreams the best for her children. She wants them to finish their studies and get degrees in the future. She also wants to increase their livelihood for better means of living.

Jean and her husband own a rice farm that serves as their main source of income. Aside from that they are engaged in various businesses like owning a motorcycle that gives them an extra income. Jean also buys and sells frozen goods like frozen meat, hot dogs, and chorizo. She also raises pigs.

She wants to borrow money to buy fertilizer for their rice farm, feed for her pigs, and frozen goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, feed and frozen goods.

loans.name: Semillas De Amor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Luisa is one of the members of her group, called Semillas de Amor (seeds of love) 1 & 2. This group has 10 female members, who sell clothes, shoes, cosmetics and other products. Some make their sales as street vendors and others have their businesses in their homes. This group is located in a poor community in the west of Santo Domingo, the capital city of the Dominican Republic.

Luisa's family consists of her three children and her partner. She lives with her children and her long-term partner. She tells us that she likes to attend church and her most difficult challenge is to have a successful business.

She is very excited to be receiving her sixth loan from Esperanza Internacional. She will invest the money in her business where she sells empanadas (a fried dough filled with different ingredients). She will buy flour to make the empanada dough, cooking oil and some meat, vegetables, cheese and others ingredients to fill them.

Luisa's profits will be reinvested in her businesses, and she will also use some to cover household needs.

One of her dreams is to see her children become professionals with stable lives and safe homes. She also dreams of having a successful business. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy flour, meat, cooking oil.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Pamela se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de restaurant,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es abrir otro restaurant . La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, verduras, arroz y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Pamela, continues to make a living from her restaurant business. She wants to get her family ahead through her business and her dream is to open another restaurant. The member is requesting a loan to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

The member is happy about this loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, rice and meat.

loans.name: Linalyn

texts.en:
Linalyn is a 54-year-old woman from San Dioninsio, Iloilo. She is married and has three school-age children, ages 19, 15 and 14 years old. Her husband is a businessman who buys and sells rice, while Linalyn is focusing on her sari-sari store business. She has been doing this for 20 years.

Linalyn and her husband work hard to give the best for their children. Linalyn dreams that all her children will finish their studies and that they could have a better life in the future.

She asks a loan to have additional capital to buy grocery items such as noodles, toiletries, canned goods, candies, biscuits, chips, spices, soft drinks and drinking liquor as well as gasoline to sell.

loans.use: to buy noodles, toiletries, canned goods, candies, biscuits, chips, spices, soft drinks, drinking liquor and gasoline.

loans.name: Balbino

texts.en:
Balbino hails from the town of Bilar, Bohol. He is married and has two dependents. His older child is 16 and the younger is 11.

He provides shoe repair services. He has been in that business for more than 10 years now.

He is asking for a loan to buy materials like glue, brush, thread and cutting scissors. These will boost Balbino's income because he will be able to provide more services and finish work ahead of time. Thus, he could continue to provide his family with good food and pay his obligations.

He would like to improve his shoe repair livelihood to continue support the schooling of his children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy materials like glue, brush, thread and cutting scissors.

loans.name: Unidas Para Seguir 1 Group

texts.en:
Lourdes is one of the members of Grupo Unidas para Seguir (bound to follow) 1, located in the city of Samana. This group is composed of five micro-entrepreneurs who sell clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and fruits, and who also provide services including a beauty salon and mobile telephone cards.

Lourdes is a businesswoman who lives with her three children and with her long-term partner. She tells us that her greatest challenge is helping her children to grow and become professionals.

She is very excited to receive her seventh loan from Kiva partner Esperanza Internacional, which she will invest in her business to buy phone cards or credits to be added to prepaid cellphones.

Lourdes has had her business for about four years. She will save her business profits for future investment and for any need. Her dream is to have a successful business and a comfortable house.

loans.use: to buy phone cards.

loans.name: Try And Gain - N4Ttiếnqtrung Group

texts.en:
Hiền is 35 years old and she is married. Hiền lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover the market need is low in this region.

She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Hiền faces is lack of capital. In 2013, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Hiền is the group leader of N4TTiếnQTrung, which consists of four members. She is requesting a loan to purchase and resell more items for her grocery store.

With her business profit, Hiền hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase and resell more items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina con una receta ancestral y nacida en cuna de humildes campesinos de quienes aprendió desde muy joven el arte culinario de elaborar Bollos de Mazorca, implementó su propia microempresa desde la comodidad de su hogar en donde realiza su proceso productivo para comercializar tres veces a la semana sus deliciosos bollos.  Hoy en día cuenta con 21 años de funcionamiento y su producto es muy consumido por los habitantes del municipio de Soledad quienes lo compran para acompañar sus desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, o simplemente para comerlo de merienda o en “matrimonio” (rodajas de queso costeño con bollo de mazorca). Gracias a su microempresa sus tres hijos y dos de ellos menores de edad, han gozado de bienestar y sobre todo de la compañía de su madre que diariamente atiende los asuntos en el hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un crédito, su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar maíz, azúcar, leña y sal y así poder responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.  Su meta a futuro es fortalecer su capital, las ventas y las utilidades.
texts.en:
Luz Marina was born in the cradle of humble farmers, from whom she learned, when she was very young, an ancestral recipe, and the culinary art of making corn bread rolls. She established her own micro company from the comfort of her home, where she does her production to sell her delicious bread rolls three times a week.
Today, she has had the company for 21 years, and her product is very popular with the inhabitants of the municipality of Soledad, who buy it to eat with their breakfast, lunch, or dinner, or simply to eat it as a snack or “marriage style” (slices of coastal cheese with the corn bread roll). Thanks to her micro company, her three children, two of whom are minors, have enjoyed well-being, and above all, the company of their mother who regularly tends to the household. 
Currently she is asking for a loan, her first credikiva, with the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo, to buy corn, sugar, firewood, and salt, and therefore meet the demands of her clients. Her goal is to strengthen her capital, her sales, and her utilities.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, firewood, and salt.

loans.name: Lesley

texts.en:
Lesley is a mother of four young children. Her oldest child is 10 and the youngest is 3 months old.

She supports her family by engaging in cosmetology services. She caters services like manicure and pedicure. She earns 2,800 pesos a month by rendering cosmetology services to the people in her place.

Her husband has an income through farming. He grows and sells rice.

Lesley has requested a loan to buy tools like brush, nipper, nail color and nail cutter. These will improve the services she is about to offer to her clients. Thus, it will help augment her daily income.

She could now provide her children with good food and support their study as well.

She dreams to expand her business to continue to finance the education of her children for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy tools like brush, nipper, nail color and nail cutter.

loans.name: Lonesa

texts.en:
Lonesa is from San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married and a mother of two children, 16 and 9 years old. Her husband is a businessman.

Lonesa is engaged in a food production business. She is the supplier of fried flour snacks in the community. She has been doing this for 13 years. Lonesa and her husband work hard for the future. She aims to uplift her business to have enough money to rebuild her house that was damaged by typhoon Yolanda.

She asks to borrow money for additional capital to continue her business. She wants to buy ingredients for her food production business like cooking oil, sugar and flour. She also wants to buy fertilizer for their rice farming as well.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar and flour for her business as well as fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Herman

texts.es:
Herman tiene 47 años de edad, es conviviente, con carga familiar, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Nanchoc, provincia de San Miguel, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Herman se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería-fumigación, contando con herramientas propias, como mochila de fumigar, palana, pico y oz; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio,además de dedicarse a la cría de animales menores, su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; él piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Herman is 47 years old, he is married, and in charge of a family. He lives with his family in the rural area of the district of Nanchoc, province of San Miguel, province of San Miguel, region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru. His community is mostly dedicated to agriculture, livestock, and commerce. 
Herman works providing services as a day laborer in fumigation. He has his own tools, such as a backpack for fumigation, shovel, pick, and sickle. He has more than ten year of experience in the business, besides also raising small farm animals. His business is located in his home. He is asking for a loan for the maintenance of equipment and tools. Such an investment will be helpful to have his equipment and tools in a better condition, which will greatly influence his business. He is thinking of improving the productivity of his services to be able to tend to the different needs of the clients in the area.

loans.use: to give maintenance to his equipment and work tools.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 30 years old, married, and has two children, who are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been farming vegetables for seven years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Reylyn

texts.en:
Reylyn is 26 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Reylyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

Reylyn has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a widowed woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 60 years old and her one child is still in school.

Rosemarie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, fish, cooking oil, additional utensils and other materials for her food production business.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, fish, ccoking oil, additional utensils and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosenne

texts.en:
Rosenne is 39 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

Rosenne has been in this business for 2 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Rosilda

texts.en:
Rosilda is 32 years old and married with four children.

She is in an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosilda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosilda has been in this business for 7 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling household products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with twelve children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rowena is 47 years old and has six children who are currently in school.

Rowena has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing equipment like fishing net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

Rowena has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment like fishing net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de libros,la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de libros.La socia solicita el credito para comprar libros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues working in her business selling books. The borrower is a hard-working woman who, through this business, wants to get her family ahead. The borrower's dream is to expand her book-selling business. The borrower asks for the loan to purchase books.

The borrower is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase books.

loans.name: Francela Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Francela está integrando por 3 mujeres quien día a día, trabajan fuertemente para sacar adelantes a sus familias, sintiéndose orgullosas de obtener ingresos económicos para salir adelante en la vida. El grupo lo coordina doña Nora de 55 años, ella se dedica a la venta de sopa y nacatamales  desde hace siete años y solicita por terciaba vez el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de carne, verduras, hueso, vegetales, papa y maíz. La segunda socia es la joven Margarett de 24 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, la tercer socia es Yojeysi de 27 años quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y zapatos.
texts.en: The solidarity group Francela is made up of 3 woman who, day by day, work hard to get their families ahead. They are proud to get income to get ahead in life. The group is coordinated by Nora, 55 years old. She has worked selling soup and Nicaraguan tamales for the past seven years and asks for a third time for a loan from the institution to purchase meat, vegetables, bone, potatoes and corn. The second borrower is the young Margarett, 24 years old, who works selling clothing and the third borrower is  Yojeysi, 27 years old who works selling cosmetics and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, bones, potatoes and corn.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Rosa Mística está integrando por 3 mujeres quien día a día, trabajan fuertemente para sacar adelantes a sus familias, sintiéndose orgullosas de poder tener sus propios negocios y obtener ingresos económicos para prosperar en la vida. El grupo lo coordina Olivia de 41 años, casada y madre de un hijo independiente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace tres años y solicita por tercer vez el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de camisas, pantalones, chores y vestidos. Uno de sus logros con los créditos anteriores fue cambiar el techo de su casa. La segunda socia es la joven verónica de 23 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de plata y acero, la tercer socia es doña Ana quien se dedica a la venta de frijoles cocidos.
texts.en: The Solidarity Group Rosa Mística is formed by 3 women, who work hard every day to move their families ahead. They are proud to have their own businesses and get financial income to prosper in life. Olivia, 41 years old, coordinates the group. She is married and has a son, who is independent. She has worked for three years selling clothes, and she is requesting for the third time the loan in the institution in order to buy shirts, pants, shorts and dresses. One of her accomplishments with the previous loans was to change the roof of her house. The second member is 23 year old Veronica, who works selling silver and steel items; and the third member is Ana, who sells cooked beans.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, shorts and dresses.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 52 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

Salvacion has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Maria Felicita

texts.es:
María agradece a la institución por la ayuda que le ha brindado cuando lo ha necesitado, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar harina, levadura, azúcar, maíz, carnes, verduras, entre otros ingredientes primordiales para preparar la venta de pan y tamales, espera que las ventas se mantengan y su situación económica siga mejorando.
Ella expresa que con el buen uso del crédito anterior los productos que elabora tienen mayor calidad, lo que le permite tener nuevos clientes e ingresos, su familia vive en mejores condiciones y se encuentran saludables.
texts.en:
María is grateful to the institution for the help that it has offered her when she has needed it. She needs another loan to purchase flour, yeast, sugar, corn, meat, vegetables, and other basic ingredients to prepare bread and tamales to sell. She hopes that the sales will continue and her economic situation will continue improving.

She says that with the good use of the previous loan, the products that she makes are of better quality, which allows her to have new customers and income. Her family lives in better conditions and is healthy.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, sugar, corn, meat, vegetables, and other basic ingredients to prepare bread and tamales to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La socia Nilda se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora es una persona alegre que le gusta vender la ropa a diferentes amigos,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde puede vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar casacas, blusas y pantalones.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Nilda, continues to work at her business selling clothing. The borrower is a very hard-working woman who likes to sell clothing to different friends. The borrower's dream is to have a store where she can sell clothing. The borrower asks for the loan to purchase jackets, blouses and pants.

The borrower is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase jackets, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Sybil

texts.en:
Sybil is a married woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sybil is 52 years old.

Sybil has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

Sybil has been in this business for three years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Carolina Marilena

texts.es:
Carolina, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que viven con ella, uno de ellos tiene 5 años de edad y el otro tiene dos meses de nacido, ella vive con sus padres, sus hermanos y sus hijos. 

Carolina, actualmente solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar, porque está cuidando su pequeño bebé, antes de tener su hijo trabajaba en la ciudad como empleada doméstica.

Carolina, necesita el crédito para comprar cerdos y aves de corral para engordarlo y luego venderlos, este crédito ayudará para que pueda mantenerse siempre en el negocio y que le siga generando las ganancias suficientes para cubrir sus gastos familiares. 

El sueño de Carolina es, seguir estudiando para tener un título universitario y tener más oportunidades de empleo, por otra parte quiere que sus hijos también se formen académicamente y que puedan aportar al desarrollo de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Carolina, 23 years old, went to school up to the third grade. She is a single mother and has two children who live with her. One is 5 years old and the other is 2 months old. She lives with her parents, her siblings, and her children.

Carolina currently only works taking care of the household tasks because she is taking care of her little baby. Before having her son, she worked in the city as a domestic employee.

Carolina needs the loan to purchase pigs and poultry to fatten them and later sell them. This loan will help her to be able to keep herself constantly in the business and continue generating sufficient income to cover the family expenses.

Carolina's dream is to continue studying to have a university degree and have more work opportunities, and she also wants her children to have a good educational background and that they can contribute to the development of their community.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and poultry to fatten them and later sell them.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old, married, and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Teresita has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 36 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are presently in school. Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

Thelma has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of banana beer to sell and earn more income.

loans.name: Tuelewane Group

texts.fr: Mabangala est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Tuelewane», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 32 ans, mariée à un infirmier, mère 6 enfants dont 3 scolarisés et 3 sont petits. Elle est vendeuse des matériels de couture au marché secondaire de la ville depuis 12 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter des tissus, fils, roulons de papier vaseline, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mabangala is a trader, member of the "Tuelewane" credit group, and client of Hekima MFI. She is 32 years old, married to a nurse, and the mother of six children of whom three are in school and three are infants.
She has sold sewing material in the town's secondary market for twelve years. She started her business with funds that she received from her husband. She will purchase cloth, thread, wax paper, etc. She wishes to grow her activity, to school and feed her children.
In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for the support given to financially excluded entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, wax paper, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros and her husband are engaged in fishing business. This has been there source of income for 40 years. Milagros dreams to have better means of living. She is now 61 years old and a mother of seven children. Among the seven, she has two children that still attending school ages 18 and 17 years old. Milagros works hard to provide the needs of her children. Thus, she is asking a loan to buy fishing net. She is also planning of other additional business that can uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Perla Marina

texts.es:
Perla tiene 46 años de edad, conviviente, con un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Cayaltí,una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería mayormente, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, Region Lambayeque, Costa norte de Perú.

Perla se dedica a brindar servicios de limpieza y mantenimiento a TERCEROS, hace 02 años, solicita préstamo para activo fijo; compra de mayor cantidad de implementos de limpieza como escobas, guantes, desinfectantes, baldes, esponjas, entre otros, de esta manera podrá ofrecer mejores servicios a sus clientes, obteniendo mayores ingresos, y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Perla is 46 years old, partnered, with one child in he care. She lives in her own house made of rustic materials, in the district of Cayaltí, a community which works in agriculture, sales, and raising animals, primarily, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Perla has worked offering cleaning and maintenance services to customers for 2 years. She asks for a loan for fixed assets, to purchase a greater quantity of cleaning tools such as brooms, gloves, disinfectants, buckets, sponges and more, in this way she will be able to offer better services to her customers, getting more income and in this way improve her quality of life and that of her son.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cleaning tools.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna is 37 years old and she lives in Lchashen village of Gegharkunik region. She lives here with her smallest son. Her husband (he works there as a builder) and daughter (she studies there) are in Russian Federation. Ruzanna’s elder son is at the army now. So alone but very skillfully Ruzanna runs farming and manages the care of her farm cattle; she has cows, calves, heifers, pigs, sheep and chickens. She sells her farm milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, meat and also eggs. Ruzanna also has small plot of land the cultivation of which gives harvest of potato and tomato. All her farm products she sells at the wholesale market during the week. Ruzanna would like to enlarge the number of her farm cattle and hopes that Kiva lenders will help her with loan amount to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder her farm cattle

loans.name: Nercy

texts.en: Nercy is a 31-year-old woman from San Dionsion, Iloilo. She married with two son ages 12 and 10 years old. Her husband works hard as a driver while she is running a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this for 10 years. Nercy is asking a loan to buy soft drinks, dinking liquor, sugar, biscuits, candies, chips, spices, toiletries, laundry, canned goods, noodles, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink. In the future, she dreams to have better means of living and to give the best to her sons like sending them college.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, dinking liquor, sugar, biscuits, candies, chips, spices, toiletries, laundry, canned goods, noodles, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink

loans.name: Merlin Alexis

texts.es:
Merlin, de 31 años de edad, es un hombre humilde, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pues sus condiciones económicas no fueron favorables para él y su familia, pero gracias a programas de alfabetización que cursó, logró aprender a leer y a escribir, ahora está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar de su hijo de 1 año de edad. 

Merlin, trabaja como jornalero en diferentes lugares, pues de esa forma obtiene ingresos económicos para él y su familia, pero aparte de dedicarse a esta actividad, también se dedica a sembrar granos básicos como maíz y frijol, esta actividad solo la ejerce en época de invierno junto a sus hermanos, gracias a la siembra de estos cultivos, él puede tener alimentos para su familia y también si la cosecha es buena podrá vender una parte.
  
El financiamiento del préstamo lo utilizara para comprar 2 sacos de abono, fertilizantes, comprar semilla, preparar la tierra y también para pagar mano de obra, con esto podrá cultivar y tener sus propios granos básicos.

Merlin, desea que su único hijo logre estudiar y se gradué de una carrera universitaria, pero también desea tener una buena cosecha este verano, pues es la única forma de donde obtiene ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Merlin, 31 years old, is a humble man. He didn't have the chance to go to school, since the economic conditions were not favorable for him and his family, but thanks to literacy programs he took, he managed to learn to read and write. Now he is married, his wife works with the household tasks and caring for their child, who is 1 year old.

Merlin works as a day laborer in different places, and in this way he gets income for himself and his family, but apart from working in this job, he also works planting basic grains such as corn and beans. This work he only does in the winter with his siblings. Thanks to planting these crops, he can have food for his family and also, if the harvest is good, he can sell a part.

The loan will be used to purchase 2 sacks of manure, fertilizers, seeds, to prepare the land and also to pay labor costs; with this, he will be able to cultivate and have his own basic grains.

Merlin wants his only child to manage to study and graduate with a university degree, but he also wants to have a good harvest this summer, since it is the only way where he gets income.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of manure, fertilizer, seeds, to prepare the land and also to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Lilian Del Carmen

texts.es: Con 26 años de edad Lilian ha demostrado ser una mujer trabajadora que vive junto a su compañero de vida, su hermana de 17 años y su hijo de 7 años de edad. Lilian se dedica desde hace varios años a prestar sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, lo que le permite  sostener la economía de su hogar. Lilian desea reparar el cuarto de la cocina y terminar de construir las paredes de su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para reparar el cuarto de la cocina y las paredes de su vivienda. Con el crédito anterior Lilian compro una pila con dos lavaderos ya que no contaba con un lugar adecuado en el cual resguardar agua para su uso diario.
texts.en: At 26 years old, Lilian has shown herself to be a hard-working woman who lives with her life partner, her 17-year-old sister and her son, who is 7 years old. Lilian has worked for some years providing domestic services in others' homes, which allows her to sustain her household's economy.
