Lilian wants to repair the kitchen and finish building the walls on her house, and for this she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire to repair the kitchen and the walls of her house. With the previous loan, Lilian bought a large water storage basin with two sinks since she didn't have a place to store water for her daily use.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to repair the kitchen and the walls of her house.

loans.name: Yura

texts.en:
This man with his wife lives in the village Chakaten of Syunik region and he hurries to be thankful for his first Kiva loan. He is sure that his second deal with Kiva will be as profitable as the first one. Yura has a daughter and a son both of them are already married.

For the last 4 years using his own tractor and hay mowing machine, Yura mainly gives paid services in his village on the farms of his neighbors. He mentions in spring and summer season he mainly works on his hay mowing machine since the farmers want to gather hay and store it for the coming cold seasons. Yura uses his tractor in autumn season and since very soon the work will start, he wants to keep it in order to work without difficulties.

So with this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams he will use in order to repair the engine of his tractor and also to buy new tires for the front part of the tractor.

loans.use: to repair the engine of his tractor and also to buy new front tires for the tractor.

loans.name: Glenda Yamileth

texts.es:
Glenda, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 12 años de edad, que actualmente están estudiando en la escuela, en su casa viven 10 personas, la gran mayoría son sobrinos y hermanas de ella, pero que las únicas personas que dependen de ella solo son su esposo y sus dos hijos.

Glenda, se dedica a la venta de antojitos tales como yuca frita, tamales y atol, esto lo realiza desde hace cinco años, decidió colocar este negocio porque siempre le ha gustado cocinar y muchas veces los vecinos llegaban a comprarle de los antojitos que ella hacía para su familia; fue así como pensó que sería un muy buen negocio y comenzó a salir a vender a las casas y todo marchaba muy bien, entonces decidió colocar un pequeño local en su casa y es así como ella ahora puede obtener ingresos económicos, para poder mantener a su familia. 

Glenda, necesita el crédito para fortalecer su negocio, específicamente necesita comprar una cocina eléctrica, bebidas y materia prima para elaborar sus productos; gracias a este financiamiento y a estas comprar, logrará ofrecer un mejor producto y el trabajo se le hará ms fácil.

Glenda, desea tener un trabajo fijo, pero siempre mantener su pequeño negocio; ella sueña con algún día tener un pequeño restaurante y poder ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Glenda is 37 years old. She finished secondary school. She lives with her life partner and has two children aged 16 and 12 who are currently at school. 10 people live in her house. Most of these people are her nephews and sisters but the only people that are financially dependent on her are her husband and two children.

Glenda sells snacks such as fried yucca and atole (a corn based drink). She has been doing this for five years. She decided to set up this business because she has always wanted to cook and because her neighbours used to buy the snacks that she made for her family and this is when she thought it would be a good business. She started selling food door to door and it was going very well. This was when she decided to set up her own little diner in her home which allowed her to have an income and thus support her family.

Glenda needs the loan to strengthen her business. She specifically needs to buy a new electric cooker, drinks and basic ingredients to make her products. Thanks to this loan she will be able to offer her clients better products and her job will become easier.

Glenda wants to have a stable job, and always keep her small business. Her dream is to some day own a small restaurant and to be able to support her children so that they can study a degree at university.

loans.use: to strengthen her business. She specifically needs to buy a new electric cooker, drinks and basic ingredients to make her products.

loans.name: Moud

texts.en:
Moud is a 23-year-old single young woman from the Mt Darwin district of Zimbabwe. She is a committed volunteer in her community, actively helping to keep children in school through life skills development because she believes that they have a chance in life when they make informed choices.

Moud is currently operating a poultry business which she started in 2013. She wanted to have a stable source of income and found that poultry was a profitable business to start. The first Kiva loan assisted her in purchasing chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales.

Moud has a business stall at a large market where she sells a variety of items which range from children clothes, shirts, skirts, sandals, hats and bags. Since there are no big shops which sell clothes nearby her sales are usually quite high, although they are affected by cotton seasons.

Moud hopes to get a second Kiva loan so that she can further expand her clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shirts, skirts, sandals, hats and bags.

loans.name: Ta Pyae Kan Village Group

texts.en:
The featured borrower, Chit is 37 years old and has three children who are students and one is helping his parents. He farm is a 4 acres crop farm and also, as a second business, the family raise ducks and fishes.

This loan will help Chit purchase ducklings and also food for them. If the ducks get more food and grow faster that of course, will lay eggs in early ages which will able Chit to boost income faster. He hopes to have better progress in both of his business so that the family will have enough income to cover all the living cost and as well as to be able to donate alms.


Pictured above are the members from Ta Paye Kan Group, named as Chit, Han, Thin, Nay and Aung. This loan will help other members purchase ducks and the vaccines, which will make ducks be healthy and more productive.


This village is located in Ta Paye Kan Village in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy River, Delta Region. Besides duck farming, for business, villagers do fishing, tailoring and agricultural productions. But most of every households raise animals as livestock or business.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings and duck food.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 44, is married with four children aged 8 to 23. She is engaged in fishing and catches and sells fish and crabs to the neighboring towns.

She has been in this business for more than 10 years now. She resides in the town of Tubigon, Bohol. 

To augment her income, she has requested a loan to buy fishing materials like a plastic screen. This will enable her to make more crab nets.  Thus, it could help improve her earnings. She would then be able to start expanding her business and be able to balance her finances wisely.

In the future, Elizabeth hopes that she can improve the living condition of her family through commitment and hard work.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cabbages, onions,kales, fruits. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of cabbages, onions, fruits, kale. She hopes that in the future, she will prosper.

loans.use: buy more stock of cabbages, onions, fruits, kale.

loans.name: Samuelo

texts.en:
Samuelo is 36 years old. He is married with three children (ages 2, 6 & 10). Samuelo has been in the business of raising hogs and operating a sari-sari store for eleven years now.  He is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy beer, coke, and cigarettes to stock his store and to buy feed so that his hogs will grow healthy.

In the future, Samuelo plans to make his business bigger and more sustainable. His income will be used to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy beer, coke, and cigarettes to stock his store and to buy feed so that his hogs will grow healthy.

loans.name: Twizere Ii Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline   fait partie du groupe  Twizere II et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 40 ans et est mariée à Sylvere, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants  âgés de  7 à 20  ans.
  
Elle  fait le commerce des œufs  et des pièces de rechange pour vélos depuis  3 ans. 

Elle  est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’œufs  et pièces  de  rechange   à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is part of the Twizere group. She lives in Gitega. She is 40 years old and is married to Sylvere, a small-scale retailer. Together, they have six children aged 7 to 20 years.

Jacqueline has been selling eggs and spare parts for bicycles for three years. She is on her third loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she has requested, she is going to grow her working capital and buy a larger quantity of eggs and spare part so as to earn more.

loans.use: to earn more by growing her working capital and buying a large quantity of eggs and spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Wealth Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Yatta is a thirty-five years old business woman. She is a member of “Wealth” solidarity group. “Wealth” solidarity group has five members all are women. Yatta sells palm oil, weave-on hair and slippers.
Yatta has been in this business for the past 15 years. She opens her business six days in a week from 9am to 6pm.

Yatta established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buy learning material and provides food from the profit she gets from her business.
Yatta and her group members needs a loan totaling 13,000,000 SLL of which Yatta is entitled to 4,000,000 SLL and will use to buy additional 60 rubbers of palm oil, 10 bundles slippers and some amount of weave-on hair for her business. See group picture Yatta (in the middle of the group).
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Yatta is married and has 2 children with the ages of 10 and 5 years who are all school going children.

In the future, Yatta plan to save more money to provide for her children’s university education and to expand her business. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.
Yatta and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional 60 rubbers of palm oil,  10 bundles slippers.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
When you look at Doris, she is the true definition of a hard worker. She is a farmer in Nkubu. Doris is involved in maize, poultry, and dairy farming. She engages in milk and egg production for commercial purposes, as opposed to many rural farmers who produce for subsistence. Doris also grows maize for food and sales. These commercial activities place her in a better position to engage in other agricultural businesses, which, in fact, she does. 

Doris is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help significantly in managing the animals’ health and hygiene. She has been in the farming business for at least 10 years. She has no plans to quit in the future, as she finds farming to be not only fulfilling, but also lucrative. However, her biggest challenges are the poor road network and the lack of market. With your loan, Doris will construct a cow shed, which will later come in handy when she scales up and introduces zero-grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to her children’s education. Kindly lend to a Kenyan farmer with great dreams!

loans.use: to build a modern dairy shed.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 60 years old and he lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. He is married and lives with his wife. He has three daughters; his two daughters are married and only smallest still lives with her parents. Samvel lives near a village where he is engaged in gardening activities.

He has nice orchard full of apricot, apple, fig, persimmon and cherry trees. His vegetable garden are also rich; here he cultivates potato, beans, tomato, cucumber, cabbage and greens. All these assortment of sweet and tasty fruits and vegetables, Samvel sells at the wholesale market.

In order to repair the fence of his large garden and also to install new watering pipes in it Samvel decided to cooperate with Kiva lenders and he asks 700.000 Armenian drams for these necessary works in the garden.

loans.use: to repair the fence of his large garden and also to install new watering pipes in it.

loans.name: Go Try Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Musu is the leader of Go-Try Solidarity Group which is made up of four members. All five members including Musu are engaged in small scale trading but selling different products.

Musu who is 48 years old was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people. She sells provisions. Musu has been selling provisions for the past 10 years. She uses proceeds of her business to pay fees for her children’s education and to provide livelihood for her family.

Musu and other group members of Go-Try solidarity are requesting for their third loan with a total of 4,000,000SLL of this amount, Musu will personally receive 1,000,000SLL which she will use to purchase more 4 cartons of milk, 1 bag sugar, sardines, ovaltine, etc. for her business. See Musu (stands in the middle of the picture).
Musu is married and has a cheerful family of two children aged 27 and 24 years old.
Musu hopes that her business continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a house and also prepare for her old age. Musu hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family
Musu and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more 4 cartons of milk, 1 bag sugar, sardines, ovaltine.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en: Rechel is 22 years old and a resident in Iloilo, Philippines. Like the other people in the community, Rechel and her family also engaged in fishing business. It has been their source of income since then. To uplift their livelihood, she dreams to have a new boat that can be used in fishing. She wants to improve their business and with that, she asks to lend money to buy new fishing net and fishing weight.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and fishing weight.

loans.name: Sofronio

texts.en:
Sofronio is a dealer and a retailer of a personal collection products and sells items like tooth paste, soap, fabric conditioner, shampoo, toilet bowl cleaner and beauty products.
He is a married man with two young dependents ages 7 and 4 month-old.   To augment his income, he also sold prepaid load to the local  subscribers in his place.

He  is asking for a loan to purchase personal collection products and load. He could continue sold load at the same time purchase the orders of his clients. These will cause to improve his income and able to settle his obligation. He could also  provide good food for his family and build better shelter.

Sofronio is doing his best to manage his livelihood well for him to support the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to purchase personal collection products and load

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a merchant from the town of Tubigon, Bohol. She is 47 years old, married, and has two grown children. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items such as noodles, biscuits, instant coffee, sugar, soft drinks, rice, diapers, and toiletries. She has been operating the store for almost three years now.

Elenita needs capital to maintain the content of her store. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan to buy a sack of rice, soft drinks, canned goods, and chips to stock her store. This will allow her to cater to her customers' needs and will enable her to improve her earnings. She will be able to start to handle her finances and to settle her obligation.

She exclaims that "with hard work and determination" her family's living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, soft drinks, canned goods, and chips.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel runs a sari-sari (variety) store for two years now. He sold commodities like coffee,eggs, edible oil, powdered juice drink, canned goods, biscuits, soap, shampoo, seasonings, and noodles. 
He is married man with 3-year old child. Together with his family, he lives in Carmen, Bohol.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP to buy assorted groceries such as beverages, toiletries and dry goods. It will enhance the supply of the store and also prevent from running out of stocks. Thus, attracting more customers to come and purchase. His income will improve and his family could enjoy nutritious meals and also start to handle his finances wisely.

He is doing his best to manage properly his livelihood to experience  better living condition and also he could support the schooling of his child in the near future.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries such as beverages, toiletries and dry goods

loans.name: Chicharrines Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
En cierta localidad veracruzana es común observar a los habitantes visitar los ríos que la rodean debido a las altas temperaturas que se registran todo el año. Los periodistas locales nombraron a la región como “la novia del sol” ya que al perecer el calor y la tierra parecen tener un romance. 
   En una de las colonias de dicha localidad se integró un grupo llamado Chicharrines debido a que uno de los integrantes vende botanas tradicionales conocidas como “chicharrones”. Los integrantes actuales del grupo son: Adolfina quien vende abarrotes; Virginia, comida y servicio de peluquería; Petra, refrescos; Dominga, refrescos, comida, papelería e internet; José A., chicharrones y dulces; Adela, zapatos y ropa por catálogo; Ana, cosméticos y zapatos por catálogo. Por su lado Martha maneja una purificadora de agua; Víctor, un taxi y José O., un taller eléctrico. 
   José A., es un hombre joven que está totalmente dedicado al cuidado de su familia integrada por su esposa Susana y su pequeña hija de dos años. Cuando dejo sus estudios comenzó a laborar como repartidor en una empresa de botanas sin embargo el deseo de tener un negocio propio lo llevó a renunciar e invertir sus ahorros en la venta de chicharrones. La botana es realizada por él mismo, dentro de una gran cacerola con aceite vierte la pasta que gradualmente adquiere una consistencia crujiente; posteriormente elabora los paquetes de frituras que reparte entre las tiendas de su comunidad. 
   El éxito que ha tenido en tan solo ocho meses lo ha llevado a planear ampliar las rutas de venta, de igual modo incrementar su producción y lograr hacer de su negocio una empresa emergente. Aunque existe competencia ésta no le preocupa ya que su calidad y precio lo respaldan, o como dice su eslogan son “chicharrones con sabor a hogar”.
   Las ganancias son ocupadas en la compra de pasta, aceite, chile, chicles, cacahuates, bolsas, etiquetas y otros dulces, también cubre el sueldo de sus empleados y el combustible de sus autos. El préstamo actual lo invertiría en la compra de pasta, aceite, bolsas y etiquetas. “estoy sumamente agradecido con Dios y con quienes han hecho posible que haga realidad mis sueños” comenta José A.
*La fotografía muestra a los miembros del grupo, José A. es quien sostiene una bolsa de chicharrones en la mano y viste playera azul cielo.
texts.en:
In the town of Veracruzana it is common to observe the inhabitants visiting the rivers that surround due to the high temperatures recorded throughout the year. The local journalists named the region "the bride of the sun" being that to perish the heat and the earth seem to have an affair.

In one of the colonies of this town a group called Chicharrines joined because one of the members who sells the traditional snacks known as "chicharrones" joined. The current members of the group are: Adolfina who sells groceries; Virginia, food and spa services; Petra, soft drinks; Dominga, soft drinks, food, stationary and the internet; José. A., chicharrones and sweets; Adela, shoes and clothing by catalog; Ana, cosmetics and shoes by catalog. By her side Martha manages water purification; Victor, a taxi and José O., an electrical workshop.

José A. is a young man who is totally dedicated to taking care of his family and for her wife Susana and their small daughter of two years. When he left his studies he began working as a delivery boy in a snack business, however the desire to have his own business led him to give up and invest his savings in the sale of chicharrones. He makes the snacks himself, inside of a large pan with oil poured on the pasta and gradually he acquires a crunchy consistency; after he makes the packets with the fries that they share between the shops in his community.

The success that he has had for just eight months has allowed him to plan to expand sales routes, and in the same way increase his production and achieve making his business a startup. Although there is competition, he is not worried since his quality and price support it, or as his slogan says "chicharrones with the flavor of home".

The earnings are engaged in the purchase of pasta, oil, pepper, gum, peanuts, bags, labels and other sweets, also it covers the salary of his employees and the fuel for their cars. The current loan will be invest in the purchase of pasta, oil, bags and labels. "I am deeply grateful to God and to those who have made it possible to make my dreams come true" says José A.

*The photograph shows the members of the group. José A. is the one holding a bag of pork rinds in his hand and is wearing a sky blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy pasta, oil, bags and labels.

loans.name: Alvie

texts.en:
Alvie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to make dried fish. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Alvie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Ana Adela

texts.es:
Ana, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su esposo trabaja junto a ella en la venta de frutas, es madre de dos hijos, su primer hijo tiene 10 años de edad y estudia tercer grado y la segunda hija estudia kínder y tiene 6 años de edad. 

Ana, trabaja vendiendo licuados en la universidad de El Salvador desde hace 8 años, este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana mayor, pues ella inicio primero con este negocio; luego ella decidió seguir cuando emigraron para la capital en busca de trabajo; el lugar donde trabaja está a 10 kilómetros de su casa y para llegar se transporta en carro y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m.

Ana, necesita el crédito para comprar frutas, leche y azúcar para preparar los licuados y pagar la cuota del local donde vende, de esa manera espera suplir su negocio con todos los insumos necesarios y así dar abasto a la demanda que tiene.

El sueño de Ana, es que su negocio crezca día con día y sueña con abrir otro local en la misma universidad, para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana, age twenty-eight, finished high school. She lives with her common-law-husband, who works along with her, selling fruit. She is the mother of two children. Her first child, a boy, is ten years old and studying in the third grade, and her second child, a daughter, is six years old and studying in kindergarten.

Ana has been working selling smoothies at the University of El Salvador for eight years. She learned this business from her older sister, as she started in this business first. Later, she decided to continue when they migrated to the capital in search of work. The area where she works is ten kilometers from her house, and she gets there by car. Her schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.

Ana needs the loan to purchase fruit, milk, and sugar for making the smoothies, and to make the payments on her sales stand. In this way, she hopes to stock her business with all the necessary supplies, and thus keep up with her demand.

Ana's dream is that her business may grow each day, and she dreams of opening another stand in the same university, in order to give better service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, milk, and sugar for making the smoothies, and to make the payments on her sales stand.

loans.name: Jeleta

texts.en:
Jeleta is 39 years old and has seven children. Jeleta is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Jeleta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jeleta requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jeleta has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jeleta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Wonder Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Mariatu is a forty-nine years old business woman. She is a member of “Wonder” solidarity group of four women. Mariatu sells drinks to the general public.
Mariatu has been in this business for the past three years. She opens her business six days in a week from 8am to 6pm.
Mariatu established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food from the profit she gets from her business.

Mariatu and her group members needs a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL of which she is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL to buy 5 crates of coke drinks, 5 crates of fanta drinks for her business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Mariatu is married and has three children who are both school going children. See Mariatu(in the middle of the group picture).

In the future, Mariatu plan to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.
Mariatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 5 crates of coke drinks, 5 crates of fanta drinks for her business.

loans.name: Sa'er

texts.en:
Sa'er opened his cell shop in 2014 where he sells mobile recharge cards and accessories for mobile phones. Sa'er, one of the Palestinian refugees who grew up in camp located in North Lebanon, is 23 years old. Since his parents passed away, he lives with his two younger brothers, his grandmother, his uncle and his cousin in a rented apartment inside the camp.

He is single and working hard to prove himself to his family and to help them improve their living situation. So far, Sa'er's good reputation and hard work have ensured his business' success and encouraged him to expand it.

For the first time, Sa'er is asking for 2,057,996 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. He is planning to use this loan to buy new cell phone models and some mobile accessories and sell them in his shop. The loan will therefore help him expand his shop with new supplies. Thus, Saer will answer his clients needs in the area, which will lead to his business' financial sustainability and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories.

loans.name: G.s El Sillon Group

texts.es:
El señor Santos es una persona que se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 4 años, se levanta todos los días muy temprano para poder darle mantenimiento a su finca, el cosecha al año un promedio de 30 quintales y sus ventas las realiza en los principales lugares de la zona.
Don Santos está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de un sistema de planta solar debido a que en su comunidad carecen de energía eléctrica, espera que esta inversión que realice le ayude a mejorar su calidad de vida y le puede satisfacer su necesidad, a su vez está contento porque al utilizar ese tipo de energía solar está contribuyendo a la protección del medio ambiente.
Don Santos el préstamo lo solicita de manera grupal y sus compañeros de grupo también están contentos de gozar de este beneficio.
Doña Digna se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 6 años.
Don Francisco se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 17años.
Doña Balvina se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 6 años.
Doña Yessi se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 6 años.


Danli, Honduras - Julio 2015
texts.en:
Santos has been growing coffee for 4 years. He gets up very early every day in order to maintain his plot. His yearly harvest provides him with 30 quintals of coffee, which he sells in the main places in the area.

Santos is asking for a loan to buy a solar power system as within his community they have no electricity. He hopes that this loan will help him to improve his quality of life and that it will satisfy his needs. He is also happy because by using this type of energy he will be helping to protect the environment.

They are asking for the loan as a group and the other members of the group besides Santos are also happy to benefit from the energy source.

Digna has been growing coffee for 6 years.

Francisco has been growing coffee for 17 years.

Balvina has been growing coffee for 6 years.

Yessi has been growing coffee for 6 years.

Danli, Honduras - July 2015

loans.use: to buy solar panel plants for their houses.

loans.name: Maria Rosenda

texts.es: María es una mujer de 41 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración de gabachas, las cuales vende en los diferentes mercados desde hace 2 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una gran cartera de clientes que solicitan sus productos. María vive en casa de su propiedad en la cual disfruta de la compañía de su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos una niña de 7 años y dos varones de 18 y 2 años de edad que son su mayor alegría. María ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: telas de diferentes colores, hilos, agujas, entre otros productos para la elaboración de gabachas.
texts.en:
María, age 41, is a hardworking woman who earns a living making aprons, which she has sold at various markets for the last two years. She is able to rely on a diverse set of customers who seek out her products. María lives in her own home alongside her partner and their three children, her greatest joys: a 7-year-old girl and two boys ages 18 and 2.

María decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing fabric in various colors, thead, needles, and other products for making aprons.

loans.use: buy materials to make and sell aprons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay college tuition.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es:
El señor Norberto tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su esposa en casa propia y su actividad principal es la venta de pan al contando, tiene 2 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad y tiene una buena clientela gracias a su buena atención y ubicación de su negocio.
Don Norberto está solicitando el préstamo para la compra panes de diferentes variedades como corazones, pan blancos, semitas, etc. y así tener un muy bien surtido y  poder satisfacer la demanda de su clientela, espera que esta inversión le permita mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Don Norberto uno de sus sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida y tener una muy  buena solvencia económica en el futuro, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños y así sentir el apoyo que Prisma de Honduras.


Trojes,  Honduras - Julio del 2015
texts.en:
Norberto, age 29, lives with his wife in their own house. His primary work is selling bread on cash accounts. He's done this for two years, and he has a good customer base thanks to his attention to detail and the location of his business.

Norberto is requesting this loan so that he can buy a variety of types of bread, including heart-shaped rolls, country loaves, and white bread. Having a well stocked business will allow him to meet the demands of his customers. He expects that this investment will allow him to earn more money and cover his family's expenses and other financial commitments.

One of Norberto's goals is to improve his living conditions and rely on economic solvency in the future. With the support from this loan and Prisma de Honduras, he will be able to work towards achieving his dreams.


Trojes, Honduras - July 2015

loans.use: stock his business with a variety of types of bread

loans.name: Sheren

texts.en:
Sheren lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is married and her husband is a fisherman who also farms rice for a living.

Sheren is dependent on her hog-raising business, farming and fish vending to support the needs of her four children aged 1 - 14. She started raising hogs in 2014 and she earns PHP 4,000 every time she sells her pigs.

She is asking for a loan to buy fresh fish, piglets and fertilizer for her farm. This will support her business to maximize her income and time.

She dreams of having a prosperous business so that she can continue to send her children to school / college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra is a 47-year-old widow from Talibon, Bohol.

For the last seven years, Silvestra has been engaged in running a sari-sari (convenience) store business, where she sells milk, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, soy sauce, salt, rice, noodles and chips.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of goods like rice, seasoning, toiletries, condiments and beverages.

Her income will be used to pay for the family's daily needs, for savings and for reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy rice, seasoning, toiletries, condiments, beverages and feed.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a resident in San Dionisio, Iloilo. She has been engaged in various businesses to earn a living. She owned a small sari-sari (variety) store for 20 years. In addition to this, she buys and sells RTW (ready-to-wear) products, such as pants, shirts, slippers, and shoes. She is also engaged in a rice farming business. 

Teresa is 45 years old and dreams of expanding and improving her business so that she can invest in other businesses and improve her livelihood. She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items, such as toiletries, laundry soap, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, spices, coffee, and powdered chocolate drink mix. She also plans to buy fertilizer for her farm and RTW products to sell. Additionally, her husband is a salesman.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, laundry soap, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, spices, coffee, powdered chocolate drink mix, fertilizer, and RTW products.

loans.name: Ermedita

texts.en:
Ermedita is 40 years old and is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

Prior to this loan request, Ermedita has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF. Now, she has requested another loan to further build her business. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns income from rice farming. Ermedita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Mukulima Kawizi Group

texts.fr: Très gâté par ses parents et voyant la pauvreté s'approcher de sa maison après leur decès, Augustin a été conscientisé par ses amis à recourir à la culture de la tomate en 1998, après la deuxième guerre de libération qu'a connu le pays. Cette activité fait actuellement vivre sa famille quoique les moyens financiers sont insuffisants pour financer ses activités. Il souhaiterait exploiter une superficie d'un hectare afin de prétendre bénéficier d'argent lui permettant de répondre au vécu quotidien, la scolarisation de ses enfants jusqu'au niveau universitaire et la construction d'une maison en matériaux durables. Augustin est président du groupe MUKULIMA KAWIZI, sur photo il tient un arrosoir et une machette.
texts.en:
Spoiled rotten by his parents and seeing poverty in the offing for his household after their passing, Augustin learned from his friends about changing over to growing tomatoes, after his country's second war of liberation. This activity presently supports his family although his funds are insufficient to finance his activities. He would like to farm one hectare so as to hope to make a profit that would permit him to cover daily living expenses, school fees for his children up to university level, and building a permanent house to live in.

Augustin is the president of the group called Mukulima Kawizi. In the photo he is holding a watering can and a machete.

loans.use: to buy mulch, do weeding, and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: El Potrero Group

texts.es:
La cultura mazahua se desarrolló en distintas partes del Estado de México lo que da pie a encontrar rasgos que conservan sus pobladores actualmente; la lengua y tradiciones son una parte importante de la riqueza cultural del país. Las actividades que rigen la economía local de dichas regiones son la agricultura y la ganadería. El grupo El Potrero es originario de allí y los integrantes siempre muestran un gran aprecio por su comunidad y raíces. 
   Don Héctor y Catalina son personas caracterizadas por su responsabilidad ya que siempre piensan en el bienestar de su familia, de igual forma son conocidos por su amabilidad y buen humor. La pareja formó una familia con tres hijos quienes ahora son independientes. “Antes no había escuelas y realmente estudiar no era importante como ahora” razón por la que decidieron esforzarse en dar educación a sus hijos.
   Tanto Héctor como Catalina heredaron el respeto y cariño por el campo del cual aprovechan sus beneficios. Han formado un equipo para criar distintos tipos de animales lo que les ha representado una manera amigable y productiva de conseguir ingresos; actualmente mantienen 16 becerros en su casa los cuales cuida con el apoyo de toda su familia. 
    El reto más grande para ellos es adquirir el alimento para los animales ya que la cría puede durar varios meses y hasta entonces no obtienen ingresos. No obstante en los préstamos que VFMéxico otorga han encontrado la solución a este contratiempo. En esta ocasión compraría pastura para sus animales la cual consigue en un mercado local. 
   Todo el grupo está muy agradecido con VFMéxico pues sus préstamos han servido para mejorar su negocio y con las ganancias obtenidas han podido mejorar su calidad de vida. María Isabel es nuera de la pareja e integrante del grupo y también invertirá en ganado.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín de la cabecera municipal donde habitan las clientes.
texts.en: The Mazahua culture developed in different parts of the State of Mexico, and currently many of its inhabitants exhibit their features. Language and traditions are an important part of the cultural wealth of the country. Their main local financial activities are agriculture and animal husbandry. The "Potrero Group" is native to this area, and their members always show a great appreciation for their community and roots. Hector and Catalina are people characterized by their responsibility, because they always think of the well being of their family. They are also known for their kindness and good humor. The couple formed a family of three children who are now independent. “Before, there were no schools and studying was really not important as it is now", reason why they decided to work hard to give an education to their children. Hector, as well as Catalina, inherited respect and love to the fields from where they take their benefits. They have formed a team to raise different types of animals, which has resulted in an amicable and productive way to earn income. Currently, they have 16 calves in their house, which they take care of with support of their whole family. Their biggest challenge is to get food for the animals, because raising can take many months in which they have no income. Nevertheless, with the loans of VFMexico they have found a solution to this obstacle. This time, they will buy pasture for their animals, which they can get at the local market. The whole group is grateful to VFMexico because their loans have served to improve their business, and with the earned income they have been able to improve their quality of life. Maria Isabel is the couple's daughter-in-law and a member of the group. She will also invest in cattle. *The photograph was taken in the garden of the Municipality where the members live.

loans.use: to buy food for the animals.

location.town: La Trampa, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 23 years old and a resident in San Dionisio, Iloilo. She is married and a mother of two children, ages 4 and 2 years old.

Vivian is engaged in various businesses to earn a living. She raises pigs, sells food (snacks), and owns a corn (maize) plantation. Her husband works hard as a farmer. Thus, Vivian is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs and ingredients for her food selling business such as sugar, cooking oil and flour. She will also buy fertilizer for her corn (maize) plantation.

In the future, she dreams to improve her business to have better earnings to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, sugar, cooking oil, flour and fertilizer

loans.name: Antinea Group

texts.es:
Originarios del Estado de México, el grupo Antinea está integrado por personas que comparten un objetivo en común; incrementar sus ingresos en favor de sus familias. El nombre fue elegido debido a que es igual al de un negocio cuyo crecimiento ha sido la inspiración para los demás integrantes. La comunidad donde habitan es de tradiciones muy arraigadas pero con un desarrollo económico naciente que se ve demostrado en actividades como la agricultura y la ganadería. 
   Isabel es una mujer en la que se pueden reconocer las cualidades del trabajo y la amabilidad. Siempre busca la mejor manera para que su familia se desarrolle en un ambiente de respeto y fraternidad. Su carácter emprendedor la llevó a dedicarse al cultivo de verduras en  un inicio, sin embargo encontró en la venta de cosméticos la mejor herramienta para obtener ingresos y pasar tiempo con su familia. Por otro lado, está firmemente decidida a iniciar una nueva actividad para complementar la actual, ésta es la cría de ganado. “Mi papá me aconseja para cuidar correctamente a mis animales, me dice que son muy fáciles de criar sólo es cuestión de alimentarlos bien” comentó Isabel muy entusiasmada. 
   La oportunidad del crédito le servirá para comprar becerros y alimento necesario con el que pueda criarlos. Mientras tanto seguirá laborando en la venta de cosméticos puesto que las ganancias que ofrecen los animales tardan en llegar. El objetivo que tiene en mente es poder incrementar la producción de ganado para tener los ingresos necesarios y contribuir en la educación de sus hijos además de comprar ropa y muebles necesarios en su hogar.
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son Nestor quien invertirá en ovejas; Josefa, en pollo y Alfredo, en productos de abarrotes. Todos se encuentran muy agradecidos con las oportunidades brindadas en favor de sus actividades. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda del señor Alfredo quien viste la gorra de color café e Isa se encuentra junto a él.
texts.en:
Coming from the country of Mexico, the group Antinea consists of people who share a common goal: to increase their income for the benefit of their families.

The name was chosen because it does not matter whose business's growth is the inspiration for the other members.

The community they are living in has very deep-rooted traditions but a recent economical development, which is showing in the fields of agriculture and livestock farming.

Isabel is a woman in whom you can see the qualities of work and kindness. She is always looking for the best way for her family to develop in an respectful and united environment. With her enterprising character, she began to cultivate vegetables but later found that selling cosmetics is the best way to generate an income and spend time with her family.

She also committed herself strongly to start something new to complement her current activity: raising cattle.

"My dad is my advisor to care correctly for my animals. He tells me they are very simple to raise. It is only a question of nourishing them well", says Isabel very enthusiastically.

The opportunity of this loan will help her to buy calves and the necessary food to raise them. Meanwhile she will continue selling cosmetics since the income from the animals will come later. The goal she has in mind is to be able to increase the production of her animals to make enough income and contribute to her children's education, to buy clothes and needed furniture for her home.

The other members of the group are Nestor, who will invest in sheep, Josefa, who will invest in chicken, and Alfredo, who will invest in goods for his grocery store. They are all very thankful for the opportunities they are offered for their business.

*The photo was taken in Alfredo's store, who wears the coffee-colored hat and Isabel is next to him.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Cristo Antonio

texts.es:
Cristo is 45 years old and lives in the municipality of Sincelejo on the Colombian Atlantic coast; he lives with his partner and his three beautiful daughters, whom are the main reason of Cristo’s life. He owns a raising cattle business, which he started for necessity, but especially, because he loves to work in farms.

This man is not earning much so he doesn’t have the money to invest in his business, also the cost of the inputs for his business are really expensive. He wants to increase his profits and make his business last in time, that’s why he’s asking for a loan so he can buy pigs and chickens. 

Cristo works really hard for his family, and for his dreams, that are their family too, he wants to fix his house because it has some problems, and he wants that his family can live save and comfortable. You can help this hard worker man with a loan and get him closer to achieve his goals.
texts.en:
Cristo is 45 years old and lives in the municipality of Sincelejo on the Atlantic coast of Colombia; he lives with his partner and his three beautiful daughters, who are Cristo's reason for living. He owns a business raising cattle, which he started out necessity, but especially because he loves farming.

Cristo doesn't earn much, so he doesn’t have the money to invest in the very expensive inputs for his business. He wants to increase his profits and make his business last, which is why he’s asking for a loan so he can buy pigs and chickens.

Cristo works really hard for his family, and for the dreams he has for them. He wants to fix his house because it has some problems, and he wants his family to be able to live safely and comfortably. You can help this hard working man with a loan and help him on the path to achieving his goals.

loans.use: buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elna works hard to support her family.

She has a ticketing office business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Elna is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase a new computer set for her ticketing office business.

Elna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer set for her ticketing office business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Her name is Erlinda. She is 58 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Since her husband died many years ago, she has dedicated herself in raising her children, of which four are already married; her youngest is in Grade 7 in school. Being a single parent is the biggest challenge in her life, but she is thankful that she has a farm to make a living.

Erlinda has owned a pineapple and corn farm for 20 years already. Agriculture is the primary and often only source of income for poor rural people. Silang is in the highland and has fertile soil where it is suited to grow various fruits and veggies. She sells her produce to the local market and vendors at her town.

To help her sustain and grow her business, she is seeking your assistance of a 15,000 PHP loan to pay for fertilizer, seedlings and labor for her farm. Her farm means a lot to her for it is her main source to provide for their daily needs.

Erlinda only dreams to always have a productive harvest on her farm. She trusts that God will continue to bless her with abundance in all aspects of her life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, seedlings, and labor for her farm.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a making of dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy an additional basket of fish to make dried fish for her making of dried fish business.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional basket of fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Dushime Ii Group

texts.fr:
Abraham   fait partie du groupe  Dushime II et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 47 ans et est marié à Jeanine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants  âgés de 5 à 21 ans.

Il fait le commerce de  savon, de pagnes, du lait de beauté,  depuis  30 ans. 

Il est à son vingtième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de savons et de pagnes  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  acheter un terrain cultivable et   voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Abraham is a member of the group called Dushime. He lives in Gitega. He is 47 years old and married to Jeanine, a farmer. Together they have six children aged 5 to 21 years. Abraham has been selling soap, pagnes (African print cloth), and cosmetics for 30 years.

He is on his 20th loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he has requested, he is going to grow his working capital and buy lots of soap and pagnes for resale, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy some farmland and see his children attend college.

loans.use: to grow his working capital and earn more by buying lots of soap and pagnes (lengths of brightly colored cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
FIDEL TIENE 33 AÑOS DE EDAD, CONVIENTE, CON UN HIJO DEPENDIENTE, VIVE CON SU CONYUGUE Y SU HIJO EN EL CASERIO CUYCA – DISTRITO DE CHOROS, PROVINCICA DE CUTERVO, REGION CAJAMARCA, SIERRA NORTE DE PERU. DISTRITO MEDIANO , EN DICHO DISTRITO LA POBLACION SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA SIENDO EL CULTIVO DE ARROZ EL DE MAYOR PRODUCCION, ASI COMO AL COMERCIO EN GENERAL, ETC DISTRITO MEDIANO CON ASPIRACIONES A SUPERARSE.

FIDEL SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO COMPRA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE GRANOS SEGUN CAMPAÑA, COMO SON MAIZ, MENESTRAS, SOYA, ENTRE OTRAS, ÉL COMPRA DICHOS PRODUCTOS EN CASERIOS CERCANOS A LOS AGRICULTORES Y LUEGO LOS COMERCIALIZA EN EL PUERTO COMERCIAL DE CHIPLE, ADEMAS CUENTA CON UNA MOTOTAXI CON LA CUAL REALIZA TRANSPORTE PUBLICO, PRESENTA BUENAS REFRENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES, TIENE 5 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO, EL DESTINO DEL PRESTAMO ES LA COMPRA DE MAYOR CANTIDAD DE GRANOS PARA AUMENTAR EL STOCK DE SU NEGOCIO, AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y POR ENDE MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Fidel is 33 years old and in a relationship with one dependent son. He lives with his partner and son in the small village of Cuyca in the Choros district, which is in the Cutervo province of the Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru. It is a medium-sized district whose population works in agriculture, primarily in rice cultivation, as well as in commerce, etc. It is a medium-sized district with aspirations for improvement.

Fidel works buying and selling grains such as corn, beans, and soybeans, among others. He buys these products from farmers in neighboring hamlets and later sells them in the commercial port of Chiple. He also has a motorcycle taxi that he uses for public transportation. He has good work and personal references and five years of experience in the industry.

The loan will be used to buy a greater quantity of grains to increase commercial stock in his business, which will increase sales and, in the end, improve his quality of life.

loans.use: buy a larger quantity of grains to increase his commercial stock.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Victoria dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 36 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Aida has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling fruits.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Jipe Moyo Group

texts.fr: Pour contourner les besoins familiaux, les membres du groupe JIPE MOYO dont le président est Jango (l'homme portant une casquette noire et chemise rouge, à côté de la dame) se sont lancés dans la culture de la tomate. L'insuffisance de moyens financiers leur fait parfois défaut mais ils sont optimistes quant à l'atteinte des meilleurs rendements dans l'avenir grâce aux crédits qu'ils auront à recevoir à travers PAIDEK.
texts.en: Jango, the man wearing a black baseball cap and red shirt, standing next to the woman, is the president of the Jipe Moyo group. In order to manage family needs, the members of this group have gone into growing tomatoes. A lack of financial means is sometimes a challenge, but they are optimists and expect better harvests in future, thanks to the loans they will have received through PAIDEK.

loans.use: to pay for laborers for sowing and weeding, and to buy lime and other chemicals

loans.name: Simona

texts.en:
Simona is a 50-year-old woman and a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living by making and selling pots made of recycled tires.

She is married with three dependents, ages 8, 10 and 17.

Simona has requested a loan to buy materials like used and recycled tires. These will help her produce more pots to sell. With these, her income will slowly increase and she and her husband can increase their production. They will be able to pay for household expenses out of their income.

In the future, she hope that her business will thrive and become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy black used tires to produce pots.

loans.name: Teltaaba De Gouloure Group

texts.fr:
Mme ALIZETA est la représentante du groupe TELTAABA DE GOULOURE. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 25 ans et le moins âgé a 19 ans. 05 enfants vont à l’école et elle 09 personnes en charge.
Mme est vendeuse de riz depuis 16 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter 02 sacs de riz et 01 fagot de bois.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour aider son mari à payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande restauratrice.
texts.en:
Mme Alizeta is the leader of the group called Teltaaba de Gouloure. She is married and the mother of seven children. The oldest is 25 and the youngest 19 years old. Five children attend school and she is responsible for nine persons in all.

Mme Alizeta has been selling rice for 16 years. She stocks up in the market in her neighborhood. With the money from the loan, she intends to buy two sacks of rice and one load of wood.

She wants to use the profits from the loan to help her husband to pay school fees for their children. Her ambition is to become a well-known seller of cooked food.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice and a load of wood.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 48 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emily is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Emily has been raising pigs for one year and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia requests a loan to buy cocoa to sell. She deals in cocoa trading and farming in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For the years she has been in business, she has been able to renovate their house and support her husband to provide for the family.

She plans to build a cocoa store and expand her business but lacks adequate capital. Lukia has targeted the cocoa peak season where there is a constant flow of income due to the readily available market.

She is a mother of five children, and all attend school.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Bread Sellers Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Bread Sellers Solidarity Group of Ibrahim. He is the leader of Bread Sellers Solidarity Group which is made up of seven members of four men and three women. All seven members including Ibrahim are engaged in petty trading but selling different products.

Ibrahim sells bread. He has been selling bread for the past five years. He uses proceeds of his business to pay fees for his children’s education and to provide livelihood for his family.
Ibrahim and other group members of Bread Sellers solidarity are requesting for a total of 19,000,000SLL Of this amount, Adama will personally receive 4,000,000SLL which he will use to purchase additional bags of flour, sugar, etc. for his business. See Ibrahim stands in the middle of the picture.

Ibrahim is married and has a cheerful family of two children aged 7 and 5 years.
Ibrahim hopes that his business continues to exist so that he can save enough money to build a house and also prepare for his old age. Ibrahim hopes that this loan will earn him more profit for him to support his family
Ibrahim and his group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of flour, sugar, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MINIBANK.
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de transporte, la socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para comprar piezas para su carro.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the MINIBANK village bank.

The member continues dedicating herself to the transportation business. The member feels thankful for the loan and commits herself to fulfilling the payment installments. The member has had her business for a good amount of time, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts forth every day to her business. The member wishes to be able to continue working so that in this manner she can continue helping her family. The member applied for the loan to buy parts for her car.

loans.use: to buy parts for her car.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Forty-year old Melinda engages in hog raising business. She raises and sells hogs for more than 10 years now.
She is married woman with two children ages 12 and 15 years old respectively.
Her husband is a farmer. She hails in the town of Alicia, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feeds. In the coming  months, she could now sold healthy pigs .  Thus, she could able to roll-out her capital and start to expand her business. In that way, she could able to support the needs of her children, like providing healthy diets and quality education.

Melinda is determined that she would properly handle her main source of livelihood to be sustainable and for the welfare of the whole family as well.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to earn more by growing his working capital and buying a lot of goats for resale

loans.name: Segundo Ivan

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 32 años de edad, conviviente, con una hija en su poder, viven en una zona rural del distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la Sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Segundo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 6 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Segundo espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 32 years old, partnered, with a daughter in his care. They live in a rural zone of the district of Pucará that's found located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru. The inhabitants of this district mainly work in agriculture, animal husbandry and trade.

Segundo works raising and selling small animals like pigs, chickens, hens, ducks, turkeys, among others. His business is found in his same home. He has 6 years of experience in the business and with very good personal and work references in the area. The loan he's applying for will be utilized for the purchase of a greater quantity of animals like hens, ducks, turkeys, chickens, among others, as well as the purchase of balanced feed for them. With this, Segundo hopes to offer a better product to his clients which will let him generate more income and therefore he will increase his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals, among other things, like purchasing balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Annie Rose

texts.en:
To earn a living, Annie Rose and her husband are engaged in the fishing business. It is their main source of income. They work together to provide for the needs of their family.

Aside from fishing, Annie Rose is engaged in a sari-sari (convenience) store business. She has been doing this for five years.

She is asking for a loan to maintain her boat and to buy grocery items such as spices, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips, candies, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and juice, sugar and toiletries.

Additionally, Annie Rose is a mother of three children, ages 14, 10 and 5. She wishes to uplift their livelihood to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to maintain her boat and to buy spices, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips, candies, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and juice, sugar and toiletries.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: For 10 years, Rosalie is engaged in hog raising business. She is a resident in San Dionisio, Iloilo. Her husband works hard as a motorcycle driver. Rosalie is a 52-year-old woman and a mother of five children. She married earlier and that is why her children are already grown up. She dreams to succeed in her business to prepare and save money for the future. With that, she is asking a loan to have additional capital to buy piglets and feed.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Liliana Carla

texts.es: Liliana encontró la oportunidad de incorporase a la vida comercial, cuando recibió una visita en su vivienda que le propuso vender productos por intermedio de catálogos; al comienzo no estaba muy convencida por su inexperiencia, sin embargo su entusiasmo la envolvió y empezó  a recorrer las calles del sector donde reside al sur de Barranquilla para promover ventas y tuvo gran acogida por sus amigos y conocidos.  Hoy en día cuenta con un año de experiencia y una clientela fidelizada a la que le ofrece bisutería, prendas de vestir y fragancias, con facilidad de pago en amortizaciones quincenales. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina y la surtirá con productos de papelería, un nuevo mercado que pretende explorar.  Su meta a futuro es engrandecer su negocio y surtirlo con más productos.  Liliana de 28 años es viuda y madre de dos hijos menores de edad a quienes desea sacar adelante con el fruto de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Liliana found an opportunity to reenter commerce when she received a visit at home from somebody that proposed selling catalog products. She was not convinced at the beginning due to her lack of experience. However, her enthusiasm convinced her and she began to go around the area where she lives in the south of Barranquilla to promote the products and had a great reception from her friends and acquaintances. 

Today, she already has one year of experience and a loyal customer base, to which she offers custom jewelry, clothes and perfumes. She allows her customers to pay in instalments every two weeks. 

She is applying for a Kiva loan, her first one through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will use to buy a display cabinet and to stock it with stationary products, a new market that she wants to explore. Her future goal is to expand her business and stock it with additional products. Liliana is 28 years old, a widow and mother of two young children, whom she wants to get ahead in life though her work.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet and stock it with stationary products.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry es un hombre de 42 años de edad que esta domiciliado en un barrio del municipio de Bogotá y se encuentra dedicado a su taller de Ornamentaciones que funciona desde el año 2010. Su idea de negocio nació cuando laboraba como empleado y aunque en condiciones precarias, empezó a funcionar, ofreciendo sus servicios de diseño y elaboración de mesones, hornos, estufas, freidores y campanas en acero inoxidable. Su cadena de comercialización es a través de referidos y subcontrataciones a hospitales y restaurantes.  Sus cobros se generan según lo establecido en el contrato y como su capital le es insuficiente para responder a la demanda está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para la compra de materia prima; láminas en acero y poder fabricar mesones, hornos, estufas y demás encargos de sus clientes.  Esta inversión permitirá que sus negocio cuente con el material necesario para la producción y Henry pueda mejorar sus tiempos de entrega y con ello la rotación de la cartera. Su meta a largo plazo es ampliar su vivienda y continuar educando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Henry is a 42-year-old man who makes his home in a neighborhood in the municipality of Bogotá. He works in his fabrication shop, which has been operating since the year 2010. His business idea was born while he was working as an employee, and although in precarious conditions, he went into operation, offering his services designing and fabricating stainless steel countertops, ovens, stoves, fryers, and bells.

His sales come from referrals and subcontracts with hospitals and restaurants. His costs are generated in accordance with the terms established by his contract, and because his capital is not sufficient for meeting demand, he is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. It is for the purchase of raw materials such as sheet metal, so that he can fabricate countertops, ovens, stoves, and other client orders.

This investment will enable his business to have the materials that are necessary for production, which will allow Henry to improve his delivery time, and therefore, his turnover.

His long term goals are to add on to his house, and continue educating his children.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as steel sheet metal.

loans.name: Maliya

texts.en:
Maliya is a mother of three school-going children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is in the business of selling and buying cocoa, with additional income from selling rice.

Just like other cocoa dealers, Maliya faces a challenge of seasonality of cocoa that causes price changes. She hopes that through her hard work, she will be able to expand her business by buying more rice to sell and buying land to expand her cocoa growing.

She intends to use the loan to buy more rice for selling to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more rice for selling to her customers.

loans.name: Zainabo

texts.en:
Zainabo is a mother of four living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She owns a cocoa garden where she gets cocoa to sell to the clients. She also has an additional source of income where she sells foods stuffs like cassava flour, maize and snacks, businesses that help her to get income to support her family.

She is a hard working lady with future plans of expanding her business and would like to use the loan for buying more food stuffs like cassava flour, maize flour and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs like cassava flour, maize flour and rice to sell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
She hails in the town of Tubigon, Bohol. Esterlita runs a sari-sari(variety) store, selling goods like  powdered soap, sugar, noodles, shampoo, coffee, insect repellent and  canned goods. 
She is a married with four  children ages 24, 18,15 and 11. She also engages in fish vending business. She sold fresh fish to the local in the community.

 She is asking for a loan to buy supplies for the store and additional fish.  These are very essential tools that could improve her livelihood. She could have more stocks on her store and sold variety of fresh fish.

She is determined to work hard to be successful and also for her to continue support the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the store and additional fish

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a 59-year-old woman from Calituban, Talibon. To reach her place, she needs to be in a boat for almost one hour from the mainland Talibon town. She live in an island that is reach in seafoods. She is engaged in selling and serves as a middleman for dried fish and salted fish (ginamos). She also sell RTW items such as shirts, shorts and trendy clothes. She is asking a loan to buy more dried fish, salted fish and more clothes to sell. In the future, Norma plans to buy more products and increase her stocks of dried fish to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and salted fish and RTW

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María Esther tiene 59 años de edad, vive en casa propia con esposo e hija, en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

María se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como vestidos, faldas,camisas, pantalones; para niños, damas y caballeros desde hace 10 años, por lo que cuenta con clientes fijos, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos para confeccionar para abastecer su negocio, de esta manera aumentar sus ingres y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María Esther is 59 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and daughter in the district of Cayaltí, a community of varied climate. Its population works in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry, located in the Chiclayo Province which belongs to the Lambayeque Region, northern coast of Peru.

María has worked at making garments like dresses, skirts, shirts, pants for children, women and men for the past 10 years; therefore she has regular customers. She has applied for a loan for the purchase of fabric, sewing thread to stock her business and, in this manner, increase her income and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, sewing thread to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additional 5 cartons of frozen fish for her business.

loans.name: Mónica Astrid

texts.es: Mónica es una empresaria independiente que anhelaba inaugurar una venta de comidas rápidas motivada por su supuesto de ser éste un negocio con muy buena rentabilidad y así le podría dar bienestar a sus cinco hijos y ayudar a su cónyuge con los gastos en el hogar. Con la certeza de que su negocio sería todo un éxito en el año 2010, dio el gran paso y aperturó en un barrio del municipio de Soledad, su venta de comidas ofreciendo una carta variada de hot dogs, hamburguesas, pinchos, pizzas y demás delicias, que diariamente disfrutan sus clientes a partir de las 4 p.m. hasta las 12 p.m.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar panes, embutidos, salsas y bebidas, de este modo podrá fortalecer su capital de inversión y generar más ventas. Su meta a futuro es mantenerse constante en este negocio para así garantizar ofrecerles a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en: Mónica is a self-employed entrepreneur who had the ambition of setting up a fast-food outlet. She was motivated by the possibility that the business would be profitable, which would enable her to support her five children and help her husband to cover the household expenses. Confident that her business would be a success in 2010, she took a bold step and opened up her food outlet in a district of the town of Soledad, where she offered a varied selection of hotdogs, hamburgers, kebabs, pizzas and other mouth-watering treats. Her customers can enjoy these between 4pm and midnight. She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy bread, sausages, sauces and drinks so she can boost her investment capital and generate more sales. Her ambition for the future is to keep her business on an even keel to ensure that she can give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy bread, sausages, sauces and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more 5 baskets of different kinds of fresh fruits for her business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a mother of three children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She operates a restaurant where she gets daily income to support her family, and she gets additional income from selling fish.

Irene has faced a challenge of competition while in business and of seasonality which causes a reduction in her profits. She is a very hard-working lady with future plans of operating a large restaurant that can even provide outside catering services.

Irene would like to get a loan to add working capital for her restaurant by buying foods like bananas, rice, and posho (cornmeal) to cook and sell.

loans.use: to add working capital for her restaurant by buying foods like bananas, rice, and posho (cornmeal) for cooking to sell.

loans.name: Jamilah

texts.en:
Jamilah is a 31-year-old married woman living with her four children in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in selling palm oil as a vendor in the markets and gets additional income from selling firewood.

She is very hardworking but is challenged by inadequate capital; she has hopes of building a permanent house and also educating children up to university.

Jamilah has requested a loan to buy more firewood to sell to meet the demand from her customers.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Indhira

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios para celulares, la  socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar accesorios entre otros.
texts.en: The member is still running her business selling mobile phones and accessories. She is grateful for the loan and promises to repay it in full. She has been running her business for some time now and it is successful thanks to the hard work she devotes to it every day. She would like to carry on working so that she can continue to support her family. She is applying for the loan to buy mobile phone accessories among other things.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories among other things.

loans.name: Gyanu

texts.en:
Gyanu is 48 years old. She is married and has three children.

Agriculture is her traditional family occupation. With vegetable farming, she started a new trend of business. She works four hours a day, seven days a week, to support her family.

Gyanu has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan Business and Professional Women (PBPW), using her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her business.

In the future, she plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.

With a Kiva loan, PBPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, borrowers are able to grow cash crops, to be sold in the local market.
