Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.name: Willian

texts.es:
El socio Wiliian al banco comunal MINIBANK.
El socio sigue dedicándose a la venta de cereales, el socio se siente agradecido  con el crédito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio continua vendiendo quinua, kiwicha y maca entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar kiwicha,quinua entre otros.
texts.en:
Willian is a member of the "Minibank" communal bank.

He continues to work selling grains. He is thankful for the loan and promises to pay back on time. He is responsible and hardworking. He continues selling quinoa, amaranth and maca and other products that his customers request. This is how Willian supports his family.

He requests this loan to buy amaranth and quinoa, among other products.

loans.use: to buy amaranth and quinoa, among other products.

loans.name: Los Solidarios Group

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Karelin sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo a sus amistades, familiares, clientes entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de perfumes de damas.
texts.en:
The member is Karelin. She continues to earn a living in the business of selling beauty prodcuts like creams, perfumes, colognes, among other things. She has been doing this for a long time and it is going well thanks to the work she puts in everyday. She continues to sell to friends, relatives, clients, among others. She hopes to be able to continue working to continue supporting her family.

She is grateful to those who form part of her dream through this and she is committed to making the repayments in the established timeframe.

She is asking for a loan to buy perfume for ladies.

loans.use: to buy ladies perfume.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of cooking fat, salt, sugar, rice and other items.

loans.name: Ma. Nelia

texts.en:
Ma. Nelia is 45 years old and has ten children. Ma. Nelia is married and has five children who are currently in school.

Ma. Nelia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Nelia requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Nelia has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Ma. Nelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 15 gallons of palm oil and 70 bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh foodstuffs like tomatoes and cabbages to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a farmer living in Fort Portal, Uganda. With the previous loan, he managed to buy land for expanding his onion farm, pay fees for his children and pay back his loan facility well. He is not only growing crops but also rears goats for commercial purposes.

He has future hopes of building a permanent home for his family.

Paul is in need of another loan to pay for labour to harvest onions.

Paul is grateful for the funds that have seen him develop and provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for labour to harvest onions.

loans.name: Dutezanyimbere Group

texts.en:
Redempta is a group leader; aged 29 years. She is married with 2 children aged between 1 and 5 years. The group is called DUTEZANYIMBERE means “SUPPORT EACH OTHER” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future.

She owns a shop and has been running a business for 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sugar and cooking oil for sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more beans, sugar and cooking oil for sale

loans.name: Bwikaragye Group

texts.en: David, a member of Bwikaragye Group, is aged 30, married, and charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children who all attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He ventured into produce, mainly the buying and selling of maize and beans among other items. This is supplemented by income from operating a retail shop mainly selling salt and sugar among other items. David desires to expand and develop his business, however, price fluctuation and inadequate capital pose a strong threat to his business. He is seeking credit to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Kiryanjagi Twimukyangane Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a Ugandan married man aged 25 years, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is into a motorcycle transport business commonly known as bodaboda, where he generates income. He also earns from produce-selling.

Joseph used the previous loan to buy a new motorcycle and has realized some good profits. He describes himself as a hardworking man, though he faces challenges of competition from people with similar businesses. He wants a loan to buy maize and groundnuts for sale.

Joseph is a member of Kiryanjagi Twimukyangane group where members guarantee each other to access a loan as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize and groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is a 33 year old gentleman married with 3 children; he is a new client to the institution. He transports people on a motor bike( Boda boda) and it is his major source of income. He has a retail shop run by his wife. He has done these two businesses for over 5 years. However Boaz has been stranded by limited capital to expand his businesses.

Boaz decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance and applied for a loan of 2,000,000 to expand his businesses especially the retail shop. He wants to buy rice, posho, salt, toilet paper in order to serve more clients and increase on his income and be able to meet all family financial needs. Boaz hopes to expand his business and he has a dream, of making a wholesale shop with the financial assistance from Ugafode. Boaz is happy with this type of financial assistance which has helped many people to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like rice, corn flour and salt.

loans.name: Deodora

texts.en:
Deodora is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Deodora is 59 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Deodora has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

Deodora has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling Avon products in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon to sell to her customers for her direct sales business.

Angela has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Angela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cacao Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre todos muy emprendedores, que se organizaron hace 4 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus pequeño negocios incrementando su mercadería y así poder mejorar también sus ingresos que les permita poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

JAVIER NICASIO: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario, es un joven de 35 años de edad, alegre, casado con un hijo de 2 años. Debido a la carencia de un empleo formal, estableció su propio negocio de venta de chiverías de manera ambulante. Solicita financiamiento para surtir su negocio. Sueña con ser un comerciante exitoso.
texts.en:
This community group is composed of two women and one man. All of them are entrepreneurial and partnered 4 months ago with the goal of having access to financing to improve their small businesses. They want to increase their products to improve their income, which will allow them to cover the basic necessities of their homes, ensure their children's education and expand their businesses. 

Javier Nicasio is the coordinator of the group. He is 35 years old, good humored, and married, with a 2-year-old son. Due the the lack of formal employment, he started his own business selling candy on the street. He is requesting a loan to stock his business. He dreams with becoming a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy candy and basic grains.

loans.name: To Day Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Lamin is a thirty-six years old business man and a member of Today solidarity group with four members of three men and one woman. Lamin sells cooked food. He has been in this business for the past eight years. He opens his business six days in a week from 8am to 6pm.

Lamin established his business to help support his children in school. He pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food from the profit he gets from his business. See Lamin (on the right of the group picture).

Lamin and his group members needs a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL of which Lamin is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL which he will use to buy more cooking ingredient 5 bag rice, 2 rubbers palm oil, 2 carton Maggi, 1 rubber oil etc. for his business.

He hopes that this loan will help his generate more profit to support his family. Lamin is married and has 2 children with the ages of 6 and 4 of which one is school going children.
In the feature, Lamin plan to save more money to provide for his children’s university education. He believes educating his children to university level will better the lives of his family.
Lamin will be very appreciative to anyone who will help them.

loans.use: to buy more cooking ingredient 5 bag rice, 2 rubbers palm oil.

loans.name: Kanchhi

texts.en:
Kanchhi is 58 years old and is married and has two children. Agriculture is her traditional occupation. Until now she continued her business with vegetable farming. She works four hours a day, seven days a week to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW, using her most recent loan to buys seeds and fertilizers for her business.

In the future, She plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, borrowers are able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rice farming has been the source of income in some communities in Iloilo, Philippines. Rosela, a 50 year-old-woman has been engaged in this business for almost 20 years. She is married with one adult daughter. Aside from doing rice farming, she also sells food (snacks) to the community.  In the future, Rosela dreams to improve her business to uplift their means of living. With that, she is asking a loan to buy fertilizer for their farm. She also buys ingredients for her food selling business such as flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, flour, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en: Valeriana is 41 years old from the island of Nocnocan in Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children ages 11-20. The island in itself is a place that is quite challenging to live. With limited access to electricity, people are really working hard to find a living in the seafood-rich island. She is asking a loan to buy crab traps (panggal) and more fish to sell. The loan will pave way for her and her husband to have a better income from fishing and fish vending. In the future, Valeriana hope to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy crab traps and more fish to sell

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is 30 years old. He lives in Getafe, Bohol.  He is married with two children ages nine and twelve. He support his family by raising hogs and making bamboo splints (locally known as lipak). This is used by people as a flooring materials, for those who cannot afford to build a concrete house. Victor is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and feed. In the future, Victor hope to live in comfort from his business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en: Zeny is from Talibon, Bohol.  Talibon town is known for crabs and other seafoods. Like most people, Zeny found her livelihood through fishing and farming seaweeds. She is asking a loan to buy seaweed seedlings and fish nets that will help increase and expand her business.  Zeny works hard because she has six children ages three to fourteen.  Her income is for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and fish nets.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa, 53, lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is married with six children. Four of her children are adults, while two are still dependents, aged 15 and 17.

Teresa provides for them by making dresses. She is also engaged in the buying and selling of hogs for a living. She needs additional capital through a loan to buy cloth and pigs to resell.

Teresa is determined to keep improving her business so she can save and live comfortably when she is old. Her income will also be utilized for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy cloth and pigs.

loans.name: Ana Ligia

texts.es: Ana Ligia es una mujer muy esforzada, trabaja en su propia granja. Ella solicita un préstamo de seiscientos mil colones (₡600 000), para la compra de gallinas ponedoras, esto con el fin de aumentar su producción y aumentar los ingresos ingresos familiares provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en: Ana Ligia is a very strong woman who works on her own farm. She is requesting a loan of six hundred thousand colones (600,000 CRC) to buy laying hens with the goal of increasing her production and increasing the family's income derived from this business.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her farm.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 27 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 3 years. Many years ago, she established her goat-raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy baby chicks.

This time she wants to start poultry farming too.In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un joven hombre de 22 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la producción de estuco.
Él es constante, fuerte y luchador de la vida. Su negocio lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Vichaya’, ubicado al sud oeste de la ciudad cuya región guarda importantes ‘Puqaras’ (construcciones militares incaicas). De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-8 grados centígrados.
Manuel es de piel oscura, cabello corto, físico delgado, su lengua materna es la Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en un cuarto propio hecho de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no tiene agua ni alcantarillado. Su trabajo es la producción de estuco; él junto a su pareja se encargan de cortar la roca para trabajarla hasta convertirla en estuco, “aprendí el oficio por herencia de mi papá ya que él también es productor de estuco…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que trabaja con su pareja, la desventaja es la falta de movilidad para transportar el estuco. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, él desea realizar la compra de correa para su molino de estuco. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a este trabajo. 
Es por esos motivos que Manuel solicita un préstamo para la compra de correa y molino para producir estuco.
texts.en: 22-year-old Manuel lives with his partner and they have yet to have children. He runs a stucco-making business. He is steadfast, strong and a fighter. He runs his business in the village of Vichaya, which is situated south-west of the city whose region still has important 'Puqaras' (Inca military constructions). The region's climate is cold and dry and daytime temperatures fluctuate between 0-8 degrees centigrade. Manuel has dark skin and short hair and is slim. His mother tongue is Aymara, which he speaks at home; he speaks Spanish for business purposes. His wife works with him in the business and they live in their own room, which is made from adobe and has a corrugated iron roof, a stone floor and electricity. However, it does not have a water supply or a sewerage system. Manuel makes stucco, "I learned my trade from my dad as he, too, is a stucco producer..." he says. The advantage of this line of business is that he works with his wife. The disadvantage is the fact that he has no means of transporting the stucco. His dream is to expand his business; he wants to buy a belt for his stucco mill. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the two years he has been running his business. Manuel is applying for the loan to buy a belt and a mill for producing stucco.

loans.use: to buy a belt and a mill for making stucco.

loans.name: Lucinio Omar

texts.es: Don Lucinio trabaja en la producción y venta de chayotes. Solicita un préstamo de mil dólares ($1,000), para la compra y colocación de postes y alambre necesarios para el manejo de dicho cultivo, esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones del cultivo y de esta manera incrementar la producción.
texts.en: Lucinio works producing and selling chayotes. He is requesting a loan of one thousand dollars ($1,000), to buy and place posts and wire needed for the management of this crop. This will allow for better growing conditions and in this way increase production.

loans.use: to buy posts to grow chayotes.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 32 years old the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with seven children ages 1-13. Alma is engaged in fishing and pottery business. Having a fisherman husband, she learned about fishing while raising her family. She is asking a loan to buy fishing nets and fishing weights. Alma's business has been thriving for ten years. In the future she hope to expand her business and increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fishing weights

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 61 years old and married with four children. 

Celsa is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Celsa requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Celsa has been raising livestock for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Celsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en:
Cerelyn sells traditional wicker bags to earn her living. She has been in this business for eight years. She and her husband work hard to support their family.

Cerelyn requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy traditional wicker bags to offer for sale.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy traditional wicker bags to offer for sale

loans.name: Noha

texts.en:
Noha is 35, married, and has 2 daughters and 2 sons. Her husband works in pre-painting preparations and she works as cleaning women in the governorate building.

She started a small cement and bricks sales project and is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy cement to expand her project and cover the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy cement.

loans.name: Didani

texts.en:
Didani is a 24 year old ambitious young man living in Bundibugyo Uganda. He works hard for a living to look after his one year old son for good health. He runs a salon and alternates it with cocoa farming to increase on his family income. Although he is challenged with electricity shortages and competition in the area, he operates his salon every day, as he has determination to take his business to a high level.
He requests a loan to buy a hair cutting machine for his salon.

loans.use: to buy a hair cutting machine for his salon.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 35 years old and she is mother of 2 kids one of them is seven years old and the other is 3 years old.   Lourdes needs a loan to fix the bathroom of her house because the walls have  deteriorated because of the rains in the city.  Lourdes is working at the city hall so she has an income and she hopes you can help her to give her family a better life.  Lourdes is divorced and she is the only support for her family

loans.use: to fix the bathroom of her house.

loans.name: Miralona

texts.en:
Miralona is 38 years old and married. Miralona works very hard to provide for them.

Miralona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, bread, candies, coffee, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Miralona has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bread, candies, coffee, soft-drinks, etc. 

In the future, Miralona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, bread, candies, coffee, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Meralyn

texts.en:
Meralyn is 40 years old and has twelve children. Meralyn is married and has six children who are currently in school.

Meralyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Meralyn requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Meralyn has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Meralyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en: Glenda, 45, is a married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For four years, Glenda has had a charcoal vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Glenda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nor Forget We Group

texts.en:
Jariatu is a thirty-one years old business woman. She is a member of “Nor Forget We” solidarity group. “Nor Forget We” solidarity group has five members who are all women. Jariatu sells groundnut to the general public.

Jariatu has been in this business for the past five years. She opens her business six days in a week from 8am to 6pm.

Jariatu established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food from the profit she gets from her business.
Jariatu and her group members needs a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL of which she is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL to buy more bags of groundnuts for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Jariatu is married and has two children who are both school going children.
In the feature, Jaritu plan to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.
Jariatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of groundnuts for her business.

loans.name: Rise - Up Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Rise Up Solidarity Group of Salamatu. She is the leader of Rise Up Group which is made up of four members. All five members including Salamatu are engaged in small scale trading but selling different products.
Salamatu who is 38 years old was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people. She sells ready-made clothes. Salamatu has been selling ready-made cloths for the past three years. She uses proceeds of her business to pay fees for her children’s education and to provide livelihood for her family.

Salamatu and other group members of Rise Up solidarity are requesting for their first loan with a total of 4,000,000SLL of this amount, Salamatu will personally receive 1,000,000SLL which she will use to purchase more different types of men's clothing and women's dresses for her business. See Salamatu (stands in the right of the picture).

Salamatu is married and has a cheerful family of three children with the ages of 14, 11, and 7 years old.
Salamatu hopes that her business continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a house and also prepare for her old age. Salamatu hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family
Salamatu and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more different types of men's clothing and women's dresses.

loans.name: We Dae Try Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is a thirty-four years old business woman. She is a member of We Dae Try solidarity group. We Dae Try solidarity group has five members of two men and three women. Fatmata sells rubber bowls. Fatmata has been in this rubber bowls business for the past two years. She opens her business six days in a week from 9am to 6pm.

Fatmata established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buy learning material and provide food from the profit she gets from her business.
Fatmata and her group members needs a loan totaling 5,000,000 SLL of which she is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL to buy more dozens of different types of rubber bowls. Fatmata stands in the middle of the group picture.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Fatmata is married and has three children which are in school.

In the feature, Fatmata plan to save more money to provide for her children’s university education and to expand her business. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.
Fatmata and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more dozens of different types of rubber bowls for her business.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es: Elsa, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijos, reside junto a su familia en una aldea del Municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. Hace 4 años que Elsa decidido establecer su propio negocio para obtener ingresos y ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Su negocio es una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser: carnes, embutidos, granos básicos, refrescos, churros, huevos, manteca, azúcar, arroz, y otros abarrotes. Además vende comida los fines de semana para obtener más ingresos.  ha invertido cuatro prestamos anteriores y actualmente solicita otro a la institución por 18,000 lempiras para invertirlos y surtir de nuevos productos como verduras, embutidos, productos enlatados, productos de aseo, refrescos, churros, huevos, leche, pastas etc. con esta inversión considera que va poder aumentar su clientela.  Su meta es darles buena educación y salud a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elsa is 33 years old. She live in a common-law realtionship with her husband with whom she has two children. She lives with her family in a village in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara.

Four years ago Elsa decided to open her own business in order to obtain income and help with the household expenses. Her business is a small store where she sells basic food items like meat, cold cuts, basic grains, soft drinks, chips, eggs, margarine, sugar, rice and other groceries. She also sells meals on weekends to obtain more income.

She has invested four previous loans and is currently requesting another with the Institution for 18,000 HNL to invest and stock new products like vegetables, meats, cold cuts, cleaning products, soft drinks, chips, eggs, milk, pasta, etc. She thinks that she will increase her clientele with this investment. Her goal is to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, cold cuts, canned goods, cleaning products, soft drinks, chips, eggs, milk, pasta, etc to stock up and sell.

loans.name: Only God Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Only God Solidarity Group of Adama. She is the leader Only God Solidarity Group which is made up of three members. All three members including Adama are engaged in small scale trading but selling different products.
Adama sells used clothing. She has been selling used clothing for the past fourteen years. She uses proceeds of her business to pay fees for her children’s education and to provide livelihood for her family.

Adama and other group members of Only God solidarity are requesting for a total of 6,000,000SLL of this amount, Adama will personally receive 3,000,000SLL which she will use to purchase 5 bales of used clothing for her business. Adama stands in the right of the picture.

Adama is married and has a cheerful family of two children with the ages of 14 and 8 years.
Adama hopes that her business continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and also prepare for her old age. Adama hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family
Adama and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bales of used clothing for her business

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a 37 years old married woman. She has 3 children aged 17, 10 and 3 respectively. She has started this small restaurant just 3 months ago and she is doing well now with this business. She is working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, to support her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid eight loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy consumable foodstuffs to prepare different dishes like vegetables and other dishes. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to prepare as dishes in her restaurant.

loans.name: Aierly

texts.en:
Aierly goes fishing and sells fish to the locals in her area. She has been engaged in fishing for two years now.
She has four children. Her oldest child is 11 while the youngest is six-month old. Her husband is a driver and a fisherman also.
She needs funds to purchase materials that could boost her livelihood.

Aierly is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like plastic screen, rope and weights. With the presence of these tools, her fishing business will prosper and enables her to have higher volume of catch. Thus, her family will be able to eat nutritious diets and she could also support the education of her children.

She hopes that with proper handling of these resource, it will lead to success and sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like plastic screen, rope and  weights

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, age 54, runs a general store business to earn her living. She and her husband have six children, and she works very hard to provide for them. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years, and sells a variety of items in her store, including grocery items like rice and sugar as well as household goods like detergent.

Evangeline requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her store.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie, 45, is a married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For two years, Josie has had a business making tote bags in the Philippines. She requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Josie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for making tote bags to sell.

loans.name: Nabonswende De Gouloure Group

texts.fr:
Mr NOMWINDE est le représentant du groupe NABONSWENDE DE GOULOURE. Il est marié et père de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18 ans et le moins âgé a  09 ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école et il a 05 personnes en charge.
Mr fait de l’élevage depuis 20 ans, et pratique aussi l'agriculture. Il s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 10 poules.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Nomwinde is the representative of the 'Nabonswende de Gouloure' Group. He is married and father to three children. The eldest is eighteen years old and the youngest is nine years old. Two of his children currently attend school and he is responsible for a total of five people.

Nomwinde has been raising livestock for twenty years now, he also grows crops. He buys his supplies at a local market in his neighbourhood.

The loan will be used to buy ten chickens for his business. Nomwinde plans to use his profits to reinvest in his business. He hopes, one day, to become a large-scale livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy 10 chickens for his livestock rearing business.

loans.name: Len Len

texts.en: Len Len is single and has manufactured tote bags in the Philippines for six years. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business. In the future, Len Len would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her tote bag production business.

loans.name: Joelucy

texts.en:
Joelucy, age 43, makes and sells traditional wicker bags to earn an income. She has been in this business for two years. This hard-working entrepreneur has four children, two of whom attend school. She and her husband work hard to provide for them. 

Joelucy requested a loan in the amount of PhP 7,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase raw materials for her manufacturing business.

In the future, Joelucy would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her traditional bag-making business

loans.name: María Evangelista

texts.es:
María, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, no continuo con sus estudios porque sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos; es viuda, su esposo falleció hace 6 meses y con su esposo tuvo 2 hijos que son independientes.

María, se dedica a la venta de vitaminas desde hace 6 años, este negocio decidió realizarlo por iniciativa propia, pero a parte de eso también sale a vender ropa desde hace 1 año.- María, sale a vender por todos los caseríos y cantones de los pueblos cercanos donde ella vive y su horario de trabaja es de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 3:30 p.m. los 6 días de la semana.

María, necesita el crédito para comprar pollos de engorde y comprar más vitaminas para su negocio; con este crédito ella podrá tener otra actividad productiva.

María, sueña con seguir ampliando su negocio y establecer otras actividades productivas, para obtener ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en: 51-year-old María went to school for 7 years but was unable to continue her studies because her parents could not afford it. She is a widow whose husband died 6 months ago. Their two children are grown up. María has been selling vitamins for 6 years. It was her own idea to set up the business but she has also sold clothing for 1 year. She goes around selling her goods in all the hamlets and villages close to where she lives and she works from 7am to 3.30pm, 6 days a week. María needs the loan to buy chickens for fattening and to buy more vitamins for her business. The loan will allow her to have another business. María dreams of being able to continue expanding her business and set up other ones to provide income with which to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening and to buy more vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en: Mr. Enkhjargal, who is 49 years old, lives with his wife in Kherlen, the easternmost town in Mongolia. He has been working as a machinist at a local power plant since 1980, while his wife grows and sells vegetables to local people. Their daughter was downsized last year from her company is now self-employed and runs a grocery store. Mr. Enkhjargal is one of our trustworthy clients and makes his payments without delay. He used his first loan to build a greenhouse and his second loan to open a grocery store in order to provide his daughter with a job. Now he is requesting a loan for $1,775 to repair and upgrade his greenhouse by rebuilding the frame among other things. This will allow his wife to  continue to grow vegetables and sell them to local people.

loans.use: to repair and upgrade his greenhouse.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pomahuaca que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de aaroz, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 14 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Pedro espera ofrecer un arroz de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 59 years old. He lives with his spouse and son in his own house made of basic materials in the district of Pomahuaca which is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru. Life in this district is quiet, the inhabitants work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Pedro works in agriculture, specifically growing rice. He has 14 years of experience in this field and has very good personal and work references in the district. The loan he has been awarded will be used to buy manure and fertilizer to provide adequate maintenance of his rice crops as well as hiring labor for the harvest. Doing this Pedro hopes to offer higher quality rice to his clients which will have a positive impact on his level of income and in the end improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to provide adequate maintenance for his rice crops.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 26 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jenny has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jenny requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.

Jenny has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Jenny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard to support her family. Veronica is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Veronica requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, bananas, etc. for her food vending business.

Veronica has been in this business for 5 years now.

Veronica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, bananas, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Rinelyn

texts.en:
Rinelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell sand and gravel business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy additional tons of sand and gravel to sell for her buy and sell sand and gravel business.

Rinelyn has been in this business for 5 years. Rinelyn earns more income from general store.

Rinelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional tons of sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Jennylin

texts.en:
Jennylin is 32 years old and married.  

Jennylin is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Jennylin requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jennylin has been raising livestock for 6 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jennylin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es: José es un joven microempresario de 19 años que inició su negocio cuando se encontraba prestando el servicio militar,  él palpo que sus superiores consumían grandes cantidades de productos desarrollados para la nutrición y cuidado del peso, así que halló un oportunidad de negocio y les propuso vendérselos a buenos precios, así comenzó su negocio.  Hoy en día su base de clientes se ha incrementado gracias a las charlas que ofrece en donde expone sobre los beneficios que se adquieren en la salud a partir del consumo de estos complementos nutricionales y  complejos vitamínicos, además de ofrecer una variada gama de productos de aseo personal.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar malteadas, proteínas, vitaminas, té, shampoo medicinales, jabones y cremas corporales, todos encargos de sus clientes.  Esta inversión le permitirá incrementar su porcentaje de ganancia y con ello ayudar en la educación de sus hermanos.  José es un joven carismático con muchos deseos de triunfar y consolidarse en el comercio de productos naturales.
texts.en:
José is a young microentrepreneur, age nineteen, who started his business while he was serving in the military. He noticed that his superiors were consuming large quantities of products designed for nutrition and weight management, and spotting a business opportunity, he offered to sell these to them at good prices.


That was how his business got started, and today his customer base has expanded, thanks to the talks that he gives in which he explains the health benefits that are gained from the consumption of these nutritional supplements and complex vitamins. In addition, he offers a varied range of personal-care products.

Today he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that he is requesting, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. It is for the purchase of shakes, protein powders, vitamins, tea, medicated shampoos, soaps, and body creams, all of which have been ordered by his customers.

This investment will allow him to increase his profit margin, and with this, help with his brothers' education. José is a charismatic young man with a great desire to succeed and establish himself in the natural products business.

loans.use: to purchase shakes, protein powders, vitamins, tea, medicated shampoos, soaps, and body creams.

loans.name: Mélanie

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Mélanie est une femme vivante à Adidogomé. Agée de 25 ans, Mélanie achète des jouets et habits pour enfants une fois par mois au marché et les revendent dans sa boutique. Mélanie sollicite ce prêt pour commander des jouets et nounous afin de tiré profit et venir en aide à son mari aux diverse charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mélanie is married and has two children. She is a vivacious woman and is twenty-five years old.

Once a month, Mélanie buys toys and clothing for children from the market and then sells them in her shop. She has requested this loan to order more toys and cuddly toys. This should earn a profit which will be used to help her husband to provide for the various expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of toys and 1 sack of cuddly toys for resale.

loans.name: Naessa

texts.en: Naessa is 29, married and has one daughter. Her husband is a farmer and has no other source of income. Naessa started a small grocery store product to help her husband with the family income. She is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy some grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta to generate more income for her children.

loans.use: to buy some grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 50 years old, married and has 2 daughters and 3 sons. He has a small ironing services project and is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy a modern iron to provide a better service and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a modern iron so as to provide better service

loans.name: Miguel Orlando

texts.es: Miguel de 46 años maneja una amplia experiencia en negocios de consumo masivo al haber nacido en una familia de panaderos, él aprendió el manejo y administración de este tipo de negocios; sin embargo decidió que su vocación estaba más ligada a las tiendas de víveres y abarrotes.  En el año 2010 inauguró en un barrio del municipio de Bogotá, su tienda en la que ofrece un amplio surtido de productos que hacen parte de la canasta familiar; panes, harina, aceite, carne, café, legumbres, productos para el aseo y bebidas, en ella está disponible todos los días a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m., para que todos los residentes del sector puedan realizar sus compras.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir su negocio con víveres de primera necesidad; aceite, arroz, legumbres, pastas y demás.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio y seguir acompañando a sus padres y ofreciéndole la mejor educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 46, has plenty of experience running businesses for mass consumption. Having been born into a family of bakers, he learned to run and manage this kind of business, but he decided that his path was more along the lines of running grocery and general stores.

In 2010, he opened his store in a neighborhood in the city of Bogotá. He offers a broad assortment of common household goods, including breads, flour, oil, meat, coffee, vegetables, cleaning supplies, and beverages. The shop is open from 7:00am until 9:00pm so that everyone in the area can do their shopping.

He is currently applying for this loan from Kiva, his first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so that he can stock his business with necessary home goods, such as oil, rice, beans, pasta, and more. His goals for the future are to expand his business and to continue caring for his parents and providing his son with a good education.

loans.use: stock his grocery store with staple items like rice and oil

loans.name: Jose Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio, de 44 años de edad, es muy respetado en la comunidad porque es muy trabajador y muy religioso; actualmente vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 estudian y una señorita de 20 años de edad le ayuda con los quehaceres del hogar, su esposa además de realizar las labores del hogar, también hace productos derivados de la leche.  

Rogelio, siembra maíz y frijol como granos para subsidiarse, pero su actividad principal es la ganadería; tiene 6 vacas lecheras y es de ese rubro que mantiene a toda su familia, además de producir, también ayuda en la iglesia a preparar la misa, para que los creyentes puedan asistir.  

El dinero lo necesita para comprar una vaca más para su hijo, porque quiere que su hijo también tenga su propio ganado y así pueda prepararse para el futuro. 

Rogelio, quiere que sus hijos sean buenos ganaderos y que tengan su ganado propio, para que puedan trabajar en ese mismo rubro.
texts.en:
Rogelio, 44 years of age, is very respected in the community because he is very hard-working and very religious. At present, he lives with his wife and their four children, of whom three study while his eldest daughter, who is now 20 years old, helps with the household work. His wife, in addition to performing chores at home, also makes products derived from milk.

Rogelio grows corn and beans as basic grains to supply the family. But his principal activity is cattle raising. He has six milk cows and this is the type of work that maintains everyone in his family. In addition to being productive, he also helps to prepare the mass at church so that believers can attend.

Rogelio needs this loan to purchase another cow, intended for his son. He wants him to own his own cow and, thereby prepare for his future.

Rogelio wants his children to become good earners and to have their own incomes, so that they can work in this same calling.

loans.use: buy another cow for his son.

loans.name: Daniela Melissa

texts.es:
Daniela, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad y su pareja trabaja como entrenador de futbol.


Daniela, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa desde hace tres años, en donde vende productos de la canasta básica como arroz, frijoles, jabón, etc.

Daniela, necesita el crédito para surtir su negocio con otro tipo de productos como: golosinas, bebidas, pan, salsas etc. con los ingresos que tendrá de su negocio, podrá sacar su hijo adelante.

El sueño de Daniela, es que su hijo crezca con las condiciones necesarias y darle una buena alimentación y tener los recursos para que estudie.
texts.en:
Daniela is 23 years old. She went to school through high school. She is in a common law marriage and has a two year old son. Her husband works as a soccer coach.

For three years, Daniela has had a small store in her home in which she sells basic consumer goods such as rice, beans, soap, etc. Daniela needs a loan to stock her business with other types of products like candies, drinks, bread, salsas, etc. With the income from her store she will be able to give her child a better life. Daniela's dream is that that her child grow up with his basic needs met, and that she can provide him good food and will have the resources for him to go to school.

loans.use: to stock her business with other types of products such as candies, drinks, bread, salsas, etc.

loans.name: Piyelinawe

texts.fr: Piyelinawe est une femme célibataire qui habite à Tokoin avec un enfant à charge. Agée de 39 ans, Piyelinawe vend des bijoux pour subvenir à ses besoins. Pour s’approvisionner, Piyelinawe se rend deux fois par mois au marché. Piyelinawe sollicite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de colliers et de boucles d’oreille en vue de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir supporter ses charges quotidiennes  et de bien prendre soin de son enfant.
texts.en:
Piyelinawe is thirty-nine years old, single and lives in Tokoin. She is responsible for one child.

Twice a month, Piyelinawe travels to the market to buy supplies for her jewelry selling business. This business is how she earns her living. She will use her loan to order one dozen necklaces and one dozen pairs of earrings. Her profits will enable her to take care of her child and provide for their day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 1 dozen necklaces and 1 dozen pairs of earrings for her jewelry business.

loans.name: Afi Marie-Françoise

texts.fr: Veuve  de 42 ans, Marie-Françoise est une femme résidant à Tokoin avec ses deux enfants à charge. Marie-Françoise est une revendeuses des œufs qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au chez les grossistes et les revendent en circulant dans les quartiers environnant pour gagner ses revenus. Pour commander des plateaux d’œufs, Marie-Françoise nécessite ce fonds pour financer son achat  et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Marie-Françoise is forty-two years old and a widow. She lives in Tokoin with her two children and is responsible for providing for herself and her children. To do this, she sells eggs.

Three times a month she buys new supplies from wholesalers and then sells them on foot in neighbouring districts. Her loan will be used to buy more supplies and increase her profits so she can help her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy 90 units of eggs and 10 trays for her business.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is a 23-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been raising hogs for five years now. Her husband drives a motorcycle for income.
Renalyn works hard to earn a living through hog raising. This business provides her the income that she needs to cover expenses. This includes supporting a 4 year old daughter. 
Renalyn s asking for a loan from CEVI to buy feed for the pigs that she is raising. She will also use it to buy adhesive for the motorcycle and payment for land pledged for loaned money. She believes that if she will be provided support through loans, she will be able to improve her business to generate more income. Renalyn dreams of seeing her family experience the fullness of life and her daughter finishing college someday.

loans.use: to buy adhesive for motorcycle, feed for hogs, and payment for land pledged for loaned money

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza lives in Bohol, Philippines with her husband and four young children. She has been in the business of hog raising for eight years now. She also sells electronic load for mobile phones. 
Riza gives her best to provide financial support for her family. Her business provides her the income that she needs.
Riza wants to expand her business to generate more income but she needs funds. She is requesting loan to buy more piglets to raise, electronic load top up and food for her family.  With the loan, Riza will be able to make her business sustainable and productive.
Riza wants to earn more so that she will have the financial capacity to send her children to school. She believes that education is important for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy electronic load top-up, piglets and food for the family

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel is a 28-year-old fisherman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is married with two children, ages 3 and 5. For six years, Ronel has been engaged in fishing. This provides financial support for his family. He is asking for a loan to further invest in his business. He will use it to buy a new engine for his boat, thus maximizing his catch.
In the future, he plans to expand his fishing investment to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his fishing boat

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
For the last 20 years, Cesaria has earned a living by engaging in fishing. She sells fresh fresh to the locals in the community.

She is 44 year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest is 22 and the youngest is 11. Together with her family, she resides in Tubigon, Bohol.

Her husband has also an income that could help meet the family's daily needs.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials, like plastic screen. This will enables Cesaria to increase her catch and sell fresh fish. She could also be able to pay her obligations and start to expand her business.

In the future, Cesaria will do her very best to improve her livelihood that could support her family needs.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like plastic screen

loans.name: Rutchemae

texts.en:
Rutchemae is a 19-year-old married woman and a resident of Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has a two-month old baby girl.

She has been in the business of fishing for four years now. Her husband is a fisherman and she works hard to help support the family. The business is not always good, specially if the weather is not conducive to fishing, like if there is a typhoon and storm, but they persevere for their family’s sake.

She is asking for a loan of PHP55,000 to buy gasoline and a new fishing boat.

Rutchemae hopes that she could expand her ventures and earn a bigger income so she can provide for her child’s needs.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and a new fishing boat

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family. Michelle is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net.

Michelle has been in this business for 10 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net for her business

loans.name: Alberto Antonio

texts.es: Alberto es un empresario independiente de 74 años de edad que reside en el municipio de Soledad en el Departamento del Atlántico y diariamente dedica 6 horas a la distribución de hielo al por mayor a vendedores de guarapos, raspado y refrescos.  Él logró vencer el desempleo y la falta de oportunidades a razón de su avanzada edad, que no ha sido un impedimento para su microempresa, por el contrario su serenidad y experticia le permite gestionar excelentes negociaciones.  En estos tres años de funcionamiento ha logrado consolidarse y ampliar su base de clientes por lo cual está necesitando mayor capacidad para su negocio, para ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará un congelador para aumentar su producción de hielo. Alberto está completamente seguro que esta inversión será todo un éxito y que mejorará sus ingresos con los cuales continuará ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Alberto is a 74 year old independent entrepreneur. He lives in the municipality of Soledad in the department of Atlántico. He works six hours a day distributing ice wholesale to the vendors of sugar cane juice, shaved ice and soft drinks.

He managed to overcome unemployment and the lack of opportunities because of his age which has been no obstacle for his micro enterprise. On the contrary his calmness and expertise have allowed him to arrange excellent negotiations.

In his three years of operation he has managed to consolidate and expand his core of customers so that he needs a greater capacity for his business. So he is applying for his first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which he will use to buy a freezer to increase his production of ice. Albert is totally sure that this investment will be a success and improve his income so he can continue to provide well-being to his family.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to increase his production of ice.

loans.name: Darlinda

texts.en:
Darlinda is 51 years old and married with five children, with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Darlinda has been in this business for seven years.

In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Nora Margarita

texts.es:
Nora is a 48 years old divorce woman who has three children, two boys and one daughter. She lives with them in the municipality of El Santuario. Like she has to be the head of her family, she has to work extra hard to give to her children a good quality of life. She sells different kind of products like clothes, fragrances, and personal use stuff. 

She knows that being a mother is a job for a life time, so she needs that her work last in time and give her everything that she needs, so she wants that her business can be sustainable. She requests a loan to buy inputs like clothes, sneakers, lotions, and others. 

She’s aware that happiness can be found in the quiet and tranquility of a home, that’s the reason why she wants to improve hers, because it has some damages, with that she can offer a more comfortable and save house to her children. Help Nora accomplish this wish, a loan can do a lot for her.
texts.en:
Nora is a 48-year-old divorcee with three children, two sons and one daughter. She lives with them in the municipality of El Santuario. As she has to be the head of her family, she has to work extra hard to give to her children a good quality of life. She sells different kinds of products like clothing, fragrances, and personal care items.

She knows that being a mother is a lifelong job, so she needs her business to be sustainable so that it can provide her with everything that she needs. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as clothing, sneakers, lotions, and more for resale. She also knows that happiness can be found in the quiet and tranquility of a home, which is why she wants to improve hers. Currently, it has some damage, and by repairing it, she can offer her children a more comfortable and safe home.

Help Nora accomplish this wish; a loan can do a lot for her.

loans.use: supply her business with clothes, sneakers, lotions, and more

loans.name: Wendmi De Gouloure Group

texts.fr:
Mme WENDMI est la représentante du groupe WENDMI DE GOULOURE. Elle est  mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 16 ans et le moins âgé a 18 mois. 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charge.
Mme est vendeuse de céréales depuis 03 ans, et pratique aussi l'élevage. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle compte acheter  03 sacs d’arachide et 01 sac de mil.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande commerçante.
texts.en:
Wendmi is the representative of the 'Wendmi de Gouloure' Group. She is married and mother to five children. The eldest is sixteen and the youngest is eighteen months old. Two of her children attend school and she is responsible for a total of seven people.

Wendmi has been selling cereals for three years, she also rears livestock. She buys her supplies at a local market. She plans to use her loan to buy three sacks of peanuts and one sack of millet.

Wendmi would like to use her profits to pay for the education of her children. She hopes to become a successful trader in the future.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of peanuts and 1 sack of millet for resale.

loans.name: Suleyma Milagro

texts.es: Suleyma es una mujer tenaz que a sus 38 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir tales como gabachas y delantales, además gracias a su experiencia como costurera es muy solicita para elaborar prendas de vestir por encargo. Suleyma vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo desde hace 14 años, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con un lugar en el cual vivir. Suleyma desea invertir en materiales para continuar con su negocio, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: telas de colores, hilos, agujas, entre otros artículos necesarios para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Suleyma is a resolute woman, age 38, who makes garments such as smocks and aprons. Additionally, thanks to her experience as a seamstress, she receives many requests to make custom garments.

Suleyma has been living in her own house with her husband for fourteen years, so she feels happy that she has a place to live.

Suleyma wants to invest in materials in order to continue with her business, so she is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in colored fabric, thread, needles, and other items needed to improve her business.

loans.use: to invest in colored fabric, thread, needles, and other items needed to improve her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a 53-year-old woman from San Dionesio, Iloilo. She is married with one adult son. Her husband works hard as a farmer and a laborer while Ruth is running a sari-sari (variety) store business. She has been running this business for 20 years. Aside from this, Ruth and her husband own a rice farm which gives them additional income. Ruth needs capital to continue her business. She asks for a loan to buy grocery items such as liquor, soft drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and juice, biscuits, chips, candies and toiletries. She also wants to buy fertilizer for their rice farm. In the future, she dreams of being successful in her business for a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy liquor, soft drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and juice, biscuits, chips, candies, and toiletries for her store and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.fr: Veuve de 55 ans, Rebeca est une femme qui vit à Baguida avec deux enfants à charge. Rebeca est une marchande des laitues qui achète ses marchandises trois fois par mois dans les jardins environnant et les revendent à la devanture de son domicile. Rebeca sollicite ce crédit pour commander des choux, carottes et poivrons afin de réaliser un bon revenu pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en:
Rebeca is fifty-five years old and a widow. She lives in Baguida with two children for whom she is responsible.

Rebeca sells vegetables which she buys three times a month from local gardens. She sells her produce from the front of her house. She has requested this loan to order more cabbages, carrots and peppers and increase her earnings. This will be used to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 20 kilos of cabbages, 2 loads of carrots and 10 kilos of peppers for her vegetable business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 57-year-old woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has six adult children, and her husband is a farmer. Rosita has been in the hog-raising business for 15 years now. She also cooks snacks like pancakes to sell.

Rosita wants to improve her business but she needs funds to make it. She is requesting a loan to buy piglets, feed, and flour. With the loan, Rosita will finally be able to make her plans of expanding her business.

Rosita hopes to see her family live a bountiful life, and she believes that this would be possible if she will be provided with financial support through a loan.

Any additional revenue will be used to finance the family's daily consumption, savings, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and flour.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 58 ans, Afi est une femme qui habite à Tokoin. Avec quatre enfants à sa charge, Afi est une revendeuse des objets en plastique, des antiseptiques  et autres. Afi s’approvisionne  une fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route non loin de son domicile. Afi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sceaux en plastique et les antiseptiques afin de satisfaire parfaitement les attentes de ses clients et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir aux charges et besoins quotidiens de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi is fifty-eight years old and a widow. She lives in Tokoin and is responsible for four children. She sells plastic products, antiseptics and various other products. She buys her supplies once a month from the market and resells them at the side of the road, near her house.

Afi has requested this loan to order plastic buckets and antiseptics to respond to the demands of her customers. She expects to make a good profit and will use it to provide for the day-to-day needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy 35 boxes of antiseptic and 10 plastic buckets for resale.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi est une femme âgée de 60 ans qui vit à Baguida avec ses deux enfants à charge. Ablavi vend des perles pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants grâce aux bénéfices de son activité. Ablavi s’approvisionne et revend deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des perles poignés et colliers, Ablavi demande ce crédit pour financer son achat et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ablavi is sixty years old and lives in Baguida with her two children. She sells pearl jewelry to earn a living and provide for her children.

Twice a month, she buys new supplies from the market. Ablavi has requested this loan to order pearl bracelets and necklaces, earn a good profit and provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy 30 units of pearl bracelets and 6 units of pearl necklaces for her jewelry business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is a 63-year-old rice farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been farming for 30 years since her eight children were young. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. Elisa hopes that her crops will grow healthy with the help of the irrigation system and fertilizer from her loan. Her income will provide food for herself and her family as well as income for household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en: Jargal, a 28-year-old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a grocery store since last year. His wife is a nurse/midwife who works at a birthing center. Their son goes to kindergarten. He is requesting a loan of $2,000 to buy food stuffs in order to increase the working capital of his grocery store. By doing so, he will increase his income and will be able to afford to buy educational materials for his son.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs in order to increase the working capital of his grocery store.

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en: Densmaa, a 43-year-old, lives with her husband, two sons, and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She raises livestock and sells dairy products to local people. Her husband is a serviceman and works on his own. Their elder son studies at university, while their younger son will begin his schooling this fall. Their daughter goes to high school. She is requesting a loan of $2,000 to pay tuition fees for her daughter's high school. She is very concerned with her daughter's education and wants her daughter to study well.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is 50 years old and single. Porferia works very hard to provide for them.

Porferia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, seasonings, vinegar, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Porferia has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, seasonings, vinegar, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Porferia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, seasonings, vinegar, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hayam

texts.en: Hayam is 37, married and has 3 daughters and one son. Her husband is a laborer with a very small income, so she started a small grocery store project to help her husband with the family income. She is requesting 5000 EGP loan to buy some grocery products such as cheese, oil and pasta to generate more income for her family and meet her children's increasing needs.

loans.use: To buy some grocery products such as cheese, oil and pasta.

loans.name: Francisco Alberto

texts.es: Francisco de 29 años es un empresario independiente que ofrece servicio de transporte a los residentes de varios municipios en el Atlántico, con mayor incidencia en Malambo, Soledad y Sabanagrande.  Él inició esta actividad al considerar que en estas localidades el transporte es muy limitado y de difícil acceso para la comunidad de escasos recursos, siendo esta una oportunidad para iniciar su propio negocio y generar ingresos para su familia. Los moradores de estos municipios encuentran disponible sus servicios de transporte a partir de las 5 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m. todos los días de la semana, por lo que Francisco está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para realizarle mantenimiento a su vehículo y comprarle llantas nuevas.  Con esta inversión optimizara el desempeño de su vehículo y se mantendrá de acuerdo a las normas de seguridad vial.  Su meta a futuro es continuar creciendo para ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco, 29, is an independent entrepeneur who offers transport services to the residents of several areas in Atlántico, most often Malambo, Soledad and Sabanagrande. He started this work seeing that transport is very limited in these localities and difficult to access for people who cannot afford a lot. This is an opportunity for Francisco to start his own business and earn an income for his family.

The inhabitants of these areas will find his transport services available from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day of the week, which is why Francisco is asking for a Kiva loan, his first financing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. This loan will be used to carry out maintenance on his vehicle and buy new tires. With this investment he will optimise his vehicle's performance and conform to road safety standards. His goal in the future is to continue growing in order to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance and buy new tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Ciruela Group 2

texts.en: Margarita enjoyed playing as a child, but when she was  seven she had to take care of housework, go to the mill for dough for tortillas, and take care of her siblings. She is literate, twenty years old, married, and the mother of one child. To earn more income, her husband taught her how to make wicker baskets and she has been doing it ever since. She is applying for this loan to expand her production capacity by buying more wicker. Margarita leads the Ciruela Group 2, which is made up of nine women, seven of whom are ethnic Maya Ixil, and two of whom are Maya Quiché. Two thirds of this loan will go to agricultural activities, and one third to manufacture. The average amount of each loan is Q 2,144, the average age of the women is 31, each women has four children. and two thirds of the members are illiterate.

loans.use: to buy wicker to use for making baskets.

loans.name: Hoayda

texts.en: Hoayda is 22, married and has one son. Her husband works in wall pre-painting preparations. She has a small grocery store project which she started to help her husband with the family income. She is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy some grocery products such as cheese, pasta and oil to expand her project.

loans.use: to buy some grocery products such as cheese, pasta and oil.
